loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 51 years old and is married to Priscilla. The couple is blessed with two children, who both attend school. For the last six years, Julius has run a business operating public toilets and he earns a monthly income of 14,300 KES.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by organization staff. Julius is very hardworking.

Julius is requesting his second loan of 30,000 KES to bring water to his toilets. He has a good credit history with KADET and will use his anticipated profit to build more toilets. In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to bring water to the public toilets he operates

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muhawe, leader du groupe d’affaire «Zawadi », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 36  ans, mariée, mère de 7 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Elle est  sociétaire d’un restaurant-cafeteria.  Il y a  16 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  9eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 paniers de pommes de terre, 5 litres d'huile, 25 kg de farine, Fanta, 20 litre de lait, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Muhawe is the leader of the business group Zawadi. She is a 36-year-old entrepreneur who is married with seven young children, all in school. 

She runs a restaurant-cafeteria, and has been practicing small income-generating activities such as this for over 16 years. She just obtained her ninth credit from the Hekima MFI, and this new loan will allow her to purchase two baskets of potatoes, five liters of oil, 25 kg of flour, some Fanta, 20 liters of milk, etc. 

She wants her children to have a comfortable upbringing, and she would also like to expand her business. 

Muhawe wishes to thank Hekima for helping poor women who cannot turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase two baskets of potatoes, five liters of oil, 25 kg of flour, some Fanta, 20 liters of milk, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 37, is married to David, and they have four children aged 12, 10, 7 and 4 years old. For the past three years she has been selling hardware, earning a monthly income of KES 20,500.

Having repaid her previous loans, Agnes is now requesting her fourth one from KADET LTD. in order to purchase cement, paints and iron sheets. She will reinvest the additional profits back into her business. Her dreams are to have a stable income and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cement, paints and iron sheets for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is married and blessed with one child who is in school. She has been running a boutique to support her family. She has employed one person to assist her in the business. She has retained her business because of her hard work and determination. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel de 46, años se dedica a la venta de cosmético. Maria Isabel tiene 5 años de tener este pequeño negocio. Ella sale desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 6 la noche. Inicio este negocio, para obtener otros ingresos en la familia. Es por eso que necesita este crédito para invertir en la compra de crema, perfume bolsos, perfume, pintura de uñas, vanidad y otros. Maria Isabel quiere aprovechar esta época de navidad. Para obtener mejores ganancias
texts.en: Maria Isabel, age 46, sells cosmetics. She has had this small business for five years. She works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm. She started this business in order to make more income for her family. For this reason, she needs this loan to invest in the purchase of cream, perfume, bags, nail polish, and other items. Maria Isabel wants to take advantage of the Christmas season in order to make a better income.

loans.use: to buy cream, perfume, bags, nail polish, and other items.

loans.name: Nurses Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to introduce to you this group of nurses from one of the hospitals in Waterloo. Waterloo is a town very close to Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with us to start a branch. This staff, like other salaried workers, comes to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan. They use these loans to fix problems that their salaries cannot fix. At the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their finance officer is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayment on their behalf. 

Kadiatu is the leader of this group. The thirty-five year old was born in Makeni. She is married and has one child. Kadiatu has been a state registered nurse for few years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy some drugs and drips for sale in the hospital.

loans.use: to buy some drugs and drips for sale in their hospital.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 55 years old and married with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from dress making & vegetable vending. Alfreda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir is 42 years old and married with two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Zakir has more than 20 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle.

Zakir usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings 300 AZN income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered as very healthy and are present in everyday life.   

This is only one souce of financial income in his family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Zakir applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase three cattle, one milkier cow and fodder. This will be his fifth loan from AqroInvest and Zakir has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle, one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor (not shown in the photo; the man in the photo is Hor's husband) is 43, married, and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetable vendor. Her husband is a construction foreman. Two of her children are garment workers. 

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Hor is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like run a new business of buying rice to store and resell when the price is higher. Moreover, she plans to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julian pertenece al banco comunal “Fuente de Vida” y su actividad económica principal es la venta de carne de cordero, chancho, res, pollo, pescado y entre otros. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de cordero. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Julian is a member of the Fuente de Vida community bank.  He works selling meat such as lamb, pork, beef, chicken, fish, and others.  He has done this work for many years and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase lamb meat.  He is happy with the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase lamb meat.

loans.name: Main Dans La Main Group

texts.fr: MAIN DANS LA MAIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Chantal (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Seyni. Chantal a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Chantal et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de quinze ans que Chantal vend des tissus et des chaussures. Chantal exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Chantal sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAIN DANS LA MAIN, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des chaussures.

loans.name: Virgen De La O Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O YUCAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Teodora la socia continua con su negocio de venta de flores y plantas ornamentales, la socia continua sembrando estas flores y plantas para venderlo en las  diferentes  ferias, la socia lleva años dedicandose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera continua apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de ropa y negocio de venta de ganados,agricultura.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “VIRGEN DE LA O YUCAY” communal bank. This communal bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Teodora. She continues with her business of selling flowers and ornamental plants.  She continues to grow these flowers and plants in order to sell them at different fairs.  She has had this business for years.  It is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds.

The other members work in the business of  selling vegetables, selling in a grocery store, selling clothing, selling cattle, and agriculture.

Teodora is grateful to those who are part of this dream in this way.   She pledges to make the payments on the loan according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina, is a 26 year old woman. She is working at a store for few years ago and form her saving, she has initiated a kiosk business at home based for 3 months ago. When Dina goes to work, her sister would help her in managing the business. That business place is close to a school and it has regular customer who are mostly students. Recently,  Dina wants to improve her kiosk by selling more snacks and beverages but she needs more capital to make it real. Therefore Dina joined with another member and requested a loan of amounting IDR 1,750,000 from TLM and ready to realize her idea for her business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks and beverages

loans.name: Fredah

texts.en:
"This business is a member of the Revelations Women group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff"

Fredah is married with one child. She is an active member of Revelation Women Group .She is enterprising and multi skilled, she makes shoes, belts, dresses, trousers and shirts.

Fredah got her first loan from WEEC in 2004 of USD 150.
She started selling rice after resigning her job in a leather factory. Her wish was to own a business however small it was in order to be independent.
She sells over 200kgs per month earning her USD 71 as profit.
In addition, her tailoring business brings in extra income. She is to open up a bigger stall in thika town for easy merchandising.

loans.use: She plans to increase stock of rice as well as buy materials for ladies wear because they have ready market. Therefore, a loan of USD 300 will contribute to realizing her dream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE A DAIRY COW

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She sells onions at the market. She is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva to help her expand her sales.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dimitry

texts.en:
Dimitry is a hard-working taxi driver from the Ivano-Frankivsk region of Ukraine. For the last nine years he has driven thousands of kilometers transporting passengers all around the city and at times around the country. Dimitry owns his own car, but contracts with a taxi dispatching company called Radiotaxi 051. He is able to use a radio in his car to make his work more efficient. Dimitry started as a taxi driver because he was unable to find another good job. He makes about $30 in a typical day which is enough to support himself and his wife, Irina, and their five year old daughter.

Dimitry has requested a loan for $1200 to make some repairs to his car engine. One of the drawbacks to being a taxi driver is the potential for costly repair overhead. Eventually Dimitryi hopes to purchase a newer vehicle, but until that time this loan will help him keep his car running and out on the road.

loans.use: Dimitry would like to repair his car engine so he can continue as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena lives with her husband and two minor children in a rented home in the Villa Fatima neighborhood of La Paz. She has been selling children's shoes in a centrally-located and very popular retail district of La Paz for the past 15 years.

She needs this loan to purchase a greater variety and expanded inventory of shoes, as she's a very well known merchant and doesn't want to lose any clients.

Her credit history with IMPRO dates back to 2002 and identifies her as a qualified borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lorena vive en anticretico en la calle Final Tejada Sorzano de la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores; desde hace mas de 15 años se dedica a la venta de calzados de niños en la calle Huyustus, lugar comercial ubicado en una de las zonas mas populares de La Paz, donde se vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercadería y tener mas variedad de calzados para ofrecer a sus clientes, pues ella es muy conocida en el sector y no quiere perder clientela.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro data del año 2002 y la califica como muy buena cliente; en consecuencia ella puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

-

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Born in 1962, Regina is married and is a mother of six children, two of which are below 15 years of age.  As a caring wife and mother, she has always worked hard to support her husband and educate their children.  Motivated by other members, she decided to join GHAPE so she could obtain a business loan.

With a loan of $100, she plans to invest in the cultivation of yams, vegetables and corn which are all highly consumed food stuffs in the area.  She plans to sell these crops and raise money to support her husband in paying school fees for their children and to feed the family.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of corn seeds and yam setts

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
There’s a lot going on in this picture. In front is Regina with one of her daughters. She has a restaurant in Kyebando on the outskirts of Kampala. The banana leaves in the pot are simmering matooke, unripe bananas, which is the largest staple in the villager’s diet. To make matooke, get a big pot, put a little water in the bottom, buy a clump of green bananas still on the stem with maybe 100 bananas on the stalk. Everything gets used, so cut the stalk in slices and place in the bottom of the pot and cover with banana leaves. Now peel those green bananas and place them on top of the leaves and cover with more leaves, so that the heat doesn’t escape. Losing heat means wasting charcoal which costs money. Let it simmer for 3-4 hours, remove, mash and presto: matooke!

Behind Regina is her restaurant where the cooking is always done outside. After all that’s where the hubbub is and the cooking is done with charcoal. The restaurant is simple: benches, no tables, no cutlery, people eat with their hands. Behind Regina are a lot of people. When a reporting agent goes into the field, a crowd follows. It makes for great fun as the children always call our mazungu, meaning white person. This is a kind recognition and all smile and laugh.

Regina is 30 years old, single with three children and one dependent. She has operated her restaurant for 9 years on the busy pathway in her village. She is requesting a loan of $300, which she will use to expand her business. Regina dreams of one day building commercial houses to rent to villagers.

loans.use: To purchase matooke, rice, posho and cassava for a restaurant business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Since Mr. N. has known the craft of watchmaking/clockmaking, it has been his work. He worked out of his house, helping his wife with the household expenses, especially since she used to work at a company, earning a low salary. Unfortunately, destiny dealt Mr. N. a bad hand and he became widowed with two children and grandchildren in his care. In view of this situation, he decided to get a stand in the La Estación market. He did this to be able to obtain better wages, due to the fact that he only had a small customer base working out of his home, and make him confront the difficulty of his family situation.

He began the business in his home with savings from his job. To obtain the stand in the market, he asked for loans, which were granted to him. And nowadays, the stand is an enclosed booth that lends itself to the right conditions to be a successful operation.

With the loans obtained through Ceprodel, he has successfully improved his way of life, and is always continuing to move forward and get ahead for his family. In addition to increasing his business every day, he is currently beginning to sell phone cards and repair cell phones out of his stand, which is contributing to additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor N. desde que conoce el oficio de relojería se dedica a esta actividad en su casa, apoyando a su esposa en los gastos del hogar ya que trabajaba como en una empresa obteniendo bajo salario. Por cosas del destino el Sr. N. quedó viudo con dos hijos y nietos a su cargo, ante esta situación decide solicitar un tramo en el mercado La Estación para obtener mayor ingresos ya que en su casa la clientela era poca, para hacerle frente a la difícil situación de su familia.

Inicia el negocio en su hogar con ahorros de su trabajo y para acondicionar el tramo solicita créditos los cuales le han beneficiado por lo que actualmente el tramo es una caseta cerrada que presta las condiciones necesarias para la realización de esta actividad.

Con los créditos obtenidos por Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida, salir siempre adelante con su familia además de incrementar cada día su negocio, actualmente esta iniciando en el mismo tramo venta de tarjeta y reparación de celulares lo cual es un ingreso mas que esta generando.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ramona's Group

texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the neighborhood of San José, there is a group of women who meet on a weekly basis to discuss their problem of a shortage of resources along with ways in which to improve their small businesses. They have founded a program, the Committee of Woman Entrepreneurs to discuss their businesses. They are all looking for support and to better their quality of life of their families. In some cases they have even created more jobs for other people.

These women have been meeting for a couple of months now to discuss business plans and strategies. They thank the micro credit organizations that have made their business growth possible. These women are dependent on loans to increase the size of their businesses and become self sufficient. This group of individuals has created a system of checks on their payments. They rely on one another in order to make payments and come to meetings. They trust each other because they understand each other. Each woman is only trying to better her life and the life of her family.

loans.use: The majority of the women involved in the committee have invested their loans to buy goods for their businesses: linens, thread for sewing and embroidery.  Others buy clothes to sell as traveling saleswomen.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan has a small business at the central market in Khoost, Ukraine where he sells a variety of toys and plastic goods. His business is the main source of income for his family of three. Ivan and his wife, Oksana, have one son. Ivan has been in business for about eight years. The plastic products he sells are practical and can be used in every home. He currently makes about $200 in profit each month but would like to increase his income so he can better provide for his family.

Ivan has requested a five-month loan of $800 to increase his working business capital. We are happy for the opportunity to assist this goal-oriented husband and father with his business livelihood.

loans.use: Incrrease working capital

loans.name: José Candelario

texts.es:
Since his youth, José V. has been devoted to the agricultural and livestock business in the municipality of Congeda in the city of Estelí. He is a very responsible in his job, in his family life, and has managed to provide for his wife and three children who are all very dependent on his support.

Currently, he lacks the resources to buy livestock and harvest in staple grains. For this reason, he seeks a loan from CEPRODEL to reach his goal to buy cattle and bring in the highest profit that will improve his family's financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

José V. desde muy joven se ha dedicado al negocio de la agricultura y ganadería en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Es un caballero muy responsable en su labor y en su familia ya que ha logrado mantener a su esposa y a sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

Actualmente, la necesidad que atraviesa el señor V. es la urgencia de adquirir recursos económicos para la compra de ganado e inversión en la cosecha de granos básicos. Por esta razón solicita apoyo en CEPRODEL por medio de los créditos para lograr alcanzar su meta que es obtener el ganado (vaquillas) y sacarle el máximo provecho para la mejora de su situación y la de su familia.

loans.use: to invest in his agricultural business

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
I am a mother of six: four daughters and two boys. I live with my family in Faisalabad, a mid-size town in Pakistan. I sell embroidered scarves and shawls whereas my husband works at a local factory. I am very good at my work and want to expand my business.

Please also make small loans to my sub-group members: Saleema B. needs to buy a donkey for her son’s donkey cart. Ishrat A. is borrowing for her brother-in-law who runs a bakery. Sughran A. requires her share of our group loan to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, since she has enjoyed the company of her loved son, is very diligent in her farming and livestock related labors. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to improve her quality of life. She now desires to start breeding animals such as guinea pigs for export. She has prepared a room in her home for this end.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Adela, desde que goza de la compañía de su amado hijo, se desempeña con mucha diligencia en sus labores agrícolas y ganaderas, gracias a esto ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida y desea incursionar ahora en la crianza de animales de exportación como los cuyes en un espacio que ya acondicionó en su hogar para este fin.

loans.use: Infusion of capital to optimize the breeding of guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Mariam M.. She is married and has three children aged 7, 10, and 14. In 2007, Mariam opened a general store and requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soap, soda, juice, and matchboxes in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

Thus, SELFINA works for the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soap, soda, juice, and other items in bulk.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel is 25 years old, he is a young father with dreams of prosperity. He works hard as a driver of a “motocarro” (motorized 3 wheel cart). Him and his partner have a 1 year old girl, they hope that one day she has a profession. Victor Manuel wants to buy parts to fix his motocarro. With the money from his job he wants to fix his house, he requests a loan with the promise to repay it on time and he thanks in advance for the attention you give to his request.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Víctor Manuel, de 25 años es un joven padre con muchos sueños de prosperidad, por eso es que trabaja arduamente, él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es chofer y propietario de un motocarro. Él y su pareja tienen una niña de 1 añito de edad, que esperan más adelante sea una profesional.Víctor Manuel quiere comprar repuestos para su motocarro para luego mandarlo a reparar. Con las ganancias de su labor como transportista desea arreglar algunas estructuras de su vivienda, por ello que solicita en presente préstamo con la promesa de cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos, y agradece de ante mano la atención a su pedido.

loans.use: Purchase parts to fix his motorcycle and transport passengers.

loans.name: Davlatbubi

texts.ru: Исломова Давлатбуби жительница города Вахдат. Замужем , имеет пятерых детей. 15 лет как уже занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке города. Сама живет в кишлаке. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Наценки ставит небольшие , поэтому у нее много клиентов. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы привезти осенне-зимнюю одежду. Это поможет удовлетворить спрос покупателей , а так же ей самой заработать  в сезон. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davlatbubi I. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is married and has five children. She has been in the retail business for the last fifteen years. She has her own vending space in the central town market. She lives in the village. Davlatbubi brings in the merchandise from Dushanbe. Her prices are not too high and this is why she has a lot of customers. She wants to get a loan to buy clothes for the fall-winter season. This will help to satisfy the demands of her customers and also earn good profits during the season. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Mrs. Pheng S. was born in 1967 and now lives in Khvet Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a single, female farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Pheng S. now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Nubia Elvira

texts.es:
La Sra. Nubia tiene 43 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, casada y con tres hijos mayores de edad de 18, 22, y 28 años, los cuales ya trabajan y apoyan en los gastos, su esposo trabaja independiente como albañil y abecés también trabaja por contratos es un trabajo que desgasta físicamente pero genera buenas ganancias. Doña Nubia su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos tiene cinco años de experiencias en las ventas, e inicio con fondos propios para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos hasta ahora le ha ido bien, pero desea surtir mas el negocio, con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la compra de mercadera de ropa y zapato, comprar variedad de estilo para grandes y chicos.
A largo plazo es crecer en su negocio, y poder vender otros productos a si como captar más clientes, y  ayudar a sus nietos con su educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nubia is 43-years old and lives in the South Laureles neighborhood of the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is married with three children of the legal age of 28, 22 and 18-years old, who are already working and helping with the family expenses. Her husband is an independent mason who works on contracts that are physically straining but generate good profits. Mrs. Nubia has five years of experience in her business of selling clothes and shoes, that she started with her own funds and with the help of her husband they have managed their expenses well, though she desire to gain more business. With this loan request Mrs. Nubia will invest in the purchase of clothing and shoe stores and purchase a variety of styles for adults and children. In the long term, she would like to grow her business and be able to sell other products to attract more clients. Also, she would like to help her grandchildren with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for children and adults

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara C. is an entrepreneur from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She is a divorced mother of five children. Her children are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. 

She is the only breadwinner in her family. She has a business selling women's national dresses and trousers. She has her stand in the famous local market, “Inom.” 

Gulsara is very hard-working woman. She always achieves all her goals and overcomes difficult challenges with her natural optimism. 

She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 4 months. She will use the loan to re-stock her inventory. She hopes to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale. 

Gulsara's only dream is to ensure her children have a good education and to make them happy. We believe Gulsara’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture over past years can guarantee further expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment. The well being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase women's national dresses and trousers

loans.name: Yunusjon

texts.en:
Yunusjon M. is a farmer and has been working the land during the past 4 years. There are 7 people in his family, including his wife, 3 children and 2 parents, all of whom are his responsibility. Educated through secondary school, he farms as his principal business activity, something he had formal training in. And it has done the trick for him financially.

In the picture you can see his wife, as Yunusjon himself wasn’t at his home the day of our visit. Due to the upcoming season he needs to grow wheat, onions, and corn. This requires money and he does not have enough. And so he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 8 months to stock up on seeds and fertilizer for a successful harvest. The income will allow him to take better care of his children's health, nourishment, and schooling.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced and has one child. She sells curtains and accessories at Image Market in Beregovo city. Her monthly gross income is 20,000 UAH; the profit is about 5,000 UAH per month.

Svetlana started this business 8 years ago. She was lucky to choose this type of goods to sell, because she had very little competition then and even now the competition is low. This gives Svetlana a good opportunity to make her living. Svetlana is a kind and hard-working person. She treats her clients well and has a desire to develop her business even more.

Svetlana would like to receive a loan of 1,000 USD to increase her inventory. Additional capital would allow her to offer a better assortment of curtains and serve even more clients.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo trabaja como chofer asalariado en el Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa de Trufi inter ciudad La Paz – El Alto. Esta actividad de chofer es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus seis hijos de 12, 10, 8, 6, 5, y 2 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para poder completar el monto que le falta para la compra una movilidad a medio uso y de esa forma trabajar como dueño de su propio taxi e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Aldo works as a driver in the Eduardo Avaroa de Trufi inter-city union of La Paz. His job as a driver is his principal means of income with which he covers the care of his six children of 12, 10, 8, 6, 5 and 2 years of age, respectively. He rents a house located in the Pasankeri zone of the city La Paz. He will use the loan money to be able to complete the amount he lacks to buy a car. Then he will be able to work as the owner of his own taxi and will allow him to increase his household income. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation has granted him the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi to work as his own boss

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 28 years old and married without children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Her husband is a commercial driver. Joy sells provisions and cosmetics, something she has done for a long time. Joy hopes for a loan to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Olinda Lucinda

texts.es:
RAMÍREZ D. GARCÍA OLINDA LUCINDA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. José Gálvez N° 120 ed distrito D. Yarinacocha, tiene 66 años, 02 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo independiente.

Ella se ha dedicado al servicio D. alquiler D. cuartos por eso el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invirtió en refaccionar un cuarto con el que pudo tener un ingreso para cubrir sus letras. 

Como vio que es rentable el alquilar cuartos, ella ha decidido refaccionar mas cuartos.
Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500. Nuevos Soles, podrá refaccionar más cuartos para darle el acabado y seguridad que necesita para estar en optimas condiciones para dar en alquiler.

Por el momento se encuentra muy contenta con Manuela Ramos y espera seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Olinda belongs to the Las Alemendras ("The Almonds") Community Bank. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha, is 66 years old, has two children, and her spouse has an independent job. She is dedicated to renting out rooms. As a result, her first loan of 300 Soles was invested in the remodeling of a room with which she was able to have income to cover her bills. Since she has seen that renting rooms is profitable, she has decided to repair more rooms. With this loan of 1,500 Soles, she will be able to remodel more rooms in order to give them the finish and security that is needed to be in optimal conditions for renting. For the moment, she is very happy with Manuela Ramos and hopes to continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will serve to remodel rooms that will be rented.

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan Q. is a poor and vulnerable person. He is fifty years old and lives with his wife and five children. Khasan has a small grocery store and sells foodstuffs. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase its daily turnover. That's why Khasan has applied for a loan of $1200. This loan will allow him to buy a larger supply of goods for re-sale and to better provide for his family. With the money he saves he hopes to be able to provide his children with a better education. With your help he’ll be able to realize his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: Buy a larger supply of goods

loans.name: Kikiafu 1 Achi Prossy Group

texts.en: Prossy A. is 34 years old and married a 14 year old daughter, who is going to school. Prossy will use this loan to improve her business selling used clothes, specifically ladies skirts, blouses, and dresses. She has been in her business for over five years. She is hardworking and encouraging, and believes she will see a change in her business.

loans.use: To improve her business selling used clothing.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia FRANCISCA, nació y vivió toda su vida en el distrito D. Ollantaytambo en la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 1:40 minutos D. la misma ciudad.

Nuestra socia es casada, tienen 57 años D. edad, tiene 4 hijos todos ellos mayores y con sus respectivas familias, ella ahora está solicitando el préstamo para poder ayudar a su hija Maritza a implementar su negocio en el mercado central D. venta D. desayunos y almuerzos, ella quiere apoyar a su hija que es madre soltera y ambas vender sus comidas en el mercado central, para lo que nuestra socia requiere el préstamo.

La socia Francisca está muy agradecida con el apoyo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Francisca has lived her whole life in the district of Ollantaytambo in the province of Cusco, located 1 hour and 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is married, 57 years old, and has four children who are all grown and have their own families. She is requesting a loan so that she can help her daughter Maritza to run her breakfast/brunch business in the central market. She wants to support her daughter, who is a single mother, by selling food together with her in the central market. She requests a loan to enable her to do that. Francisca is very grateful for the support offered and she promises to repay her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her daughter's breakfast/brunch stand

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito S. is from the village of Kinangay, Norte Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is fifty-eight years old and married with three grown children. To make a living, Paquito owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paquito has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately $23 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Paquito joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Paquito has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan to purchase additional products to sell in his "sari-sari" or general store. This loan will be his fourth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve his business and to meet his family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khuseynali

texts.en:
Khuseynali A. is 53 years old and married with five children. He is a cattle breeder. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. At the same time he raises cattle at his house.

Khuseynali’s wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: To expand his irrigation system

loans.name: Lesaoai

texts.en:
Lesaoai S., 37, is married with five children.  She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala. 

SPBD loans are Lesaoai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Part of the loan will be used to purchase sacks of cement and iron roofing for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase wire for fencing, Gramoxone herbicide, pesticides, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, cement and iron roofing

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 31 years old. She is married woman with three children and currently all her children attend school. She sells frozen foods like chicken, mutton, fish, meat, etc. at the local market. She travels to Kumasi to purchase her supplies of goods from the importers. She makes sure she buys only what she can afford. She has realized that her capital is not sufficient enough to meet the demands of her customers. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase additional cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork and meat to enable her to expand her business. It is her dream to give her children an education and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton etc.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette A. is from the village of Gala, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Jeanette is single. To make a living, Jeanette owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jeanette has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jeanette joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanette has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jeanette from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shujaa Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the shujaa borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 45 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 33,31,27, and 20 years.

Elizabeth started her own shop business selling rice,wheat,sugar,cooking oil etc 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Elizabeth second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Elizabeth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Fatuma,Monica are also the member of the same borrower group,they also requested the loan in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mill to grind spices.

loans.name: Motalib

texts.en:
Motalib S. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 44 years old. Motalib is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Motalib owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail shop. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling video compact discs and others products like cell phone accessories in the local community. Motalib has been operating his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Motalib joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Motalib is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items and expand his product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Motalib from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of his family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items and expand his product offering

loans.name: Sein

texts.en:
Sein S., 26, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She and her husband are traditional singers who typically make US$5 each day. Both of them have been performing in the arts sector since they were young.

Sein S. is asking for loan of US$1200 to make a new investment. Her husband needs to operate a moto-taxi (passenger-carrying motorcycle) to help improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a moto-taxi for her husband

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia S. is from the village of Owaon. She is 49 years old. Lilia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates an agricultural business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years, with approximate average monthly earnings of 1,900 PHP for these activities.

In 2006, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets, livestock feed, and other supplies. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, livestock feed, and other supplies

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
65-year-old Erma B. is still fighting against poverty and time as she works to change her family's standard of living. Being the sole provider for her two children, whose ages are 24 and 26, she sees no reason to give up the fight, although she was disappointed with her children’s educational attainment.

She sometimes thinks of herself as not being responsible enough in attending to the financial needs of her children so that they could be able to graduate from college and have a better career for themselves. Still, Erma wants to make use of her remaining capacity and time in running a business and making it sustainable for her children to take over when she is gone.

Through loans she has requested since her membership in ASHI until the present, Erma tries to achieve her goal for the business little by little. Patiently, with ASHI and Kiva to support her, she is determined to wait for her dream to come true.

loans.use: To purchase common commodities to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora L. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga. She is 28 years old. Flora is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a mini-restaurant in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Flora is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP to expand her business. This will be Flora's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi has owned a phone sales shop in his town since 2005, and has 7 years of experience in this field. He's 26 years old.

He plans to enlarge his business, and that's why he is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more phones and phone accessories so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To buy more phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Yesu Nkoa Group

texts.en: Felicia is thirty-eight years old. She is a wife and a mother of two children who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who sells smoked fish and food items. Felicia is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into her business to scale up progress. She is the leader of a village trust bank group called “Yesu Nkoa” (Jesus alone). All the members are engaged in trading. They work so hard to put food on the table of their households and also to support their kids in school. They believe the loan will help them to be more resourceful to purchase food ingredients and stock in bulk. In time, they will be better able to serve their customers. They believe your support would enable them to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase food stuff and other stock.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka S. is 27 and married with 4 children (ages 1 month - 6 years).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Eka has 7 years of experience in this business.  Eka needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 tala or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Eka joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Eka's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Eka S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.56 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.89 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.99 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is involved in rice farming. She shares that it is really tiring to work at the farm but because she and her husband are together in this, she finds it comforting to know that they both support each other all the time. They have two children whom they want to have a bright future.

Mercedes joined CEVI to have financial assistance for her business. She would like to request a loan of PHP 6,000, which she will use for the farm. She will purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nuevo Horizonte” se formó con la unión varias vecinas  de la ciudad de San Antonio. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable. 
La Sra. Maria M. realiza trabajos de repostería sobre pedidos, para cumpleaños, quince años, bodas y otros acontecimientos, ella trabaja de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedidos que ella recibe de sus clientes actualmente ella hace sus trabajos o panaderías por que requiere de sus ingredientes en cantidad mayor y por ello agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado para cada una de ellas.

texts.en:
The committee "Nuevo Horizonte" ("New Horizon") was formed by a group of neighbors in the city of San Antonio. All the members of the committee perform indepedent activities, such as sales. The members have formed a very united group capable of realizing activities together, so now the majority of the members work in sales together as colleagues. All the members of the committee are mothers who work developing sustainable businesses in order to support their households. Mrs. Maria M. is a baker, baking items to order for birthdays, quinceañeras, weddings, and other events. She works according to the number of orders she receives from her clients. She herself bakes the goods or has bakeries do it because the orders require ingredients in large quantities. She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the loan given to each one of the committee's members. 1. Maria M., bakery 2. Digna G., clothes sales 3. Dolores R., clothes sales 4. Dorotea J., kiosk 5. Digna C., cosmetics sales 6. Dora O., sports pool/lottery sales 7. Zunilda C., sports pool/lottery sales 8. Nancy D., beverage sales 9. Zeneida D., snack sales 10. Cirila S., food coupon sales 11. Edelina Alfonzo, baking 12. Mabel C., clothing sales 13. Teresa M., food sales 14. Rosalina G., food coupon sales 15. Ruth A., fruit sales 16. Nancy R., clothing sales 17. Maria E., baking 18. Candida A., cosmetics sales 19. Lucia A., sports pools/lottery sales

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for baking like sugar, butter, eggs, and utensils

loans.name: Survivor Group

texts.en:
Eleanor D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Survivor. She is 32 years old and married with three children, ages 2, 5, and 9. Her oldest child is in the 5th grade, and her next oldest child is in the 2nd grade. Eleanor also helps care for two of her aunts.

Eleanor's business is making and selling tie-dyed clothes, something she's been doing for four years. She says she started her business with 500 LRD in seed money, and now she operates with 6000 LRD in working capital. She says her enterprise is a success. She also says that she faces difficulty when she allows customers to buy on credit, and they don't pay her back promptly. Eleanor sells the clothes she creates at the Chicken Soup Factory Market in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

With her 15,000-LRD share of this 95,000-LRD group loan, Eleanor intends to buy more materials to make tie-dyed clothes. She says the colors of her clothes are nice, which is what keeps her customers coming back. She hopes to provide the means for all her children to get a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Eleanor is the one holding the sign. Ophelia S. is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socioeconomic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and LEAP puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy materials for making tie-dyed clothes

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald D. is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old and is single. Ronald works in a business operating motor transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ronald joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mercedes está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora María Lourdes M. quien inicio hace cinco años con 900 córdobas vendiendo chiverías, gaseosas, helados y fresco.  Actualmente su negocio ha crecido según comento  por medio de los préstamos ya que ha podido surtirla con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Salís S. Gaitán quien vende ropa desde hace siete años y Marcelina Justina G. vende tortillas, compra cosechas de tamarindo.
Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios en mercadería para que crezcan y prosperen.
texts.en:
The Mercedes group is composed of three, hard-working people. One of them is María Lourdes Mendoza who, five years ago, invested 900 córdobas to start selling yoghourt snacks, soft-drinks, frozen treats and frozen fruit juices. Currently, her business has grown through the loans because she’s been able to stock it with more variety and quantity of products. Her fellow group members are Salís S. Gaitán, who has sold clothes for the last 7 years, and Marcelina Justina González, who sells tortillas and buys tamarind crops. They will use the funds for merchandise so that their businesses will grow and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soap, meat, detergent, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Sofia es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Sofia junto a su esposo tiene carros con los cuales realiza transporte de pasajeros, Sofia se encarga de la administración.
Sofia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de su carro.
Los sueños de Sofia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sofia is a member of the communal bank "Villa Huatatas." Sofia is married, 35 years old, and has two children. She lives with her husband, who has cars that he uses to provide public passenger transportation services. Sofia is in charge of managing the business. Sofia needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the maintenance of her car. Sofia dreams of having her children become professionals and succeeding with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for car maintenance

loans.name: Mujeres Con Esperanza 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Lora is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Con Esperanza (Women With Esperanza), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Lora’s group is located in the urban slums that surround Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and four children.

Lora is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small cafeteria by purchasing sausages, bread, ketchup and mayonnaise as well as two glass display cases.

Lora will use the profits to reinvest in her business by moving it out of her home into its own location. Additionally, she plans to make repairs to her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more sausages, bread, ketchup and mayonnaise as well as two glass display cases

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio forma parte del banco comunal “L. Unión D. Ollantaytambo”, tiene 47 años y vive en Ollantaytambo. Gregorio y su esposa Sabina tienen un negocio familiar D. venta D. palomitas D. maíz D. forma ambulatoria, sabina venD. las palomitas D. maíz en bolsas D. plástico y venD. a 0.50 soles. Ya son diez años que se dedica a negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Gregorio es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, él requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y desea comprar más maíz. El anhelo del socio es comprar una carreta para vender las palomitas D. maíz. 
        
El socio se encuentra agradecido por L. oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gregorio belongs to the L. Unión D. Ollantaytambo Communal Bank. He is 47 years old, and he lives in Ollantaytambo. Gregorio and his wife, Sabina, have a family business selling popcorn as street vendors. Sabina sells popcorn in plastic bags for 0.50 soles. He has been in the business for ten years. It is going very well for him, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Gregorio is a hard-working and enterprising person. He always looks for opportunities to get ahead. With his daily effort he is looking to give his children a better future. He needs the loan to invest in his business; he wants to buy more corn. His wish is to buy a cart to sell the popcorn. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his business by purchasing corn

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 63 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Lolita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lolita has been involved in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta D. is from the village of Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is a 59-year-old widow and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Restituta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, cinderblocks, window frames and glass, and skilled labor.

loans.name: Sokea Kham Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sokea K., who was born in 1989, is a married man and was selected as village bank president by the twenty-one members of the loan which is located in Tranh village, Kandal province. The members of this village loan will use the money to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.

Mr. Sokea K. is a farmer who works very hard to support his family. For this farm, he will use the loan that he has requested from AMK to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, he is also a construction worker while his wife, Mrs. Sokrat Duong, is a seamstress in a garment factory. With their occupations they are able to earn a small income to support the family. This couple has a child, age 3, who is not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derick is a 30-year-old member of Neema group in Faulu Kenya. Since he joined the group, he has become more focused in his business selling cereals. He started the business four years ago after leaving his job.

Derick has requested 20,000 KES to buy more cereals. He hopes to expand his business and open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh T. N. is  43 years old with 2 children who are in high school. She has opened a furniture workshop for where she makes tables, chairs, beds and wardrobes. Her workshop is  always busy with contracts. Each month Tinh earns 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in Seda's credit program since 2004 and has used loans very effectively in running her business. Currently,Tinh needs to borrow 8,502,000 VND to purchase wood.

loans.use: To purchase wood for furniture making.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is a 35-year-old single woman. She has no children and lives with her sisters in Morope, a commercial district within the region of Lambayeque.

Felicita has worked as a fish vendor in the Tucume market for the last 8 years. She purchases her fish daily from the bulk dealers who come to the city in the morning. This saves her the time and cost of travelling to the coast where the fishermen live. She hopes to be able to use this loan to purchase a greater quantity of fish in order to get a better discount and increase her profit margin.

Additionally, Felicita raises animals in the yard behind the home she shares with her sisters. The family raises these animals on rice chaff and local grasses until they are large enough to sell for their meat.

Felicita currently has no loans outstanding and has good references within the community. She is a very hardworking woman and has a very strong and supportive relationship with her sisters. She wants to continue to support her household and improve the famly's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of fish

loans.name: Peter Kuria

texts.en: Peter has farmed in Njabini town for the last three years.  He is 49 years old, married to Mary Wanjiku and they have three  children. He heard about KADET through the field staff and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan to buy another dairy cow which will increase his milk output for his customers who are increasing daily.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Azinafa

texts.en:
Azinafa has been practicing mixed farming for the last eighteen years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables which are all sold locally. She also earns income from her business of selling fish to the local market. 

She is 50 years old and married with 6 children who are all adults. Her youngest child is currently attending school.

She recently repaid her fifth loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 50,800 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand her poultry farm. By adding another dairy cow and expanding her poultry farm, she hopes it will increase her income which in turn will enable her pay college fees for her children. 

Her biggest challenges have been fluctuation in the market prices of products and the high cost of poultry feeds. She hopes to set up a zero grazing unit in the future so that her animals can be well catered for. She also hopes to acquire a high-breed dairy cow in the future. 

She comments that Juhudi loans have benefited her very much. She also gives a thumb up for the current efficiency in terms of loan processing.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow, and expand her poultry farm.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida T. is from the village of Canitoan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Adelaida is single and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods and instant noodles in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a forty two year old man living in a mud wattle house with five children in Fort Portal Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after seven of his house hold members and his family dream is to have an income generating activity that provides an assured daily income. He is a farmer and deals mainly in cassava. He has been in business for five years and earns tangible profits. Francis needs the loan to buy more cassava  to sell

loans.use: Buying cassava for sale

loans.name: Sel-Mar Group

texts.es: La foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Sagrario,una integrante D. grupo SEL-MAR que está ubicada en el estado de veracruz, en México. En la foto se ve al grupo de señoras alrededor de su mercancía, Sagrario tiene una papelería que inicio hace 3 años,solicita el prestamo para abastecer su negocio con nuevos productos,al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta y satisfecha,tiene 37 años y estudió la preparatoria,es casada y tiene 3 hijos,una mujer y dos varones,quiere este crédito para abastecer su negocio con nueva mercancía,también espera aumentar sus ventas y comprar una copiadora.Selma es la presidenta D. grupo,tiene 22 años,estudió hasta la preparatoria,es soltera y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y calzado que inicio hace 4 años,solicita el prestamo para surtir pedidos, el grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y retomó el nombre de la señora Selma para crear el de SEL- MAR.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Sagrario's home.  Sagrario is a member of the SEL-MAR group which is located in the State of Veracruz, in Mexico.  In the photo you can see the group of ladies surrounding their merchandise.  Sagrario has a stationery store that she set up 3 years ago.  She is requesting a loan so that she can stock her business with new products.  As she requests this loan, she is feeling very happy and satisfied.  She is 37 years old and has her high school certificate.  She is married and has 3 children: one daughter and two sons.  She would like this loan to stock her business with new merchandise.
