4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10117110022) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 7.194.000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop.


5.  Hoàng Thị L. (10117110020) is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 7.194.000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Trần Thị (10117110018) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xóm Thượng 11 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán thịt heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2003, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.750.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.886.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Vương Thị T. (10117110039) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt.


2.  Hoàng Thị T. (10117110023) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.194.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  Hoàng Đình M. (10117110021) là 49 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.194.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10117110022) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.194.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt.


5.  Hoàng Thị L. (10117110020) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.194.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy C.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling green bananas in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Catubac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. Nancy has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Nancy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena se dedica a la producción de queques, tortas, empanadas, estos productos los comercializa en las tiendas y también a través de  personas a quienes entrega sus productos en consignación, las cuales  venden en las ferias y mercados.

Vive en alquiler, la casa queda ubicada en la calle Huancane de la Zona de Villa Fátima Provincia murillo de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Es Divorciada, tiene una hija la cual se encuentra en el País de Chile por razones de estudio.

El crédito lo destinará para compra de harina y otros insumos para la elaboración de productos de repostería y así mejorara sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Elena makes pastries, cakes, and empanadas. She sells them in stores and also through people who she gives her products to on consignment. They sell them at fairs and markets. She lives in a rented house on Huancane Street in the Villa Fátima area in the Murillo province of the city of La Paz. She is divorced. She has a daughter who in the country of Chile for her studies. The loan is to buy flour and other supplies to make her pastries and improve her income. This is her second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making the pastries she sells

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: A. Jeanne est née le 27 Mars 1956, et vit depuis neuf ans à Dandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à HOUENOUVI Christophe, Jeanne est mère de six enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Jeanne n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Jeanne vend de la nourriture (mélange de riz et de haricot, accompagné de la friture) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Jeanne s’approvisionne. Jeanne a sept ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Jeanne a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, et a bien remboursé le crédit. Jeanne sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
A. Jeanne was born on March 27, 1956 and has lived for 9 years at Dandji, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. Married to HOUENOUVI Christophe, Jeanne is the mother of 6 children. Some of her children are enrolled in school. Jeanne lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting the household.

Jeanne only went to primary school. To support herself, she sells cooked food (a mixture of rice and beans, accompanied by fries) out of her house. She buys her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Jeanne has seven years' experience in this business. She has received a prior loan from ALIDé, and she reimbursed it correctly. She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, to bolster her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase rice, beans, and condiments (tomatoes, onions, peppers)

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
S. is 58 years of age and lives in Siem Reap province. She is the mother of seven children: the oldest two are married and live separately, the second two are single and work with Saroun in her business, and the last three are students. Her husband’s name is Aiy and he earns a living fishing along the Mekong river. S. gets up early every morning to gather the fish from her husband and other fisherman in bulk and then hurries them to the market. Along with her fish sales, she also feeds many ducks, which she then will sell. 

S. requests her second loan to purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to study or work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is an entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a business of selling maize flour in wholesale to her customers at Yombo Kiwalan in Dar es Salaam. She purchases maize from the wholesale business entrepreneurs and makes it into maize flour which she packs into different sized bags. She sells to wholesalers and retail customers. She has been in the business for five years. The business income helped her to construct her own house, paying school fees for her children and meeting her family's daily demands. She needs a loan of TZS 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 32-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children, has owned a barber shop since 2000. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. He decided to work as a hairdresser because he had gained experience in his previous work. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him to purchase tools for his work as well as improve his barber shop. Ali is now requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an electric motor and a washing chair for his salon.

loans.use: To purchase an electric motor and washing chair for his salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tuwezeshane Group

texts.en:
Bakari M. is 34, married and has three children ages 8, 5 and 2. He runs a small business selling vegetables and fruits which he opened 10 years ago. He works from 5 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make monthly profit of about $207

This will be Bakari’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to build a small house and increase the stock of items he has to sell. He succeeded in repaying his previous loans, and plans to use the new one to continue to expand his business.

Bakari will share this loan with the other six members of his group, which is called Tuwezeshane. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To increase the stock of items he has to sell his customers

loans.name: Syvita Group

texts.en: Esmatullah is the group leader of 'Syvita' group. Esmatullah is married and the father of 5 children. He lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his elderly father and mother. He wants to take a loan for his business of general store. He has been involved in this business for more than 4 years and now he wants to buy more foods and some needed tools for his general store and wants to expand and progress his business and help his family. He is very happy with this small loan process in Afghanistan that helps poor people.

loans.use: Buying more foods for his shop

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
En 2008, ce monsieur a ouvert sa propre boutique de vente des articles de quincaillerie qu’il a appelé « ETS ENERGIE AFRICA », il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.il n’a jamais obtenu du crédit chez WAGES, il sollicite sont premier crédit pour gonfler son stock avec divers articles de mercerie.sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
il est marié et  a un enfant.
texts.en:
In 2008, this gentleman opened his own store selling hardware items. He calls his little shop « ETS ENERGIE AFRICA », and he buys his stocks in the big open-air market of Lomé. He has never had a loan from WAGES, and so he is requesting his first to bolster his stocks of various drygoods items. His clientele is composed of all sorts of people. He is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various hardware items

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en:
Eva G. is from the town of Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Eva is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Eva G.'s group.

Eva is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. Eva is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Eva from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vuthy S. is a CD and VCD seller who owns a small store to support her business. She is 49 years old. Her husband, Mr. Sok M., is an ambulance car driver who earns a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is employed in a private company. 

Mrs. Vuthy S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, consisting of 18 people from Preak Cheang Prom village in Kandal province. Each member of this village bank will use their loan for different purposes. In order to enlarge her business, Mrs. Vuthy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more CDs and VCDs.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and VCDs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina R. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 71 years old, is widowed, and has nine adult children. Regina owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 19th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old. He is married with 3 children ages, 8, 10, and 12 years old. All the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for 10 years and has 2 employees. His products are maize, milk and tomatoes which he sells on the local market. He also owns some rental houses and a retail shop in the same area.

His major challenges in farming have been the lack of steady markets for his produce and the high cost of labour.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow, after successfully completing a previous loan of 45,000 KES. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production and earn the family enough income.

In future, Peter would like to increase the number of his dairy cows and build more rental houses to increase the family income.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David L. C. tiene 47 años y vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona Tabladita del Barrio Méndez Arcos de la ciudad de Tarija. David es casado con la señora primitiva Oña Ramírez de 45 años de edad con quien tiene 5 hijos. David se dedica a trabajar como albañil desde hace más de 20 años teniendo obras en diferentes puntos de esta ciudad.   
                        
David quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su familia pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar más herramientas de trabajo. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado a la compra de más herramientas, para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.      
                                                                                                                                                                                                 David nos cuenta que quiere darles a su esposa e hijos toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
David is 47 years old and lives at his in-laws house in the Tabladita zone of the Mendez Arcos district, in the town of Tarija. David is married to Primitiva Oña Ramirez who is 45 years old. They have 5 children. David has been a bricklayer for more than 20 years and has done construction in different parts of town. David wants to increase his income to improve his family's life but tells us that he needs to purchase more working tools. This is why this loan will be used to buy more tools so that he can increase his income. David tells us that he wants to give his wife and children the most comfort he can and for that he says that the next loan he requests will be to improve the conditions of the house he lives in.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for construction work

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es de 24 años de edad es casada, tiene un hijo varón, se dedica a confeccionar pantalones de diferentes tallas y estilos, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente cuatro años de edad, solicita su primer préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo en telas y materiales para confeccionar, sus referencia personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador, con la ayuda de su esposo realizara los pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Paulina, 24, is married and has a son. She manufactures pants in a variety of styles and sizes. She has been in this occupation for about 4 years. She is asking for her first loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies. Her personal references indicate that she is a responsible and hard working person. Her husband will help her make her monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely T. is a 62-year-old mother of five. She is married to a farmer who works a small parcel of their land. Her husband is also hired by other people in their village during the rice planting and harvest season. This livelihood of hers started more than 10 years ago, but improving the family's living conditions remains impossible. 

Fely applied for this loan to finance fertilizers, insecticides, and other supplies. She wants to buy these items in advance in order to get a lower price, and to avoid borrowing money from her neighbor during planting season. When she borrows from her neighbor, she usually pays back in rice grains after harvest which is very disadvantageous to her. Fely hopes that through her loan, she and her husband can save their harvest and get a better price at market. Fely also engaged her second venture--raising livestock in their wide and verdant backyard for supplementary income.

Fely and her husband lack the education that is required to be employed. Therefore, they have used their own skills to earn money for their children and to survive. Fely has never wanted anything else in her life as a mother other than to give her children a better future by sending them to school through college. However, she failed with her four eldest children, because some of them married at an early age and others stopped going to school and worked instead. Fely's last hope is youngest child who is in the fourth year of high school and will soon be in college, and, also, her grandchildren. 

She also wants to have an electricity connection for their farm’s operation and to build a better house for the family.

loans.use: buying fertilizers, insecticides, and other supplies

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S., 26, is married and resides with her husband and their young child in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. and her husband are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 3.30 each per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to build a new house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: build a new house

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul O. N. is thirty six years old and married. His wife is a vegetable vendor and they do not have any children yet.

His business is located at a busy market known as Nyamasaria in Kisumu. He makes clothes which include trousers, shirts and seat covers, and sells to wholesalers at Kibuye market. He has been doing this for ten years. He says that his business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy materials to make more clothes and sell to the local people, thus serving a bigger clientele. He hopes to acquire his own shop at Kibuye market in Kisumu. He describes himself as tolerant, respectful and social.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for sewing

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Phun S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being a cross-border business area with Vietnam. S. is a farmer and grows rice for an income of $2 US per day. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning an income of $6 US per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase snacks and beverages to sell at home. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buying snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: L. señora Amelia tiene 43 años, vive en L. zona D, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos que cuida, además es L. presidenta del grupo: “Las Esmeraldas” el cual se conforma por 8 vecinas que vienen trabajando 7 años con Edaprospo. Amelia vende productos de belleza de Avon y ESICA, ah hecho esto por 20 años, también vende cebiche, gaseosas y cerveza los domingos para ayudar a su pareja, que es albañil, a mantener su hogar y los estudios de Diseño Grafico de su hija FioreL., gracias a su esfuerzo y L. ayuda de Edaprospo ah lograd implementar un cuarto más en su casa, espera pronto poner su propia Boutique, pero para esto desea que Edaprospo haga más habilitaciones para su grupo.L. señora Ana, socia pasiva esta aun con sus amigas y les apoya ensus reuniones, aunque esta vez no este participando.
texts.en: Amelia is 43 years old. She lives in Zona D. She is in a common law marriage and has 3 children she is raising. She is also the president of the “Las Esmeraldas” group, which is made up of 8 neighbors who have been working with Edaprospo for 7 years. Amelia sells Avon and ESICA beauty products. She has done this for 20 years. She also sells ceviche and soft drinks on Sundays to help her spouse, who is a bricklayer, support the home and pay for the graphic design classes for their daughter FioreL.. Thanks to her hard work and help from Edaprospo, she has been able to add another room on to her house. She hopes to be able to open her own boutique soon, but for this she hopes that Edaprospo will make more authorizations for her group. Ana is a passive member who still is with her friend supporting them in meetings, although she is not participating at this time.

loans.use: To buy products and materials

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 40 years old. Juvy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy plants and harvests rice for sale. Juvy wishes for her children to finish college and have bright futures. 

Juvy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Juvy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ryamatumba Twimukye-Bushenyi Group

texts.en: Ryamatumba Twimukye is the group to which 52-year-old John M. belongs. He has been operating his cattle sales business for five years. This business has been earning this productive gentleman 160,000 shillings weekly. On the side, John has an agro-sales business where he sells mostly bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes. John is married and has 6 children. He says that, with this loan, he is going to purchase more cows that he eventually hopes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet M. is 16 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  Harriet has a hair salon business, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a dryer.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Harriet hopes to own a house.        Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by changing her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda S. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda prepares and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks like bread, chips, fish balls, and other dim sums to the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Imelda's first loan from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 22 años y reside junto a su familia en el sector Los A. , uno de los anexos que conforman el caserío Punto 9 del distrito de Mochumí, una localidad dedicada principalmente a la agricultura que se encuentra situada en la localidad de Lambayeque, a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de consumo diario, siempre brindando una buena atención, con lo cual siempre se garantiza una buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante a su familia y progresar juntos poco a poco.

Victoria desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su nivel de venta y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Victoria, 22, lives with her family in Los A. one of the annexes that make up Mochumí district’s Punto 9 settlement, a location dedicated principally to agriculture located in Lambayeque over half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic needs items and groceries in a store installed in her house.  She offers her neighbors all kinds of products that are used daily always with good customer service which guarantees her a good reception.  Income from this activity is used to support the family and to progress together little by little.

Victoria wants to acquire more merchandise to expand her sales and profit level.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La Sra. Dora, se dedica a la venta de papa por mayor y menor,  lleva  a vender su producto a la ciudad de Santa Cruz,   tiene  dos hijos quedo  viuda  muy joven y salió adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos, es una persona muy conocida en su zona, es padre y madre para sus hijos,  viaja cada fin de semana a entregar sus productos y los demás días vende en el mercado cerca a la zona donde ella vive, el préstamo invertirá para comprar cargas de papa por mayor y así poder incrementar su  capital de trabajo, es una persona  muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dora sells potatoes both wholesale and retail.  She takes her products to sell in the city of Santa Cruz.  Dora has two children.  She was left a widow at a very early age but got ahead for the well-being of her children.  She is a very well-known person in her area.  She is both mother and father to her children.  She travels every weekend to deliver her products and the rest of the week she sells her products in the market in a nearby area.

Dora will invest her loan in buying loads of potatoes wholesale and thereby increase her working capital.  She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy loads of potatoes

loans.name: Daisy's Group

texts.en:
Daisy R. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 44 years old. Daisy is the group leader of a six member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Daisy R.'s Group.

Daisy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Efa Sarai

texts.es:
La señora Efa ES socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se desempeña como mecánico y tiene 5 hijos (2 mayores e independientes y 3 que todavía son pequeños y dependen de ella).
La señora Efa lleva 12 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y que ha estado invirtiendo en la compra y venta de madera, negocio que le ha sido muy lucrativo y ha mejorado la situación económica de su hogar.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de 2,500 pies de madera en tablones, que es más comercial y lo va poder colocar más rápido.
Para la señora Efa Manuela Ramos ha sido quien le dió la mano para poder tener un capital y hacerlo trabajar, trabajo que le va muy bien hasta el momento y complementa con lo que su esposo aporta a su casa.
La señora Efa al mismo tiempo está generando trabajo a otra persona que se encarga de las labores de su hogar, porque no tiene tiempo para ocuparse de eso, su trabajo le demanda todo el dia.
texts.en:
Efa is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (Mutually Supportive Women” communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 37 years old, married and her husband works as a mechanic.  They have five children (two adult, independent ones and 3 who are still little and depend on her).

Efa has been working for 12 years with Manuela Ramos loans.  She has been investing them in lumber sales, a business that has proven to be quite profitable and has improved her household economy.

With this 3000 new sol loan she will buy 2500 feed of wood beams which is more commercial and she will be able to sell quickly.

For Efa, Manuela Ramos has been who gave her a hand in order to have capital to put to work, work which to date she’s done well in and complements what her husband contributes to the home.

At the same time, Efa is generating employment for another person who does her household chores because she doesn’t have time for that; her business keeps her busy all day.

loans.use: To buy 2500 linear feet of wood beams.

loans.name: Manolo Roberto

texts.es:
Manolo  B. comenzó desde los 18 años su profesión como panadero y  hace 8 años dejo la ciudad de Santa Elena  y llego a playas para ejercer su profesión  de la cual le está yendo mejor. En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a domingos de 7am hasta las 6 de la tarde. No tiene ningún obstáculo en su panadería está casado su esposa le ayuda en el negocio y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en escuela fiscal 

Con el préstamo va a comprar harina, bebidas, manteca. Su sueño para los próximos 5 años es comprar un terreno y hacer su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manolo B. started out in his trade as a baker at the age of 18.  Eight years ago he left the city of Santa Elena and arrived in Playas to carry out his trade and it is doing better.  He currently works from Monday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  He has nothing to stop him in his bakery.  Manolo is married and his wife helps him in the business.  He has 2 children who attend school. 

Manolo will use his loan to buy flour, drinks and butter.  His dream for the next 5 years is to buy a plot of land and build a home.

loans.use: To buy flour, drinks and butter

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling fish. She is 48 years old, married to a driver, and has 7 children -- all of whom go to school. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell.  In the future, with the extra profits she hopes to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To stock fish to sell

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, vive en la comunidad de Chican en el cantón  Paute, este cantón es de clima templado propicio para la siembra de flores, es reconocido por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora María tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 6 años que estudia en la escuela y otro de 1 año con el cual está en la fotografía. Su esposo labora  como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña María se dedica a la venta de hortalizas, esta actividad  la realiza los días domingos desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, los otros días de la semana se dedica al cuidado de sus animales, ella cría pollos, cuyes, vacas y chivos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá, el dinero del prestamo lo va a invertir en la compra de hortalizas para su negocio y tambien en más animales para la cría. Su meta es construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” communal bank.  She lives in the community of Chican in Paute Parish.  This parish has a moderate climate that’s suitable for growing flowers.  It is known for the beauty of its scenery.  Its residents are merchants, raise animals and farm.

María is 23 years old, married and has two children: a 6-year-old who is in school and a one-year-old who appears in the photo.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not own a house; they live with her parents with whom they share household expenses.

María is a vegetable merchant; she works every Sunday from 4am until 5pm.  The other days of the week she spends caring for her animals; she raises chickens, guinea pigs, cows and goats that she sells in her own community.

She is in her 3rd loan with the communal bank which she was invited to join by her mother.  The money from the loan will be used to buy vegetables for her business and also for more animals to raise.  Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and animals to raise.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es separada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de choclos y también vende productos secos como quinua, trigo y moraya, ella vende en el mercado de Urcos desde 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de choclos y granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar choclos y productos secos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "The Friends". It is located in the district of Urcos, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Felicitas. She is 50 years old, separated, and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business buying and selling corn and she also sells dry products, such as quinoa, wheat, and dried potatoes. She makes her sales in the market in Urcos from 7am until 5pm. She wants to improve her corn and dried grain business. She requests a loan to purchase corn and dried products in wholesale.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase corn and dried products in wholesale

loans.name: Basiliza

texts.en:
Basiliza C. is a lady of forty-six, married and a mother of four children. They live in Cheplaskei on the outskirts of Eldoret, and she has done maize farming in the same area for the last seven years. She gets a monthly income of seven thousand shillings.


Basiliza plans to use the loan to buy maize seed and, fertilizer and use part of the money for weeding. She will use the additional income that she will get to pay back the loan and to expand her agricultural business. 



In future she wants to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and  fertilizer.

loans.name: C4710 Abashakashatsi Group

texts.en:
Vedaste (first on the left side)  is 26 years old and is married. He is the president of a group called “Abashakashatsi.” Vedaste sells various goods such as rice, sugar, bread, and biscuits. He has four years of experience, and works from 6 am until 10 pm every day. 

Vedaste and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more goods such as Irish potatoes,sweet potatoes, rice, sugar, bread, and biscuits to sell.  With their increased profits, Vedaste and the group will reinvest in their business.

loans.use: To buy more goods such as rice, sugar, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Edith Nicolette

texts.fr: Née le 19 Octobre 1970, Edith Nicolette est mariée à Pascal, un hôtelier. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Edith Nicolette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Edith Nicolette  a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et a appris la couture, une activité qu’elle exerce passionnément depuis vingt quatre ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Edith Nicolette vend des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Edith Nicolette s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Edith Nicolette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira certainement à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Born on October 19, 1970, Edith Nicolette is married to Pascal, a hotelier. They have two children, who both go to school. Edith Nicolette lives with her husband and her children. Edith Nicolette stopped attending school at the secondary level and learned how to sew, which she has been doing with a passion for 24 years, and which has enabled her to provide for herself. On the side, Edith Nicolette also sells sewing supplies in her shop. Edith Nicolette buys her supplies from Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the second time that Edith Nicolette is asking for a loan from ALIDé. This loan will most certainly help her enhance her business, in order to better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena tiene 40 años de edad, es casada vive con el esposo y con los  hijos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Maria Magdalena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y choclo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y choclo, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno.

En los tiempos libres le gusta conversar con el esposo.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 40 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in San Pablo parish, in San Miguel canton.

The Unión y Esperanza (Unity and Hope) community bank is located in San Pablo parish, 30 minutes from our San Miguel office.  The members of this group farm corn and potatoes, and sell vegetables and other products.

Maria Magdalena is a farmer who grows corn.  She has been in this line of work for a long time.  She makes her purchases in San Miguel and sells her products in the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

Maria Magdalena is requesting this loan to buy corn seeds.  This loan will help her to increase her income and production.  She faces challenges in her business such as a lack of workers and changes in the weather which sometimes damage her crops.  Her dream is to buy more land.

In her spare time, Maria Magdalena likes to chat with her husband.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds

loans.name: Sultanbek's Group

texts.en:
Sultanbek, 54, is a member of this group. Together with his wife, he brings up four children: two daughters and two sons. The first daughter studies at university, the older son works for the police and the other children are at school. In order to earn money, Sultanbek works as a driver. He also makes additional money by reselling livestock.  The profits gained from the business helped him to give the children a good education. This year Sultanbek’s younger son graduates from school and Sultanbek needs some additional financial funds to pay for his son’s tuition at the Police Academy. For this purpose, he applied for the loan. He hopes that the loan will help him to realize the plans. Sultanbek will be thankful for all the lenders who support his group.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition at Police Academy

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo gracias a la Sra. Maria, ella había oído hablar del grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y quedo fascinada con la idea, por lo que organizo a sus vecinas y amigas, las cuales encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité al que llamaron Medalla Milagrosa.
el comité actualmente tiene 10 miembros, todas ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras y responsable. Todas ellas luchan por un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus familiares, se unieron con ese propósito y desean cumplirlo.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, como ser sandwishs, empanadas, croquetas, y demás. Cada día a muy tempranas horas se levanta a preparar los alimentos que va a vender. Ella manifiesta que todo sacrificio es pequeño por lograr un bienestar a su familia.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los ingredientes para los alimentos que prepara como ser las especias, carnes, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
The group was formed thanks to Mrs. Maria who had heard of a group of entrepreneurial woman and was fascinated by the idea. So she organized her friends and neighbors who were delighted to agree to make up the Committee that they named Medalla Milagrosa [Miraculous Medal]. The committee currently has ten members, all of whom define themselves as hardworking and responsible women. They all fight for a better future for themselves and their families. They came together with that purpose and want to fulfill it. 

Mrs. Maria works selling fast food such as sandwiches, empanadas, croquettes and other foods. Every day at a very early hour she gets up to prepare the foods she is going to sell. She asserts that every sacrifice is a small one when it comes to achieving wellbeing for her family. 

She is seeking the loan to purchase ingredients for the foods she prepares, such as spices, meat, garden produce and other ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients such as spices, meat, produce and other items.

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es:
Bethy tiene 36 años , radica en su pueblo natal  con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 7 años que se dedica a la agricultora, produce papa y granos; paralelamente cría  animales como toros, que lo adquiere muy tiernos antes que lleguen a desarrollar por completo, para así alimentarlo y darles el peso exacto y ser vendido s aun buen precio, de esa manera  genera los ingresos que necesita para su familia. En cuanto a lo que cosecha los vende en el mercado principal de su ciudad, durante los días miércoles y domingo cuando es la feria comercial y cada 2 meses aproximadamente vende sus animales en la feria ganadera de su zona. En todos estos años le ha resultado beneficioso en sus ganancias por lo que se anima a continuar con este esfuerzo en bienestar de la educación de sus hijos menores. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal que integra   de las cuales esta es la oportunidad 14 que tiene con MFP, Es admirable  la perseverancia de su persona ya que es una de las socias mas antiguas de su grupo y estar aun en los tiempos difíciles que tuvo el banco comunal que integra. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva.
Con el dinero, comprará sacos de abono orgánico para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Bethy is 36 years of age.  She lives in the city of her birth with her husband and their 2 children in their own home.  For 7 years she has been dedicated to agriculture, producing potatoes and grains.  At the same time, she raises animals such as bulls, which she acquires very young when they are not yet completely developed, to fatten and raise to the right weight to sell at a good price.  In this general manner she earns the necessary income for her family.  As to her harvest, she sells that in the commercial market of her city on Wednesdays and Sundays.  Approximately every 2 months she sells her animals in the cattle market of her area. All these years have had a beneficial effect on her income, which encourages her to continue her efforts for the welfare and education of her small children.  She has worked for several years with her group in the communal bank.  This is her 14th loan with MFP.  Her perseverence is admirable, as she is one of the associates who has been working with the communal bank the longest.  On this occasion, she will continue renewing her effort and her positive attitude. 
With the money she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer to sow potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Chielo

texts.en:
Maria Chielo is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. 

Maria Chielo has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Maria Chielo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Maria Chielo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, age 60, sells bags and clothing.  Her husband is a retired school principal.  They live along national road number two about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married for almost thirty years and have three married children, two sons and one daughter.

Sophy is requesting a loan of $500 to expand her business by buying additional bags and clothing for sale.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying additional bags and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with seven children, three boys and four girls. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past two years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other water vendors in the area. She dreams of purchasing another water tank in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to establish a vegetable stall business and purchase bundles of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables to sell to establish a vegetable stall business

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene veinte y nuevo años de edad, es soltero y vive con su mama actualmente estudia en la universidad y trabaja.
 Una de las necesidades que atraviesa el, es la urgencia de comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir un cuarto. Es  por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Es su  segundo préstamo con ceprodel, agradece a la institución ya que con este nuevo préstamo podrá terminar su cuarto en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Pedro is twenty-nine years old, he is single and he lives with his mother. He is a university student and he has a job.
He urgently needs to buy construction materials, as one of his main current needs is to finish building a room. For this reason he has come to CEPRODEL to receive a loan that will help him improving his living conditions. This is his second loan with CEPRODEL, and he is thankful to the institution because with this new loan he will be able to finish building the room in his parents’ house.

loans.use: To buy construction material to finish building a room in his house.

loans.name: Jacklyn

texts.en:
Jacklyn engages in cosmetics sales. She lives with her husband and four children. Jacklyn is a former OFW abroad. She has just come back to the Philippines because she got sick. Jacklyn didn't want to waste her time staying in the Philippines without any source of income.
 
Jacklyn decided to engage in a direct-selling business. She learned the business through some friends, and she has been in the business for 6 years. Jacklyn is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase eye liner, lipstick, eye brow pencil and lotions to sell on her customers. This loan will help her improve the inventory that she offers to customers. Her only difficulty is that she sells on credit, and her customers don't pay their purchases on time.

loans.use: to purchase eye liner, lipstick, eye brow and lotion to sell on her customers.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella used the previous loan to educate her children but needs another loan to expand her business. She currently runs a retail shop that she started five years ago with a limited capital of only 2,000,000 shillings.  She faces a challenge in the high cost of rent and her dream is to own a wholesale shop.  Stella needs another loan to buy sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.use: buy sugar, soap and rice

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Sinat is 26 years old and works in the garment factory, earning $5 per day. Her husband is a driver, earning $4 per day. They have one child who is 3 years old. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for her and her husband to use traveling to work. Her husband plans to buy a car to run a car taxi service, which can make better income than working in the factory.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARTESANAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda, venta de medicina natural, confección de poleras, elaboración de mantas, venta de herramientas, elaboración de macramé, confección de poleras.

La señora Juana  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido en macrame que viene trabajando hace un año atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su amiga. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de hilo.) que comprará de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en: The 'Artesanas' (Craftswomen) community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office. The group has seven members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Juana. The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: running a store, selling natural medicines, making tops, making blankets, selling tools and making macramé products. Juana tells us that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer and she joined through an invitation from a loan officer. She currently has a business making products from macramé. She has been in this business for one year and learned the trade from her friend. Juana will use this loan to increase her capital (buying threads). She will buy these supplies in the market and then sell her products to order. This work allows her to make money to support her family. She is married and has three children. When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana replied that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy threads

loans.name: Vannat's Group

texts.en: Vannat is married and a 41 years-old mother of 5 children. Her oldest child is married while the other four are still single. Her husband is a painter and has been painting for more than 20 years to support the family. Vannat sometimes works for others for additional income. She leads a group of 4 members. Vannat and other members of the group are requesting a second loan with VisionFund. She wants to buy ink for her husband's painting. She hopes this loan will enable her husband to increase his painting and earn more income to feed her family, and set aside some money for the future needs.

loans.use: to buy ink for painting.

loans.name: Marlene Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Marlene se dedica a la venta de mariscos en general como por ejemplo, pulpo, almejas, langostinos, etc. Estos productos provienen del mar de los países de Chile y Perú, ya que Bolivia no cuenta con salida al mar. Las ventas las realiza  a los restaurantes, marisquerías, cevicheras de ciudad de La Paz y el Alto de Bolivia, la señora Marlene no cuenta con hijos pero es muy trabajadora y piensa en el futuro compra su casa propia y así tener algún patrimonio que ofrecer a futuros hijos, con el dinero del credito comprara mariscos, para la entrega de pedidos, su sueño es el llegar a tener un restaurant que venda productos del mar y hacer posible que  los pobladores de La Paz y Bolivia degusten de estos exquisitos mariscos, Marlene es una persona joven  emprendedora con ganas de superación, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marlene sells varied seafood such as octopus, clams, prawns, etc.  These products are imported from Chile and Perú, since Bolivia has no sea coast. She sells to restaurants, seafood and ceviche establishments in La Paz and el Alto de Bolivia.  Marlene does not have children, and is very hard-working and hopes in the future to buy her own house and have some savings for an eventual family.  With this credit she plans to buy seafood to satisfy customer orders.  She dreams of one day owning a restaurant to sell her seafood products for residents of La Paz and Bolivia to enjoy.  Marlene is dedicated worker and is very grateful for the support given by microcredit.

loans.use: to buy seafood (octopus, prawns, clams)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 computers

loans.name: Duo San Francisco La Jiralda Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN FRANCISCO
Doña Reyna es una persona trabajadora que diariamente se dedica a su negocio ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y también se dedica a la crianza de animales ella tiene bajo su responsabilidad sus cuatro hijos menores de edad,  que necesitan mucho el apoyo de ella , gracias a dios ella ha podido Sacar adelante a sus hijos a pesar de muchas dificultades que ella a pasado  en su vida, desde la muerte de su esposo ella se ha dedicado a cuidar a sus hijos y sacarlos  adelante, ella necesita el credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos, y así obtener mas ganancia y darles una educación mejor a sus hijos. Don Edgar, es una persona  trabajador que solo quiere lo mejor para su familia junto con su esposa quieren darle  a sus hijos una educación mejor y tener un futuro mejor , el tiene un pequeño negocio de estudio de publicidad, y que ahora necesita un capital para poder engrandarlo y dar un  mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
‘DUO SAN FRANCISCO’ 

Reyna is an industrious woman who works on her business every day. She sells traditional clothes and also breeds animals. She is responsible for her four young children, who are very reliant on her support. Thankfully she has managed to help her children get ahead in spite of the many difficulties she has faced during her life. Since her husband died, Reyna has looked after the children and helped them to progress. She needs the loan to buy raw materials for making fabrics, so that she can increase her profits and give her children a better education. 

Edgar is a hardworking man who just wants the best for his family. Together with his wife, he wants to give his children a better education and have a better future. He has a small business - an advertising agency. Edgar now needs capital so that he can grow the business and provide his clients with a better service.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making fabrics.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan (in the photo) is 43 and her husband, Nhoel, is 54 years old. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1986 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two are garment workers, one is a chef, one is a driver and another one has full-time employment.  
 
Chan stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband, who is a construction worker. 

Chan is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives. She will also use a part of the loan to fill in the land in front of her house because there are some ponds in front of the house, so she needs to fill them in.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives and fill in the land in front of her house.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de amable y alegre, es separada de su pareja, pero vive en compañía de sus cuatro hijos a los que quiere mucho, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Gladys es la venta de frutas frescas, negocio que lo realiza desde su propia casa. Para eso se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige al mercado a comprar las frutas recién llegadas y las más frescas. Tiene más de realizando éste negocio y paralelo a ello, también se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, por lo que tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado Bellavista, negocio que lo realiza desda hace 5 meses. Le gusta ambos negocios ya que le generan los ingresos económicos necesarios para vivir de una manera más cómoda, además de contar con el apoyo económico de sus hijos, ya que con ese dinero lo ahorró y lo utilizó como capital inicial, y viendo que su capital está creciendo, tiene planes de invertirlo en una bodega de venta de abarrotes que lo instalaría en su propia casa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para implementar su bodega y ponerlo en marcha.
texts.en: Gladys, 49 years old, is a hardworking and earnest woman, as well as friendly and cheerful.  She is separated from her partner, but lives with her four children, whom she loves very much, comfortably in their own home. The business has Gladys is selling fresh fruits, which she performs from home. For that she gets up early and heads for the market to buy fresh fruits and the freshest arrivals. She has more than doing this business as she also sells second hand clothing and has a stall in the Bellavista market, a business that she has had for 5 months. She likes both businesses as they generate the income necessary to live a more comfortable life, in addition to financial support from her children, since that money was saved and used as seed money, and seeing that her capital is growing, she plans to invest in a grocery store that she would install at home. This is the first loan with the MFP institution, she feels satisfied with the financial support to realize her plans. With the amount requested of 800 nuevos soles she will invest in buying staples to implement her store and get it going.

loans.use: to buy staples to set up her grocery store.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Umoja Ni Nguvu Masimeri Group

texts.en:
Matride, 54 years old, is the mother of ten children, three attending secondary school. She has grown maize, beans and coffee for over 13 years. She has farming problems, such as lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Matride works hard to find funds to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. In five years to come, she has a vision of increasing her scale of production from 5 to 14 acres in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos de 33 años solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa; porque en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo se está deteriorando. Carlos quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos él y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora de lunes a viernes. Para que pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar impermeabilizante para que su casa este mejor protegida en los cambios climáticos.
texts.en: Thirty-three-year old Carlos is asking for a loan to waterproof the roof of his home because during the rainy season the water seeps through and it's causing the roof to deteriorate.  Carlos wants to keep the problem from getting serious so he doesn't have to spend more than he anticipated.  He and his wife work at an assembly plant Monday through Friday to cover their expenses.  In order to complete this project, he has to buy waterproofing so his home will be better protected from changes in climate.

loans.use: to buy waterproofing

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Purity who is a tenacious, determined, and very resourceful woman who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a proud mother and has been doing mixed farming for the past four years. Her primary sources of income are egg selling, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Purity loves farming. She has even nicknamed her cow and she really takes good care of her dairy cows.

The Nkubu area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming; that is, good soil, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Purity wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. She intends to buy good vegetable and fruits seeds that she will use in horticultural farming.

With more income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. The financial benefits that Purity will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits. With your support, this noble farmer will be able to produce more crops. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Barrio San Antonio Group

texts.en:
The people of Santa María Visitación have very rich cultural traditions that make them very proud; the colorful dress of the women is ornate and beautiful. It consists of a woven and embroidered rectangular blouse called a “huipil” (wee-peel), wrap around woven skirt or “corte” and an embroidered and woven belt called a “faja”. The predominant languages are the indigenous language of K’iché and Spanish. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Barrio San Antonio” is located here and is composed of seven entrepreneurial women. Julia, who is a member of the Trust Bank, is 42 years old and has been married for 20 years; she has five children who range in age from 7-18. Julia is working hard so that each of her children can have formal education since she realizes how important it is. She was only able to study until the 6th grade. She is empowered, motivated and appreciates her loan that she is going to use in her beekeeping and textile businesses. She raises bees, as well as embroiders and weaves the traditional “huipiles” of her town. Julia also distributes natural medicines to sick children in her area. She is requesting a loan to buy a number of supplies for her textile business including thread, wool, silk, and other needed supplies. She wants to have plenty of raw materials for her textile treasures, especially at this time of the year. Julia has utilized part of her income to purchase a plot of land, repair and expand her home, buy a computer and most importantly, send her children to school.
 
The ladies look forward to their monthly meetings when they have the opportunity to socialize, make payments on their loans and participate in educational trainings conducted by a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. A specific topic is covered at each meeting and the Facilitator uses games, role playing, pictures and diagrams to share the information. Most of the women have had little or no formal education. 

Julia is especially grateful to be a member of the Trust Bank since she is the sole provider for her children. Several years ago, her husband became ill and was unable to work.  She had to assume a leadership role in their home. 

Thank you, KIVA investors, for believing that Julia and her friends in the Trust Bank have the capacity to progress and create more prosperous lives for themselves, their families and their community!

loans.use: To buy supplies for her textile business including thread, wool, silk, and other needed supplies

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Rai is a villager of Stoeng Sen district where crop farming is the common way to earn a living. Rai is 38 and married with children. Like other villager, Rai has been struggled to make a living by farming rice and sometimes working as a paid worker to earn additional income. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 10$ per day, but she manage to save about 5$ each day. 

Rai has never been with VisionFund before, now she is asking for a loan to buy solar panel for lighting in her house. She hopes that this loan will enable her to reduce on electric bill.

loans.use: to buy solar panel for lighting in her house

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
I am Santos S., I have been selling clothes for six years. My store is located in the market in my city, which is heavily visited by people traveling through town, the majority of my sales are to people who sell my items in other cities. With my earnings I support my wife and my two school aged children.

Descripción del Negocio: Soy Santos S., me dedico a la venta de ropa desde hace seis años. Mi negocio está ubicado en el mercado de mi ciudad por lo que es bastante visitado por personas en transito, vendo al por mayor a personas que se dedican a vender en otras ciudades. Con las ganancias que percibo mantengo a mi esposa y dos hijos en edad escolar.

loans.use: Buying children’s clothes, trousers for women, men and children, underwear.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has 2 years of experience in her business of sales of home products. She started her business with money that her husband had saved; together they have succeeded in launching the business. They work every day from 8 am to 3 pm alongside their sons, who help them sell. Previously, Ana worked in an office as a secretary for a year. When she left that job, her husband brought up the idea of starting her own business.

Ana wants the loan so she can invest it in the business by buying products her clients order but that she doesn't currently stock, and by having more products in stock in general, in order to generate more income.

Ana is 38 years old with 8 children. Four of her children are currently in school; the other four help her in the business. Her husband has worked for almost 16 years as a cook preparing morocho, a dry cracked corn used in beverages and foods; he enjoys his work. With the loan and the income their business generates, they would like to begin to improve their home, which is currently made of reed. They want to begin to reinforce the house with cement. They also want their children to be able to live a better quality of life. The childen who work with Ana and her husband wish to begin to build their own businesses soon, to follow their mother, who has succeeded in setting an example for them with her hard work and effort.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ana tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su negocio de ventas de artículos de hogar, el cual lo inicio con dinero que tenia ahorrado su esposo y juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante. El negocio lo trabajan todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. con dos de sus hijos que son los que le ayudan a vender. Anterior ella trabajaba de secretaria en una oficina casi un año actividad que dejo por que su esposo le comento la idea de tener un negocio propio.

Ana desea el crédito para poder invertir en el negocio con productos que al momento no cuenta y tiene pedidos de ellos, y tener más productos para generar más ingresos.

Ana tiene 38 años, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian y los demás le ayudan en su negocio. Su esposo también trabaja de cocinero como elaborador de morochos por casi 16 años, actividad que le gusta realizar. Actualmente desean con el crédito y los ingresos que su negocio genere poder comenzar a arreglar su domicilio ya que actualmente su casita es de caña y quieren comenzar a hacerla de cemento. También quieren que sus hijos puedan vivir de una mejor manera. De los hijos que trabajan con ella ya desean en muy poco tiempo comenzar a tener su propio negocio ya que su madre ha sido la que con trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado dar el ejemplo para que ellos puedan seguirlo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products for the home to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Mr. V. works in the repair and sale of audio and video accessories, exploiting the knowledge he acquired in the technical studies he completed some years ago. "I worry about how to protect my business because the insecurity in the city is alarming. I need to install a closed circuit system to safeguard my inventory. Installing the system will require an investment of $1200".

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El oficio del Sr. V. consta en la reparación y venta de accesorios para audio y video, explotando su conocimiento en la materia, mediante una carrera técnica cursada años atrás. "Mi inquietud es proteger mi negocio pues la inseguridad de la ciudad es alarmante y necesito instalar un equipo de circuito cerrado para resguardar el inventario, para esto se requiere de $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: Buy a closed circuit security system

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mr. Cheng B. is 37 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife (pictured here because Cheng was at work when we visited) and their 5 children.  Cheng works as a trailer driver around the market, transporting food and other goods.  He can earn close to $6/day in this business, while his wife earns $3/day as a recylcer.
