She plans to use the new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN to buy 3 men's perfumes, 2 women's perfumes, 2 handcreams, 1 body lotion, 2 baby colognes, 2 baby powders and a showcase in which to preserve and display her products with pride.  Mrs. Mercedes wants to work with Manuela Ramos for a long time because she enjoys being surrounded by the other fortunate members and because with the working capital she can help her husband.

loans.use: To buy 3 men's perfumes, 2 women's perfumes, 2 handcreams, 1 body lotion, 2 baby colognes, 2 baby powders, a showcase

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Manuel P. Velásquez, tiene la edad de 39 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , en comarca Buenos Aries , junto a su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras para poyarlos con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene tres hijos el mayor de ellos trabaja y le apoya y los otros dos estudian , los planes hacia su familia es poder comprar una moto taxi y  tener mejores beneficio  y brindarle mayor aportación a su familia , don Manuel desde hace diez años labora como agricultor  cultivando piña , la mayor afectación ha sido las plagas , porque carecen de cuidados y fertilizantes necesarios para que los plantillos de piñas estén en buenas condiciones y puedan ser grandes y de un buen sabor . El solicita el apoyo de Afodenic atrávez de Kiva ya que en el primer crédito logro mejor el 50 % delcultivo y ahora quiere mejor la otra parte para tener un mejor resultado en la venta de piña.
texts.en:
Manuel P. Velásquez, age 39, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality in the rural area of Buenos Aries.  He lives with his life partner, who sells fruits and vegetables to be able to help them with the household expenses.  He has three children, the oldest of which works and helps him.  The other two attend school. 

His plan for the family is to be able to buy a “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) and have better profits to contribute to his family.  Manuel has been working as a farmer growing pineapples for ten years.  The biggest hindrance has been the pests.  This is because they lack the needed care and fertilizers for the pineapple plants to be in good condition, to grow big, and to taste good.

He is requesting support from Afodenic through Kiva.  With his first loan he managed to improve 50% of his crops.  Now he wants to improve the other part in order to have better results selling the pineapples.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia R. owns A Plus Real Estate Services.  She has been a real estate agent for the past 30 years, and a real estate broker for the last two.  Lydia got into the real estate business after buying her first home.  She says a poor understanding of the business side of home buying made her feel vulnerable throughout the process and motivated her to educate herself.  She took courses in real estate management, which eventually led to her becoming a certified real estate agent.  Lydia holds a bachelors degree from Texas State University, from which she graduated Summa Cum Laude in 2005.

Being a certified real estate broker means she has the credentials to manage her own real estate business without operating through a middleman.  Lydia has a small office with a conference room where she can meet with clients.  She says that meeting a potential client is much like an interview, and that having an office gives her business professional credibility.  In addition to herself, Lydia currently has one real estate agent that works for A Plus Real Estate.

When Lydia decided to start A Plus Real Estate, she wanted to do it alone, without any outside financing.  This strained her resources.  Early on, she invested too much of the company’s revenues back into the business, assuming she could pay herself with future business transactions.  Overextended, she found herself in a bind when business temporarily slowed.  She soon realized paying cash for everything was not practical, and decided it would be prudent to take out a small loan to help cover operating expenses.

She first heard of ACCION Texas-Louisiana years ago through a San Antonio Express-News article written about the organization and its CEO, Janie Barrera.  Lydia found the article inspiring and saved it.  When she decided to apply for a loan, she remembered the article and decided to apply through ACCION Texas-Louisiana.

Lydia never wants her business to grow to the point that it costs her customers quality of service.  She says she would someday like to have 10 real estate agents with A Plus Real Estate, but says she does not want to overextend herself and wants her business to grow naturally.  This summer, she expects to be ready to hire an additional two agents.

Check out her business at http://www.bestsanantoniodeals.com/.

loans.use: Help covering operating expenses

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 56 year-old Kadiatu.  She is a widow and has 3 children ages 34, 29, and 29. She has six additional dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.

In 1987, Kadiatu established her cookery (cooked food) business. She began her business because she learnt the business from her parents: "Since I was not sent to school I preferred selling for my survival." 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 100,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Kadiatu plans to educate her children to university level.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food for her business

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Braulia; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida y también tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi a la ciudad de Cusco, el negocio de venta de comida lo realiza en forma ambulatoria, ella prepara caldo de gallina,chiriuchu (es un plato típico de la ciudad de cusco que consta a base de cuy,tortilla,maíz,salchicha y gallina) y chicha blanca, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar los negocios de transporte y venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y mantenimiento de su carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Braulia is a member of the 'Las Amistosas' community bank which is located in Urcos district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Braulia is 47 years old, widowed, and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling meals.  She also has a car which provides a taxi service in the city of Cusco.  Braulia carries out her meals business as an itinerant street vendor.  She prepares her chicken soup, chiriuchu (a traditional Cusco dish made from guinea pig, tortilla, corn, sausage and chicken), and 'chicha blanca' (a traditional, white corn-based drink).  Through her businesses, Braulia gets her children ahead in life.

Braulia would like to improve her transportation business and her meals business.  She is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies and to pay to have maintenance work done on her car.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and to pay for maintenance work on her car

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara U., 47, is the leader of this group. She resides in Tup and is married to a farmer. They have five children, the youngest of whom is nine years old. Since 2007 she has operated a dairy business. Every day Dinara’s cows yield up to nine liters of milk, which she sells for about $0.24 per liter. The original starting capital was 15,000 KGS. The purpose of Dinara’s application for a loan is to purchase more cattle for generating more milk.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy cows.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor S., age 46, makes a living by selling fish in the Baray market. She sells the fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier at an appropriate price. She currently earns an average of US $2 a day, and she has been running her business for over ten years. 

She is a single mother who has been divorced from her husband for years. Hor S. is the mother of four teenage children who are no longer in school. All of her children are working at various occupations, and they each contribute some of their income to help the family meet its daily expenses. 

Hor S. now uses her old bike to pick up her fish to sell. She hopes to use a motorcycle instead of her old bike, but she doesn't have enough cash to buy one. 

In order to deal with this problem, Hor S. is applying for a loan to add to her savings so that she can buy a used motorcycle for transporting her fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for transporting her fish to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: For the past 11 years, Adjoa has been making kenkey (Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough, usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish) at Abura near Brasi. She is a single parent taking care of two children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to expand her kenkey business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more bags of maize to store for later use. At the time of the visit, Adjoa was yet to prepare the kenkey and so she is showing the pot she uses to cook the dough.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes tipos de comida como caldo de gallina, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como gallina, carne y verduras.                                           
                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the “MUNAY TIKA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Tomasa is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  She prepares different types of food such as chicken soup which she sells as an itinerant street vendor from 7.00am to 1.00pm.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Tomasa would like to expand and improve her food business.  She is requesting a loan to buy products with which to prepare her food such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

Tomasa is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for making meals such as chicken, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 36 years old and married.  She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. Emma has been engaged in farming for more than 10 years. She grows rice and vegetables. Emma rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest.

Emma has requested a loan so she can fund her farm. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Emma hopes to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 45 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz ademas tiene tres cabezas de ganado y como trabajo extra se dedica a la albañeria. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos y alimento para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. enfrenta desafios como enfermedades en los animales. Su sueño es tener mas terreno para dedicarse solo a esta actividad que es la que le gusta.

Le gusta bailar en las fiesta de carnaval y San Pedro.
texts.en:
Segundo is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. He has two children.

The members of the Sacred Heart Communal Bank meet in the sector of Cuatro Esquinas, which is part of the canton of Guaranda and located 15 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The Communal Bank consists of 12 members who engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, the sale of their products, and other profitable activities.

Segundo is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat, and corn. He also has three heads of cattle and works an additional job as a mason. Segundo purchases his supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells his products at the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his crops and feed for his animals. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his animals. His dream is to have more land so that he can dedicate himself exclusively to farming, the activity that he enjoys.

Segundo enjoys dancing at the Carnival celebrations and at the San Pedro festival.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Grecia Iveth

texts.es: Grecia Iveth, de veinticinco años de edad, vive con sus hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cerca de la localidad donde residen. Ella posee un puesto de frutas y verduras en un mercado muy conocido en el lugar; tiene mucha clientela pues vende la fruta y verdura más fresca y de buena calidad y a un buen precio, gracias a ello esta adelante de su competencia. Grecia piensa que la felicidad esta en las personas que deciden serlo es por eso que ella está dispuesta a seguir adelante es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tomates, cebollas, chiles, plátanos, manzanas etc. Así podrá mantener su clientela y generar mas. Grecia tiene la confianza que con esto le podrá regalar una vida mas plena a su familia.
texts.en:
Grecia Iveth, 25, lives with her children who attend school in the town where they live.  She has a fruit and vegetable stand at a well-known market, and has many customers because she offers fresh, quality products at reasonable prices.  Because of this she is ahead of her competitors.

Grecia believes that happiness resides in people who decide they want to be happy.  That's why she wants to get ahead and decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, bananas, apples, etc.  This will enable her to keep her current customers and generate more income.  She is confident that this will help her provide a more fulfilling lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, bananas and apples.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: As head of the family, Tang and her husband always worry about how to create more benefits for their family. Tang sells chicken-rice-soup in a market near her village. Her husband is a carpenter. Together, they earn $8 per day. They are responsible for their five children. With the aim of a more comfortable standard of living, Tang wishes to borrow $500 so she can purchase ingredients to support her current business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to support her current business.

loans.name: Chou

texts.en:
Chou is 35 years old and is married with three lovely dependent children, all of whom are students. She lives permanently in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Chou works hard to support her family and never takes time to visit or talk freely with anyone else. She is always considering how to earn more cash for her family. Currently, she is a fish trader in a market near her community and earns around 3 USD daily. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Chou would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial future of her family and is requesting a 500 USD loan from Kiva to purchase fishing equipment for her husband’s business. In the future, she hopes to send all of her children to study at university.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
Melrose is 34 years old and married with 4 children aged between 5 and 14. She runs a general merchandise store in the Krootown central part of Freetown.

Melrose has owned this business for 4 years and sells food containers, milk, sugar and umbrellas at her store. She also earns income from small-scale timber construction. She says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of transportation. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more food containers, suitcases and tinned milks. Melrose says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to import goods from overseas and expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase more food containers, suitcases, tinned milk and umbrellas

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: Este señor es originario del municipio de Telica donde imparte clases en un colegio de la comunidad teniendo 5 años de ejercer dicha actividad, su núcleo familiar esta compuesta por 3 personas: él, su esposa y su hija la que estudia en el colegio de la localidad. Actualmente solicita un crédito para ser utilizado en compra de ropa de diferentes tallas ya que posee un pequeño negocio de ropa, dicho financiamiento es para incrementar el inventario existente del negocio que lo administra la esposa, esto es para fortalecer los ingresos de la familia y tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This person is a native of the town of Telica, where he has been teaching for 5 years.  His nuclear family is composed of 3 people: him, his wife and his daughter, who is studying in a school in the area.

This funding will be used to buy clothes in different sizes in order to expand existing inventory in the business his wife runs. This business increases the family’s income in order to improve their living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing in all sizes to increase inventory.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Thary (in the photo) and her husband, Ret, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and just have a young son. 

Thary raise pigs at home and she assists her husband in the business. Her husband produces jars for sale. Thary is asking for a loan of $600 to buy wooden materials for her father’s carpenter business.

loans.use: To buy wooden materials for her father’s carpentry business.

loans.name: Jassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and a father of one child who works with him.

Jassem has owned an herbal shop since 2009 where he sells bulk herbs, spices, medicinal herbs, aromatherapy, therapeutic essential oils, botanicals and essential oils for restaurants, health food stores, herbalists, bakers, family farms, soap makers and perfumes. He has sufficient experience in herbs and how to prepare them. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting an $1800 loan in order to buy a three-wheel truck and generator. He is aiming to gain more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheel truck and generator.

loans.name: Berlista

texts.en: Berlista is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has four children. Berlista has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and viands such as afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages and raw ingredients needed for viands. Berlista has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Berlista hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and raw ingredients needed for viands.

loans.name: Soukaye

texts.fr: Madame Soukaye est mariée et âgée de 47ans. Elle habite au Sénégal. Son activité consiste à fournir des services de location de chaise, bâches  et marmites a cuisiner pour les cérémonies. Dans le quartier ou elle habite la demande y  est très forte et c’est la raison pour laquelle elle a opté pour cette activité.  Son point fort est qu’elle n’a pas de concurrents dans le quartier ou elle habite. Elle s’accapare le  marché de prestation de service  dans son intégralité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de chaises, bâches et marmites  en vue de répondre a la demande croissante de la population de sa localité. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus financiers   pour mieux soutenir ses 3 enfants mineurs.
texts.en: Soukaye is 47 years old and married.  She lives in Senegal.  Her business is hiring out chairs, awnings and cooking pots for ceremonies.  There is a very strong demand in the neighborhood where she lives and that is why she chose to pursue this business.  Her strong point is that she does not have any competitors in her neighborhood.  She has captured the market for hiring these items in its entirety.  Soukaye has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since August 2011.  She is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy chairs, awnings and pots in order to meet the growing demand from the people in her town.  Her goal is to increase her income so that she can better support her three dependent children.

loans.use: to buy chairs, awnings and pots to hire out

loans.name: Chreng's Group

texts.en: Chreng is a 39-year-old mother of three children. For the last three years, she has been selling wine-making ingredients to support her family. She leads a group of three members. Chreng and other members have been with VisionFund for two years and are now applying for a third loan. She wants to buy wine-making ingredients and sell to the market. With this loan, she hopes to increase her stock and earn more income to feed her family and buy necessary household stuff.

loans.use: to buy wine-making ingredients

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme  âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un  transitaire. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé est âgé de 18ans et le dernier de 06 ans.
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse de mais et d’huile d’arachide depuis 1992. Elle vend dans une boutique à toutes personnes intéressées par ses marchandises.
Elle a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Elle voudrait agrandir son stock afin de mieux répondre à la population. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a 42-year-old woman.  She is married to a shipping worker.  She has three children, all of whom are in school.  The oldest is 18 years old, and the youngest is 6 years old.  

Akouvi has been working as a retailer of maize and peanut oil since 1992.  She sells from a shop to all people interested in her goods.  She requested her second loan from WAGES so that she can could more goods. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, she would like to grow her stock so she can better respond to the population.  She says that with the profits she anticipates improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase maize and peanut oil for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 63 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Alicia has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Alicia has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, Alicia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to make clothing.

loans.name: Adylbek

texts.ru:
Адылбек 48-летний фермер, женат, имеет троих детей – школьников.  С 1996 года семья Адылбека успешно занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Начав со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Адылбек смог  увеличить поголовье до трех дойных коров и восемнадцати баранов, а также он возделывает 1,80 га земли, где выращивает эспарцет и зерновые культуры. Такая деятельность позволяет Адылбеку получать около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
 Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Адылбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Адылбек намерен использовать для реконструкции сарая в целях обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Adylbek is a 48-year-old farmer, he is married and has three school age children. Since 1996 Adylbek's family has been successfully running a business in raising livestock and cropping. Beginning with the starting sum of 10,000 soms (KGS) Adylbek was able to increase the headcount to three dairy cows and eighteen sheep as well as cultivate 1.8 hectares of land where he grows crops and sainfoin. This activity allows Adylbek to receive about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.

To further increase the number of livestock Adylbek has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle for fattening. Adylbek intends to use the projected profit to reconstruct the barn in order to ensure good conditions for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun, 57, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She models clay into animal shapes to sell out of her home to generate income for the family. Her husband is a taxi driver. Two of her children are employed in a factory. Due to the children's difficulty in traveling to work, Khun is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Gbegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sidonie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 46 ans. Sidonie est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Louis . Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sidonie vend depuis vingt huit ans du maïs, du riz et du gari (farine de manioc) dans sa région. Sidonie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sidonie  ensemble avec les membres du  groupe GBEGNON sollicite un quatrième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, du maïs et du gari.

loans.name: Nurahmad

texts.ru: Нурахмад из района Хамадони. Ему 42 года. Он женат и имеет детей. Дети учатся в школе, и Нурахмад помогает детей в учебе. Его жена домохозяйка. Нурахмад любитель автомашин. Он любить водить машину. Нурахмад занимается перевозом людей. Он арендует автомашину. Ему не выгодно платить за аренду, но он вынужден арендовать автомашину. Потому, что он кормить детей. Нурахмад хочет купить себе новую автомашину, чтобы не платить за аренду, и ему так выгодно зарабатывать. Ему не хватает денег для купли автомашин. Из-за нехватки он обратился за кредитом. Он надеется, что ему не откажет. Нурмахмаду очень нужно Ваша поддержка.

loans.use: Для купли автомашин и сохранить источник дохода.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is an active member of Life in Africa. She joined in November of 2005 and currently works as a wire sorter for the Invisible Children Bracelet project. She is one of the younger members being only 20 years old. She is an orphan. Her parents died when she was only 8 leaving her and her two brothers alone.

They were taken in by an aunt but life was very hard. The aunt, who was a widow herself, was taking care of many children and the grandmother who is blind. With very little money, food was often scarce and the only schooling Monica could afford was a tailor course. She did manage to get a job but could not earn enough money to exist on. Then she came to LiA. She now earns enough to help with food, rent, school fees for her brothers and support for her grandmother.

With encouragement from her determined aunt, she is learning to be independent and to forget that she is an orphan. She has managed to save enough to set up a small shop. Her cousin runs the shop during the day while Monica works. Now she would like to do more. If she adds more stock to the shop, her profits will increase. She also plans to use her tailoring skills by purchasing a sewing machine. Since her shop has a big veranda, she will put this sewing machine there and use on the weekends to earn money. For this project she is seeking a loan of 800,000/=. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months at a rate of 66,667/= per month.

Below is her budget:

  1. A sewing machine @ …………. 250, 000/=
  2. adding stock:
  • 100kgs of rice @ 900/= ………………90,000/=
  • 50kgs of sugar ……………………70,000/=
  • 20 liters of cooking oil…………….40, 000/=
  • 100kgs of maize flour @ 600/=……60,000/=
  • 60kgs of beans @ 1,000/=………….60,000/=
  • 50kgs of groundnuts @ 2,000/=…….100,000/=
  • 50kgs of Simsim @ 1,500/= …………75,000/=
  • 1 box of washing soap ………………...25,000/=
  • Transport ………………………………30,000/=

The total is 800,000/=

Monica's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by her peers at the Life in Africa WE Center community in Kampala. She has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest on her loan to support Life in Africa's Internet4Change team. For more about Monica, her life and her worldview, visit http://lifeinafrica.com/4/atimmonica

loans.use: Retail shop and tailoring

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny sells sheets, comforters, curtains and plastic items. He started his business with the help of his sister who loaned him 100 dollars he initially invested. He began selling sheets door to door. Now he continues to offer sheets, along with towels and other items for the home.

Lenny would use the loan to invest in buying stock wholesale, which would yield better earnings. He has the aspiration to improve his business in order to save and enjoy a better quality of life. He has faith that with this new investment his business will move forward. Lenny is 32 years old and married, with 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Lenny tiene venta de sabanas, edredones, toldos y articulos plásticos. Lenny empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana quien le facilito la cantidad de 100 dólares para su inversión. Se inicio vendiendo solo sabanas puerta a puerta. Ahora el continua ofreciendo estos productos junto con toallas y demás articulos para el hogar. Lenny usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias. El tiene la aspiración de que su negocio mejorara para ahorrar y tener mejor calidad de vida. El tiene la fe que con estos nuevos ingresos su negocio saldrá adelante. Lenny es Padre de dos hijo, esta unido, tiene 32 años.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy products at wholesale quantities

loans.name: Noorullah

texts.en: Noorullah S/O Sakhi Dad was born in 1973 and lives in District 8 of Kabul city. He is married and has eight family members. He is a high school graduate, but during the wars he wasn't able to start his university. After marriage, his financial situation was not good, so he decided to start his own business. He borrowed money from his friends and established a small shop in which he sold limited grocery goods which he purchased from the market. His business continued that way for one year. Then he heard about the loan program from one of his relative. His first loan enabled him to offer more items for sale, and his business grow well. Noorullah has now finished his 4th loan cycle, and is ready to go on the the 5th cycle. He is pleased with the progress of his business and wants to continue with the loan program and keep developing his store.

loans.use: To purchase tea, sugar, milk, flour and other grocery items

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en:
Rafail is 53 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Khodjavand region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children. He has sold metal for 10 years.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy equipment for compressing and cutting metal to sell.

loans.use: To buy equipment for compressing and cutting metal to sell.

loans.name: Imoisili

texts.en: Mrs. Imoisili D. is 39 years old, and married with 5 children.  She has been in this business since 2002.  She is a native of Uromi in Edo state.  She is requesting for the above loan to enable her to buy more food stuffs, hair cream, hair relaxer, weavon, etc. to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and hair equipment

loans.name: Delia Luz

texts.es:
Delia and her husband devote their time and money to arts and crafts as this labor is highly valued and profitable in the area where they live. Nevertheless, it requires large sums of money for investment in raw materials and in machines for fine workmanship, expenses that Delia often cannot assume, given that she must also invest large sums of money in the education and well being of her four children, and she faces these expenses with diligence and responsibility. The need to increase her production to deal with these new demands of her household and creative work has brought her to request a loan of $500. She will use the money to purchase an additional machine that will speed up her work and meet the demand of her foreign customers. With your help, you can make sure Delia and her family ensure a profitable business and a roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Delia y su esposo han dedicado su tiempo y dinero a la actividad artesanal debido a que en la zona en la cual residen esta labor es muy valorada y rentable, sin embargo requiere de cuantiosas sumas de dinero para la inversión en materia prima y máquinas de confección, gasto que Delia no puede asumir en muchos casos, debido a que también invierte importantes sumas de dinero en la educación y bienestar de sus cuatro pequeños niños y afronta estos gastos con diligencia y responsabilidad.La necesidad de acrecentar su producción para hacer frente a los nuevos requerimientos que genere su hogar y su labor de artesanos la ha llevado a solicitar la suma de 500 dólares con el propósito de adquirir una máquina más para agilizar su trabajo y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes foráneos.Con tu colaboración harás que Delia su familia puedan tener un techo propio y un negocio más rentable.

loans.use: Purchase a machine for an artisan's shop.

loans.name: Trad

texts.en: Trad is a 42 year old father of four. He lives with his family in the region of Saida, in south Lebanon. Trad owns a little shop in which he sells cosmetics, accessories, and toys. He needs a loan to purchase enough merchandise to sustain his business. Trad also works as an electrician to generate enough revenues to provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Marcia Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Marcia's activity is to buy apples and grapes during the Christmas season to then sell them. She has been in this business for 4 years, starting with a sum of C$1,000.00 from her personal savings.

She started in the market at Leon's terminal, on a wooden table, and later moved to a place outside the Cathedral, which is a good spot with much traffic of cars and people.

As you can see, these are not the best conditions for selling fruits, so she doesn't have an established place to sell.

Aside from that, Mrs. Marcia is a single mom who is working hard to keep going and support her two daughters who are currently in junior high school.

Mrs. Marcia has established a solid financial bond with Ceprodel, to help her grow her business. In the past 5 months she has been given 2 loans, which increased her working capital and the financial wellbeing of her two daughters, who now receive better nutrition and care.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Marcia es la compra de contado de manzanas y uvas por temporada navideña para luego comercializarlas. Tiene 4 años de estar en el negocio y se inicio con un monto de C$1.000.00 obtenidos por sus ahorros personales.

Inicia en el mercado la Terminal de León en una mesa de madera y posteriormente se traslada al atrio de la iglesia de la Catedral, punto llamativo por el tráfico vehicular y de gente que se moviliza en el sector.

Como se puede notar no son las mejores condiciones para vender sus frutas por lo que aun no tiene un lugar estable para vender.

Además de lo anterior, la señora Marcia es madre soltera que ha luchando para salir adelante con sus dos hijas que actualmente cursan la secundaria.

La señora Marcia ha establecido con Ceprodel una alianza de financiamiento solidó que le ayuda al crecimiento de su negocio con 5 meses de estar trabajando y lleva dos créditos otorgados teniendo un impacto del crédito en un crecimiento de su capital de trabajo, mejor bienestar económico para su dos hijas que están estudiando ya que les da mejor alimentación, salud y cuidados por ser sus únicas hijas que le ha costado mucho formar.

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables (Compra de frutas y vegetales)

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto and Elide live a simple life with the basic necessities and provide for their two children, ages eight and three. As the owner of a carpentry store, Alberto specializes in designing and building beautiful pieces of furniture in his shop at home. With eight years of experience in his line of work, his business has grown and now he not only sells to his neighbors, but also to many others. Alberto works everyday to be able to pay the bills and to make sure that he is able to give his children a great education. Both he and his wife hope that their sons will graduate and become good people in the community.

For now, Alberto is asking for a loan that will help cover the costs of a small truck. This investment will allow him to transport the goods that he makes. Having the ability to cover a larger distance will also allow him to increase his clientele and the sale of his furniture..

loans.use: To invest in a small truck to transport the furniture he constructs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank for over twelve years. She enjoys the community bank, because it maD. it possible for her to borrow without collateral. She has also learned about responsibility, punctuality, solidarity, and to save.

Juana is 55 years old. She is a widow and has five children. Juana owns a butcher shop. She sells pork, bacon, and lamb. Juana started this business with her first loan from the community bank.

Juana each needs a loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy rice sugar, flour, oil, and animals.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Juana plans to use her savings to put a roof on her homes, make general improvements, and buy new furniture. She dreams that her children will finish school and become professionals.

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy rice sugar, flour, oil, and animals.

loans.name: Rawandi

texts.id:
Rawandi is a used goods collector. He collects used goods and then resells them to recycle depot. He has a 2 years old son. He usually walks up to 2 km per day to collect the used goods, mainly the ones made of plastic, aluminum and glass such as bottles. He can earn up to IDR 800 thousand (around USD 100) per month from this work which he uses to pay for his rent, his daily necessities and also to be saved for some amount.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Rawandi adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Rawandi mempunyai seorang anak laki-laki yang masih kecil dengan usia 2 tahun. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Rawandi harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Rawandi mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: to purchase more used goods (Untuk menambah modal membeli barang-barang bekas)

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a small business owner from Simferopol, Ukraine. She sells jeans and other clothing at the large Central market in Simferopol. Her business is unique in her market in that she is one of the only ones who sells jeans in bulk supplies as well as by the pair. Elena has been in business for about five years. She is divorced and has a 16 year old daughter who lives with her. Elena’s business provides about half of her income. She also owns an apartment and a house that she rents out for additional income.

Elena has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase a new supply of clothing inventory. This loan will help her continue to operate a successful business so that she can provide for the needs of herself and her daughter.

loans.use: Elena would like to purchase clothing inventory for her clothing stall.

loans.name: Vey

texts.en: Vey M. is a 28-year-old farmer who also operates a battery-recharging service from her house. She earns about $3.50 per day and her husband earns about $4 per day driving a motor-taxi. They live in Stong District in Kampong Thom Province. Because of their growing business, M. is seeking a loan of $1100 to purchase a new battery recharging  machine and a trailer to transport their customers’ batteries. This loan will help to increase the family’s income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new battery recharging machine and a trailer to transport their customers' batteries.

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.es:
Juana Almendares is a lady who has encountered economic difficulties, but thanks to her concerted efforts, has managed to persevere and provide stability for her young, school-aged children. She is involved in the production and sale of refreshments, which she prepares herself and sells from her own home in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega.

Her business requires investment in the purchase of the raw materials with which to make the refreshments; it is for this reason that Mrs. Juana has approached Ceprodel for a loan. Upon acquiring raw materials, she plans to continue with the sale of refreshments in her community of Somotillo.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Juana Almendares es una dama que a través de la historia ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas pero que gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante y proporcionarle el bienestar a sus pequeños hijos que hoy se encuentran en edades escolares. Ella se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de refrescos los cuales ella misma los prepara y ofrece en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.

El negocio hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los refrescos y es por este único motivo que la señora Juana acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito con el cual logre adquirir su materia prima y de esta manera continuar con la venta de sus refrescos en su comunidad de Somotillo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work in his farm and to look after his cattle and other farm animals.

Pedro wishes to improve the quality of his cattle by purchasing a best-of-breed bull, hence the request for the loan. He will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Pedro es un laborioso agricultor porque sabe que la única manera de satisfacer las necesidades de sus seres queridos y brindarles lo necesario para su desarrollo es con esfuerzo y dedicación. Es así que como todo padre responsable sale todas las madrugadas rumbo a su chacra donde se dedica a abonar la tierra y regarla adecuadamente. Paralelamente se dedica al cuidado de sus animales, los que le ayudan en el trabajo del arado, por ello vela por su bienestar diariamente, porque son el apoyo para la siembra.Pedro desea mejorara la calidad de sus vacas, para ello debe comprarse un toro de mejor raza, y este el motivo por el que solicita el presente préstamo, con la esperanza de recibir atención a su pedido y con la promesa de que su agradecido corazón tendrá siempre en la memoria a las persona que le tendieron la mano cuando lo necesitó.

loans.use: Purchase of a pedigree bull to improve the quality of his cattle

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Née en 1976, madame Afi T. n’a pas fait de brillantes études par manque de support financier. Elle s’est lancée dans la vente de produits génériques à porter de la population de son milieu qui ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour aller à l’hôpital tout le temps. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle participe aux besoins de ses trois (03) enfants grâce aux revenus qu’elle tire de son activité. Ainsi, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter les produits en grande quantité. Ceci permettrait une augmentation de ses revenus pour lui permettre une amélioration de son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Born in 1976, Mrs. Afi T. was not able to go far at school because she lacked the necessary financial support. She began selling generic pharmaceutical products that are within reach of the people in her area who do not have the financial resources to go to the hospital at the drop of a hat.

Married to a farmer, she contributes to the support of her three children thanks to the income from her business. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy the products she sells in large quantity. This should lead to an increase in her income which will permit her to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Seangdy

texts.en:
Mrs. Seangdy C. and her husband, Mr. Phun Phoung, live in a small village along National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1982 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Two of their children are employed full-time, and four children study at the local school. One child assists Seangdy in her business. 

Mrs. Seangdy has been selling porridge and fried noodles for four years. She cooks the food and sells it in front of her home early in the morning. He husband has health problems and stays at home. The main income in the family is from Seangdy and two of her children. Seangdy is requesting a loan of US$300 to dig a well for her family.

loans.use: To dig a well for the family.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú y su negocio está ubicado en su casa en la Carretera Marginal, lugar donde acuden diariamente sus comensales, que son moradores de su comunidad y en su mayoría visitantes de otros lugares, que llegan a su distrito por distintas razones. 

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, y otros ingredientes que necesita para la preparación diaria de los platos que oferta a sus clientes como verduras, carnes (res, cerdo, pollo, pescado). Desea tener todo listo para esperar las fiestas patronales de su distrito donde está asegurada sus ventas.

La señora Isabel tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora. Tiene como meta ampliar su casa porque su clientela está creciendo, para dar una buena  atención y comodidad a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel belongs to the La Libertad Communal Bank. She lives in the township of La Libertad in Bellavista district and province, San Martín region. She sells set-menu meals out of her home on Marginal Highway. Her customers are regulars who live in the neighbourhood while the majority are visitors from other places coming to the area for a variety of reasons. With this loan of S/.1,000 which she will pay off in six months, Isabel will buy rice, sugar in bags, oil by the gallon, a variety of brands and flavours of soft drinks, and other ingredients that she needs when preparing the dishes that she offers her customers, such as vegetables and meats (beef, pork, chicken, and fish). She wants to have everything in place for the local festivals where she is guaranteed good sales. Señora Isabel is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are still dependent on her. She is a determined, lively woman and a good administrator. Her goal is to extend her house because her client base is expanding; she will then be able to offer good service and comfortable surroundings to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. O. lives in Rongo, Kenya, where she sells fertilizer to the rural farmers in the area. She has had a consistent supply of satisfied, repeat customers for the three years she has been in business.

Twice a week, Jane purchases 10 sacks of fertilizer from Kisii, a small town that is a 45-minute drive from Rongo. In order to save both time and money on transportation, she would like to be able to travel there just once a week and buy 20 sacks of fertilizer, the reason she is requesting a loan of $400.

Jane is the married breadwinner of a family of five, two members of whom are disabled and require extra support. Jane maintains her sense of humor even in a difficult situation, humbly and laughingly referring to herself as “just a local woman jumbling around town, trying to make some money.”

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Augusta Daniela

texts.en:
Augusta is a member of the Tu Angel Lucy (“Your Angel Lucy”, named for FINCA founder Lucinda Lanao) Village Bank. Augusta lives with her partner and their daughter. Augusta bakes traditional kinds of bread in a rented oven. She sells her goods in the Ayacuchan jungle. Augusta wants to start selling toys for the Christmas season, which she will travel to Lima to buy. Augusta needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy toys and clothing. Augusta dreams of buying a plot of land to build a home of her own and of opening a store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow.

Augusta es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy. Augusta es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hija, Augusta elabora panes típicos, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, además vende carne, queso, estos productos lo lleva a la selva Ayacuchana. Augusta tiene proyectado vender juguetes aprovechando la fiesta navideña, para lo cual viajara a Lima. Augusta necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes y ropa. Augusta sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa y tener una tienda.

loans.use: To buy toys and clothing for Christmas season

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia K. is thirty-five year old trader. She is married with three children who are currently attending school through the help of government free compulsory education. It is her daily dream to provide quality education for her children to give them better future life.

Felicia owns and operates a grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, and evaporated milk. She wants to use this loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of different variety, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hope to pay the loan in due time because she believes the loan would boost her business growth. Her picture was taking when she was visited at her business site.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her grocery shop, like cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Los Viñedos.  
Maria es de Palpa departamento de Ica,  conviviente, tiene 46 años y dos hijos de 26 y 10  años  el mayor trabaja y él ultima esta en el colegio. 
Maria no termina de estudiar  en el colegio por la mala influencia de sus amigas, se quedo en el tercer año de secundaria  y empezó a trabajar en casas, limpiando y cocinando, siempre le gusto la cocina y con el tiempo puso un  restaurante en su casa  que  funciono seis años, después lo cerro por que era mucho trabajo, decidió descansar por un tiempo, aproximadamente hace dos años se le presento una oportunidad de dar menús, en el trabajo de su esposo, el es maestro de obras, desde entonces ella lleva menús a los trabajadores, todos los días.

Maria sabe bordar y ha conseguido un trabajo de bordados de chompa para exportación, le llevan a su casa las chompas. 
Desde que esta en Finca a prendió a ser puntual en sus pagos, ha no endeudarse, ha recibido  charlas de cómo manejar su negocio. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de una campana extractora para su negocio de comida. 
El sueño de María es surgir en su negocio de comida, que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Los Viñedos Communal Bank. She is from Palpa Departamento de Ica. She is 46 years old and has two children aged 26 and 10. Her eldest child works and the youngest attends school.

Because of the bad influence of her friends María did not finish school. She left in her third year high school and began cleaning and cooking in houses. She has always liked to cook and with time she opened a restaurant in her house, which she ran for six years. She closed the restaurant because it was such difficult work. She decided to rest for a time and approximately two years ago she was presented with the opportunity of making lunches at her husband’s workplace where he is a master builder. Since then she has brought lunches to the workers everyday. Also, Maria knows how to embroider and has obtained a job embroidering jackets for export in her home.

Since she has been involved with FINCA she has been punctual with her payments and she has not gotten herself into debt. She has also attended talks on how to run her business. She needs a loan of 1000 soles for the purchase of an extractor hood for her food business. Maria’s dream is to continue with her food business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of an extractor hood for her food business.

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en: Yagub Q. is 43-year-old man trader who sells home products such as furniture, clocks, kettles, and other items. He started his business more than 10 years ago. Yagub is married and has one child. His profession is cook, and in the second part of the day he is working in the local restaurant. It is not very easy to combine two jobs, but Yagub does everything to keep his family in a good level of life. Yagub applied for $1200 to purchase more goods for his store and will dedicate his time only to sales.

loans.use: Purchase home products as furniture, clocks, kettles, and other items.

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
La señora Leonina P. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Sucre Mza. A – Lte. 05, Distrito de Morales, departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 39 años y es madre 02 hijos.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, que fue por iniciativa propia, empezó vendiendo ceviche en el centro de Tarapoto todos los días. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.
En la actualidad se dedica a la Venta de comidas preparadas, anticuchos asados y juanes, ubicada al costado de la Empresa Ejetur, donde vende a chóferes, pasajeros y moradores de la comunidad. 

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá, comprando mesas, sillas, baldes, termos, vasos y ollas, para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, desea ampliar más su negocio y se siente más segura con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Leovina, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonina P. D. belongs to the “Las Moralinas” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Sucre Mza. A – Lte. 05, Morales district, San Martin department. She is married, 39 years old, and mother of 2 children. With the first loan for S/.300.00, which she sought on her own, she began selling ceviche in downtown Tarapoto every day. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 4 years. Today she sells prepared meals, such as grilled kabobs and “juanes” (a traditional dish) at the side of Empresa Ejetur, where she sells to drivers, passengers, and residents of the community. With this loan for S/1,500.00 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy tables, chairs, buckets, thermoses, glasses and pots to provide better service to her customers. She usually makes the decisions regarding the earnings from her business. Personally, she wishes to expand her business and she feels assured in repaying her loan. Leovina thanks Manuela Ramos in permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs, buckets, thermoses,  glasses and pots to provide better service to her customers.

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité la contacto fue la Señora Irmina P. quien vive en la zona del Barrio San Miguel  D. Ciudad Del Este. Ella es madre D. 2 hijos y ella se dedica a la Venta D. comidas. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Torype Oñondivepa”, está constituido  por 18  señoras muy activas y solidarias, todas D. la misma zona.
  
Las señoras retiran un crédito D. Gs 500.000 a Gs 1200.000 c/u.  El Crédito destinaran a la compra D. mercaderías y artículos D. primera necesidad para la venta.

Irmina E. 	Venta D. Comida 
María P. 	        Modista
Solana R. 	        Modista 
Florinda Báez 	        Venta D. Productos Avon 
Trinidad P. 	Venta D. Comestibles
Felicia E. 	Venta helados
Fidencia P. 	Venta D. Mercería 
María Vázquez 	        Venta Verduras 
Liliana G.	Venta D. Frazadas 
Julia D. G. 	Venta D. Frutas 
Francisca B. 	Venta D. Frutas 
Reina Báez 	        Despensa 
María P. 	        Venta D. Ropa
Zulma G. 	        Venta D. Ropa
Amelia D. 	        Venta D. Hamburguesas
María Pabla O. 	Confección D. Ropa 
Epifania B. 	Venta D. Confites
Patricia F. 	Venta D. Comidas
texts.en:
The group was founded by Mrs. Irmina Portilla. She lives in the area of Barrio San Miguel in the Cuidad Del Este. She has 2 children, and she sells food. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in her area. The group’s name is Torype Oñondivepa. It is maD. up of 18 active and supportive women from the same area. The women are asking for a loan of between $100 and $235 for each member. The loan is to buy merchandise and basic goods to sell. Irmina E. Sells Food María P. Seamstress Solana R. Seamstress Florinda Báez Sells Avon Products Trinidad P. Sells Foodstuffs Felicia E. Sells Ice Cream Fidencia P. Haberdashery María Vázquez Sells Vegetables Liliana G. Sells Blankets Julia D. G. Sells Fruit Francisca B. Sells Fruit Reina Báez Mini Market María P. Sells Clothes Zulma G. Sells Clothes Amelia D. Sells Hamburgers María Pabla O. Makes Clothes Epifania B. Sells Confections Patricia F. Sells Food

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, fruit, breads, blankets, clothes, ice cream and basic needs items

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
“In every sacrifice there is a gift," this is what Rebecca believes. Every day she is very optimistic that she can receive a gift through her business. Rebecca is 51 years old and married to Euligio. They live in San J., Quirino, Isabela and they are blessed with three children: Albert, 40 years old; Jenny, 38 years old, who is working in Malaysia as a domestic helper; and Janward, 25 years old. The family works hard for the fulfillment of their dreams in life despite their age.

Rebecca is a vendor in their village. She sells different merchandise in order to earn a living. Some of her products include: vegetables, fish sauce, goto (congee), and halo-halo during summer in her little stall located near their house.

She would like to request a loan amount of 7,000 Philippine Pesos to be used as additional working capital for her business. She was always busy with her venture to earn a living. She wished that somehow, someday, they can uplift their poor living condition so that her children and future families will not suffer so much from life's difficulties.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.es:
La Señora Bellarosa de 39 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Juan de 45  años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene tres hijos todos  ellos estudiando. 
    La  Sra. es propietaria de una despensa en el cual se inició en el año 2002  El cual inicio con un pequeño ahorro que contaba. Ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención  que les ofrece a sus clientes.  En dicho negocio recibe la ayuda de sus Hijos.  Su Marido está trabajando en una panadería hace más de 15 años, así ayudando también para los gastos de la casa.
     Ña Bellarosa como un sueño personal, desea ampliar su negocio para llegar a ofrecer mejor comodidad y más variedades de productos a sus clientes.
     La clienta  solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías varias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bellarosa is 39 years old. She is married to Juan, who is 45, and they have 3 children, who are all students. Mrs. Bellarosa is the owner of a small grocery that she opened in 2002. She started the business with the small savings that she had. She now has a well established customer base thanks to the good customer service that she provides. Her children help her in her business. Her husband has been working at a bakery for more than 15 years, thus also helping cover household expenses. Mrs. Bellarosa's personal dream is to expand her business to be able to offer greater convenience and product selection to her customers. She is requesting a loan to puchase additional merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: A 46-year-old, married woman and mother of three children, Mrs. Myrna F. is struggling to generate her own income to help her husband combat their poverty. She manages her own sari-sari store in her residence and in addition she cultivates different kinds of vegetables and root crops in her backyard, for their own consumption and for sale. She brings her children along to the garden for the help they can provide. Her sacrifices are for her children's education. She is hoping that some day they will be uplifted by virtue of their own hard work.

loans.use: To purchase assorted grocery stock

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: moussa N. est un jeune handicapé qui travaille dans une librairie près de la gare routière de thiès;pour diversifier ses revenus,il achète des pièces détachées qu'il revend au détail à ses amis mécaniciens;c'est pour améliorer son activité qu'il sollicite un nouveau crédit
texts.en:
Moussa N. is a young disabled person who works in bookstore near the Thiès bus stop. To diversify his revenues, he buys spare parts that he sells retail to his mechanic friends. He's requesting a new loan to improve his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Lannorian

texts.en:
Lannorian T., 19, is single and has no children. She operates a canteen business. She sells seven days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Lannorian’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy mayonnaise, tinned fish, salt, sugar, onions, eggs, mixed vegetables and other ingredients for her canteen

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 55 years and married with six children. She has a grinding machine that she uses to grind tomatoes and beans. She fries akara (bean cake) to sell. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more beans to fry akara to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beans to fry more akara to sell

loans.name: Olya

texts.en: Olya M. was born in 1953 in Sevan, which is a beautiful town not far from Yerevan. Her family consists of two members: her 87-year-old mother, whom she takes care of, and herself. Olya has never been married and has no children. She finished secondary school. Before 1995, Olya worked as a shop assistant at the big local store, but then she decided to organize her own business with personal funds. Now she is busy selling ladies', men’s and children’s clothes at the trade fair. Olya needs a $550 loan to buy and sell children’s school uniforms before the beginning of the school year on the first of September.

loans.use: To buy and sell children’s school uniforms

loans.name: Cherisse

texts.en:
Cherisse B. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old. Cherisse is single. To make a living, Cherisse owns and operates a bakeshop. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Cherisse has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cherisse joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherisse is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cherisse from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor Jorge L. de 34 años de edad, es cadete de taxi en la ciudad de Managua con dos turnos diferente una semana de 5 a 2pm de la tarde y otra de 2pm hasta ahoras de la noche, muy cansado y a veces pocos clientes, pero otros días muy buenos. Reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela con una hija de once años de edad estudia el taxi es de su propiedad, lo cual compro con ahorros. Ante de comprar el vehiculo trabajaba en estesa técnica. Sus planes es  poder comprar un terreno para hacer su casa ya que vive en casa de su suegra, a si como dar estudio a su hija para que tenga mejores oportunidades de vida. Con este préstamo dará mantenimiento a su vehiculo como comprar llantas y reparación de la velocidades para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad del financiamiento para hacer posible sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge L. is 34 years old, and is a txi driver in Managua. He works two different shifts during the week, from 5am until 2 pm, and another from 2 pm until the middle of the night. Afterwards he is naturally quite tired, and sometimes he has very few customers. However, some days he gets many customers. He lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood with an 11 year old daughter who studies his taxi, the very one he bought with savings. Before he bought his taxi cab, he worked with precision control panels. His plans are to be able to buy land to turn the house his mother-in-law lives in into a study so that his daughter will have better opporotunities for life. With this loan, he will have maintenance done to his car, such as buying wheels, and to repair the speedometer in his car, to give his customers better service. He thanks AFODENIC for giving him the opportunity to make his goals possible by loaning him money.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wheels and paying for repairs for his taxi

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek S. is married with two young children. He lives with wife (pictured) in Batambong Province. Ek is currently employed as a security guard in a private security company, typically earning $4 USD per day. His wife is hired to prepare packages of fish meat, which is a kind of popular food in Batambong Province. She is able to earn an income of $2 USD per day from this work. Both of them have to work hard every day to ensure a good living for their family and children. Therefore, Ek S. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase various kinds of groceries and beverages for his wife to sell at his workplace.

loans.use: To buy groceries and beverages for resale

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a proud mother of her 6 children: Michael, aged 38, is now working abroad; Manulito, aged 37, now drives their own tricycle, a type of cab in the Philippines that has 3 wheels; Joseph, aged 35, now works as accounting staff; Verlita, aged 33, now works as teacher in their town; Jessie, aged 27, now works as a consultant in a company; and Bernandita, aged 22, is now studying 3rd year college. Lolita is proud because all of her children have finished their studies, except for Bernandita who is now currently studying. All of them are now married, except Jessie. Of course she is also proud of herself because she really works hard for success and, with the help of her husband who is now 61 years old, 3 years older than her. He has been working as a Baranggay Official in their town for 4 years now. His salary is one of their sources of income. Aside from the salary of her husband, the revenue of the tricycle that her son drives aids also to support them.

When Lolita joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she used the loan to buy rice for her buying and selling of rice business. Following the success of that business, she invested in the charcoal business. This is Lolita’s 9th cycle loan. She will use the funds to support both of these businesses. She will buy sacks of rice and supplies for the charcoal business. The charcoal business has been affected by typhoon “Ondoy”. If Lolita makes her own charcoal, she will increase her income.

Lolita’s dream now is to make her business grow so that they can build a much bigger and better house. Also, she dreams for her youngest child to finish her studies so that she can help herself and her family improve their life.

loans.use: To finance her rice and charcoal businesses.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa M. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 4 ans. Avec son prêt elle développe un petit restaurant dans lequel elle vend le petit déjeuné, cette activité lui permet de se procurer des bénéfices pour faire face aux charges quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa M. is a 53-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for four years. With her loan, she’s developing a small restaurant where she sells breakfast. This business enables her to bring in the profits for coping with day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her business

loans.name: Nhoeb

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoeb N. is 53 years old. She lives in Pour Ta Mouk Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Nhoeb N. is a farmer who grows rice on a 3-hectare (7.4-acre) field that she owns. The soil in her field is infertile, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nak Tum, is a construction worker. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel G. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 32 years old. Ariel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ariel owns and operates a business selling grilled chicken and pork in the local community. Ariel has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month doing these activities.

In 2009, Ariel joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ariel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ariel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Orchidée Plus Group

texts.en:
Orchidée Plus is a Community Bank of 33 owners of small businesses chaired by Alain. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses.

Alain, 33 and single, is a photographer. He became a microentrepreneur in 2007. Alain has already received two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. He intends to use the next loan to purchase camera accessories to resell in order to reinforce working capital. Currently he earns a profit of $30 a week.

loans.use: To purchase camera accessories to resell in order to reinforce working capital.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 26 años, vive con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de 2 años, en su casa propia.
Al terminar sus estudios secundarios empezó a trabajar, ya que las necesidades de su familia lo demandaban. Incursionó en la construcción y ahora es muy bueno en esta labor, actualmente trabaja por contrato para personas que requieren de sus servicios, ya que se ha hecho de gran fama, al igual que el compañero con el que trabaja en asociación. 
Luis siempre tiene trabajo y da gracias por ello, por tal motivo piensa para el futuro espera poder mejorar sus herramientas para brindar un mejor servicio.

Este es el primer crédito que obtiene con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con cada uno de los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará algunas herramientas que le hacen falta para el desarrollo óptimo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
