Luis is 26 years old and lives in his own home with his common law wife and their two year old child. After finishing high school, he started working in order to meet the needs of his family. He started in the construction business and became very good in this type of work. He currently works as a contractor for clients who are in need of his services. Luis has developed a good reputation. Likewise, he and his wife work together in their partnership.

Luis is grateful that he is always able to find work. For this reason, he hopes to have better tools so that he can provide better service.

This is his first loan with MFP. Luis promises to be punctual with each of his payments. The money he requested will be used to purchase a few of the tools that he is lacking that will help him to develop in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his job

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Oeurn is 54 years old and lives in Prey Snoul village in Takeo province. She is the village bank president selected by the 17 members who will all use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Sourt Kong, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice.

Aside from growing rice, Mrs. N. Oeurn is a pig breeder and her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. In order to expand the business and improve their standard of living, she has decided to ask for a loan to bU. more pigs and will use the remainder of the loan to pay for laborers. Mrs. N. Oeurn is the mother of two children who are both students in the local school. All the members are shown in the photo but some of them are obscured.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Adela Esther

texts.es:
Adela Esther B. G. con sus 51 años es la estilista en belleza mas conocida en el barrio Simon Bolívar de la Ciudad  de Barranquilla, considerado uno de las infraestructura mas integrales por su amplia cantidad de servicios alrededor de un amplio  boulevard, entre los que se encuentran  establecimientos  comerciales, zonas deportivas escolares, lugares de oración, unidades de servicios financieros y amplia ruta de transporte publico. Los Habitantes de este barrio,  se sienten muy orgullosos pues aseguran que en este amplio boulevard,  Cinco colombianos y tres alemanes tuvieron la idea de construir una Tarabita entre la costa y el interior de Colombia y funcionó la Sociedad Colombo-Alemana de Transportes Aéreos, SCADTA, y posteriormente AVIANCA haciendo de Barranquilla  la cuna de la aviación civil en el mundo.
 Adela, estudió enfermería y luego belleza, actividad que le satisface personalmente pues ofrece servicios de embellecimiento y cuidado estético  en una  pequeña sala de su local, donde realiza  peinados, cortes de cabello masculino, femenino e infantil, manicure y pedicure.  Maneja simultáneamente un servicio de llamadas telefónicas al público. En el hogar de Adela todos participan en negocios;  asi como su esposo que cuando se quedó sin trabajo inició su actividad de mensajería independiente y al mismo tiempo comercializa alimentos. Tiene cinco hijos entre las edades de 31 y 17;  todos han estudiado: los tres más jóvenes todavía están en la universidad y los demás ya trabajan. Adela aprecia mucho la educación de sus hijos y su sueño siempre ha sido que ellos estudien para que sean independientes, autosuficientes y autosuficientes, con este fin los educó. Precisamente para cumplir esta meta quiere un crédito con el cual pagar la universidad de su hija que estudia en el 5º semestre de Salud Ocupacional y que también ayuda en las actividades de su microempresa.
Adela ya lleva tres años acompañada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y se enteró de ella a través de un cliente que la vio muy limitada  y le recomendó un crédito. Dice que desde entonces se siente despajada porque compraba a crédito y ahora puede comprar de contado y en mayores cantidades que salen más económicas aunque requieran más dinero. Es más, puede vender insumos de peluquería a sus clientes, que ayuda en el crecimiento de su negocio. Le gusta ser cliente de la fundación porque no ha tenido problemas con ella y las cuotas son cómodas.
No siente haber tenido muchas dificultades en su negocio, porque desde el comienzo ha sido muy exitosa. Le ayuda la ubicación de su peluquería  en el barrio Simón Bolívar pues se encuentra justamente al pie del boulevard comercial, que concentra un gran tráfico de personas y múltiples transporte. Ahora está pensando en agrandar su peluquería porque el espacio no le permite emplear a más de una empleada.
texts.en:
Adela Esther B. G. is 51 years old and a well-known beauty stylist in the Simon Bolivar neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, which is considered to have one of the most comprehensive infrastructures. It offers a wide range of services including shops, sports venues, places of worship, financial service institutions, and an extensive public transportation route. The residents of the neighborhood are very proud that they were able to secure these amenities. Five Colombians and three Germans had the idea to build a bridge between the coast and the Colombian interior. This led to the start of Colombo-German Air Transport Society (or SCADTA), which later became Avianca, thereby making Barranquilla the birthplace of civil aviation in Latin America.

Adela studied nursing and then cosmetology. She personally finds the beauty sector to be more satisfying personally. Adela provides styling and aesthetic care services such as haircuts (for men, women, and children), manicures, and pedicures from her small location. At the same time, she manages a public telephone service. Everyone in her family participates in the business. Her husband lost his job and started an independent messaging service while selling food. They have five children between the ages of 17 and 31. All of them attended school, but the three youngest children are still in college while the others are already working. Adela is thankful that her children have the opportunity to pursue an education because her dream has always been for them to be independent, self-reliant, and self-sufficient, and an education has allowed them to achieve this goal. She is requesting a loan to pay the college expenses of her daughter, who is studying in her fifth semester of Occupational Therapy and also helps with the family microenterprise activities.

Adela has been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for three years. She learned about the organization from a one of her customers who she saw on a limited basis and suggested that she apply for a loan. Adela is opposed to buying anything on credit, but now she can make cash purchases and also acquire supplies cheaper and in large quantities even though it may require spending more money. As a stylist, she is able to sell hair products to her customers, which helps to grow her business. She enjoys being a client of the Foundation because she has not experienced any problems and her loans have been manageable.

Adela has not had many difficulties in her business because she experienced success from the very beginning. It helps that her beauty shop is located in the Simon Bolivar neighborhood because of the number of passing vehicles and presence of heavy foot traffic from the commercial boulevard. She is now planning to expand her salon because there is not enough space to accommodate more than one employee.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's college expenses

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza se formó en la parroquia Turi al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, sector conocido como el balcón de la ciudad es muy turístico por la belleza natural del campo, la gastronomía y la amabilidad de su gente, la mayor parte de su población  se dedica a la agricultura y a otras  actividades que les permiten salir adelante junto a sus familias.

La señora María G.  es socia de éste banco hace tres ciclos, goza de  una gran amistad con todas las integrantes de su banco  y es una mujer muy alegre, tiene 28 años de edad es casada y tiene cinco  hijos que se encuentran de 9, 7, 4, 2 años y el ultimo de 2 meses, su esposo es albañil y la casa en la que habitan es propia siendo el fruto de muchos años de trabajo.

Nuestra socia vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca  en el sector Punta Corral, se dedica al cultivo de tierras ajenas los días que le dan  trabajo y los otros  a cultivar sus propias tierras y al cuidado de sus animales pues   posee dos borregos y una ternera que los adquirió con los créditos obtenidos de la Fundación, y con el  dinero que reciba del nuevo préstamo va a comprar pollos y alimento  para montar este nuevo negocio. Su meta es dar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Mujer y Fortaleza" [Woman and Strength] Communal Bank was formed in the parish of Turi, southeast of the city of Cuenca. It is an area known as the "balcony of the city" and is popular with tourists due to the natural beauty of the land, the excellent food, and the friendliness of its people. Most of the population works in agriculture and in other activities that allow them and their families to get ahead. María G. has been a member of the bank for three loan cycles, and is friendly with all the other members. She is a happy woman, 28 years old and married with five children. The older ones are 9, 7, 4 and 2 years old, and the littlest one is 2 months old. Her husband is a bricklayer and their many years of hard work have enabled them to own their own home. María G. lives on the outskirts of Cuenca in the Punta Corral area. She works tending others' fields on the days in which she can find such work, and on the other days she tends to her own land and animals. She has two lambs and a calf that she bought with funds borrowed through the Kiva field partner, and with the money from this new loan she is going to buy chickens and feed to get this new endeavor going. Her goal is to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and corn for their feed

loans.name: Madjiguene

texts.fr: Madame Madjiguene est une femme marie  de 46 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou  a Yoff. Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2000. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 3 prêts antérieurs. Elle a 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 7 et 25 ans. Elle s’active depuis 13 ans dans le commerce d’habits, de chaussures, de draps et de téléviseurs. En même temps elle vend du jus et de la crème. Elle a choisi cette activité par l’intermédiaires de sa grand-mère qui l’a beaucoup influence. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les profits que lui procurent cette activiste. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour l’achat de thioub. Son objectif est de diversifier ses marchandises, augmenter ses profits et améliorer  sa situation familiale.
texts.en:
Ms. Madjiguene is a 46-year-old married woman.  She lives in the Ngaparou district in Yoff.  She has been a member of the lending group U-IMCEC since June 2000 and has already benefited from three previous loans.  Madjiguene has four children ranging from 7 to 25 years of age.  She has been active for thirteen years in the commerce of clothing, shoes, bed sheets, and televisions.  At the same time, she sells juice and cream.  She chose this work through her grandmother, who influenced her a lot.  The most interesting thing to Madjiguene is the profits that this business provides. She's requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for buying thioub (a type of dyed cloth).  Her goal is to diversify her merchandise, to increase her profits, and to improve her family's situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her capital

loans.name: Obidullah Group

texts.en: Fozia is a member of Obidullah group. She lives in the fifteenth district of Kabul, Afghanistan and is married with three children — 12, 8, and 4. She has a bakery in her house and is famous for the bread she bakes, so she has lots of clients every day. She would like this loan to buy flour, fire wood, etc. for her business. Fozia is glad that, through her business, she can help support her children by buying notebooks and pens for their school. She wants her children be educated and also to  grow her business.

loans.use: purchasing flour and firewood

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en: Mariafe P.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting coconut in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Mariafe has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Mariafe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase products to sell. Mariafe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia D. sells onions and other food supplies and also sells body lotion at Akotokyire. She has received junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and she supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Afia’s loan will be used to buy more onions and body lotions for sale. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more onions and body lotions to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: 51-year-old Fe D. lives in the first Barangay (village) of the province of Antique along with her 56-year-old husband and six children who range in age from 15 to 24 years old. Despite being poor, Fe and her family have been able to enjoy their lives by maximizing the resources of their community. Her husband and her 23-year-old son are fishermen and have been earning money through fishing. Fe sells the fish they catch in their neighborhood. Someday Fe wishes that her husband and child would be able to go fishing more often and catch more fish by having their own fishing motorboat. Through this, Fe would be able to sell more fish in the market and in their neighborhood for bigger revenue. Aside from that, she also wants to have her own small “sari-sari” (variety) store where she sells a few varieties of foodstuffs, beverages and other basic commodities. To be able to do this, Fe is requesting a much larger loan through ASHI. Proceeds of her business will be used to support the education of her two children who are still in school and augment an improved the life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and a motorboat for fishing.

loans.name: Jailer

texts.es:
Jailer S. A. de 37 años es oriundo del Carmen de Bolívar, donde tienen sus tierras él y su papá, ambos siembran, Jailer ñame y su papá yuca en su terreno. Desde muy pequeño conoce y aprecia las delicias de estos dos productos, por eso justamente son la base de  su principal negocio que desarrolla en el municipio de Soledad, donde vive con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 años.

Jailer se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana y en su moto lleva los productos que piden las 25 tiendas que en la actualidad tiene como clientes, él reparte durante toda la mañana, ñame, yuca y también cuando hay cosecha el famoso y muy reconocido aguacate “carmero” o sea sembrado en  “El Carmen de Bolívar” 

Jailer no todas las veces trae ñame y yuca sembrados en su  tierra  y la de su papá, también compra en Ovejas y  en Montería cuando se hace necesario; como en la actualidad quiere vender en estos municipios el empaque de estos productos   y aprovechar el mismo viaje para traer  su ñame, yuca y aguacate, está solicitando un crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, (organización donde está desde el año hace dos años) por valor de $2.000.000, con él comprará 50 resistentes bolsas llenas de yuca y ñame, aguacates carmeros que le dan buena utilidad y empaques que venderá en el mercado de los municipios proveedores de su producto.

Este negocio lo inició Jailer cuando se retiró de la Central de Abastos por su extenso horario de trabajo  de 3: 00 AM a 8: 00 PM, agravado por su muy bajo el salario, la poca dedicación de  tiempo a su familia y además,  porque permanecía con agotamiento permanente; así fue como decidido, independizarse e iniciar su negocio de vender verduras, tomate de árbol y aguacate, buscando la mejor opción que generara mejores ingresos y como conocía a muchos tenderos, empezó a hacer la preventa y pronto se llenó de muchos pedidos especialmente de ñame, yuca y aguacate.

Desde que llegó a la Fundación ha logrado pasar de tener como medio de transporte una bicicleta a una moto, en la que carga sus bultos, y acceder a mayor número de clientes, con mayor cantidad de sus  productos, porque antes los compraba a crédito a plazo de un día, y si le quedaban en existencia tenia dificultades con su proveedores viajeros y perdía credibilidad en el mercado. Hora trabaja mas holgado con su dinero de crédito y sueña con que su hijo se convierta en un profesional y respecto a él se ve en el futuro con una camioneta distribuidora de productos de la canasta doméstica y  extendido en toda Barranquilla y otros municipios del departamento del Atlántico.
texts.en:
Jailer S. A. is 37 years old and a native of Carmen de Bolivar, which is where he and his father own farmland on which they grow cassava and yams. From a young age, he has come to know and appreciate the delight associated with these two products since they form the basis of his main business that he developed in the town of Soledad. There he lives with his family, which consists of his wife and ten year old son.

Jailer wakes up every morning at 5am and delivers his products by motorcycle to 25 stores that make up his existing customer base. Throughout the morning he distributes cassava and yams that he harvested, as well as the famous “carmero” avocado that is grown in Carmen de Bolivar.

Jailer may not always have yams and cassava to sell from either his land or his father’s, so he also buys sheep in Montería when necessary. He wants to take advantage of his trips to Montería by seizing the opportunity to sell yams, cassava, and avocados while he is there. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (which he joined two years ago) in the amount of 2,000,000 COP. He will buy 50 sturdy bags filled with cassava, yams, and carmero avocados so that he can sell his products in the markets where his suppliers are located.

Jailer started this business after he quit his job at the central municipal supply depot, where he worked an extensive schedule from 3am to 8pm, which was made worse by the low pay. Due to the exhaustion and the lack of time to devote to his family, he decided to become independent and start selling vegetables, tomato plants, and avocados. He is always looking for better ways to earn more income and eventually became acquainted with several shopkeepers who started ordering yams, cassava, and avocados from him.

Since joining Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Jailer has been able to upgrade his means of transportation from a bicycle to a motorcycle so that he can travel with cargo, access more customers, and sell more of his products because credit was available to him. Otherwise, he would have had difficulty traveling to his suppliers and would have eventually lost credibility in the marketplace. He is now more comfortable working with credit and dreams of seeing his son become a professional and looking up to him. In the future, he hopes to own a distribution truck so that he can sell basic necessities throughout Barranquilla and in other towns in the district of Atlántico.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 50 bags of cassava, yams, and avocados to sell

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Being a mother, Anabel T.’s aspirations in life are all focused on the welfare of her children. Despite living in poverty, she is determined to achieve her goals no matter how hard she needs to work to make this happen. She will do this with her husband, who is always by her side and committed to accompany her through life.   

Today, Anabel's main goal is to build a home for her family and keep everyone safe from harm. She plans to pay for this home by raising pigs, and with help from her husband, who is an office worker. She joined ASHI in 2007 and has used several previous loans to establish her livestock business. She is now applying for a new loan to increase the number of piglets she can raise and sell for a profit.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain is is 33 years old, married without children. Sylvain works hard in order to get all the necessities for his family. Sylvain owns a business selling various products such as: cosmetics, biscuits, rice, sugar, and so on. This business is profitable in his residence place, and that is the reason why it was chosen by him. Sylvain is a young entrepreneur in this field because he has one year of experience. The hours of his daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day.

Sylvain is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products for his shop. This loan will be used to attract more customers which will be one of the ways of earning more profit.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Freddy Wilfrido

texts.es:
Freddy Wilfrido V. L. tiene 30 años.  Es soltero y vive con su padres y niña Melani (20 meses), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Freddy es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Freddy trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada semana, y sus ventas cada 4 o 6 meses, en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para cultivar papas. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a trabajar bien. Quisiera seguir adelante trabajando y dar estudios a su hija. Enfrenta enfermedades y dificultad para comprar los insumos. 

Le gusta hacer deportes: jugar indoor fútbol y voleibol.
texts.en:
Freddy Wilfrido V. L. is 30 years old. He’s single and lives with his parents and his daughter, Melani (20 months old) in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. Freddy is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank which is located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are corn and potato farmers. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San José. Freddy farms potatoes, wheat, barley and corn. He makes his purchases weekly and his sales every four or six months in Guaranda. He is asking for funding to buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his potato crops. He feels that this loan will help him work well. He’d like to continue working to provide for his daughter’s education. He faces illnesses and difficulties to buy raw materials. He enjoys playing sports like indoor football and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es: Marta es de 21 años de edad, se dedica a confeccionar sudaderos de diferentes estilos y tallas, lo que le ha ayudado a sufragar sus gastos, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente seis años de experiencia, solicita su segundo préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo compra de materiales para confeccionar sudaderos, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajado.
texts.en:
Marta is 21 years old and manufactures pullover jackets in different styles and sizes, which helps with covering her expenses. She has approximately six years of experience in this business.

Marta is requesting her second loan so that she can increase her operating capital. She plans to buy materials for making pullover jackets. Her personal references indicate she is a responsible and hardworking individual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making pullover jackets

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Mr. Dara T., age 41, has been with his second wife, Mrs. Sreytoch Hok, age 41, since 1990. He has four children. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, another one assists her mother in the business and one attends school. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Dara has been a motor taxi driver for ten years, while his wife has been selling vegetables in the Phnom Penh market for ten years. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for his daughter, who is a garment factory worker, to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique A. is from the village of Sta Isabel Norte. He is 38 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Enrique owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Enrique has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Enrique joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enrique is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Enrique from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Azanmassou

texts.fr: S. a ouvert  depuis plus de 9 ans une imprimerie qu'il exploite. il réalise de grandes recettes à l'approche de la rentrée scolaires, et comme ce moment est arrivé il veut pouvoir mettre tous les atouts de son côté et pouvoir bien travailler. il sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter les matières premières indispensable à son activité d'imprimerie pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle en ce début de rentrée scolaire.
texts.en:
About nine years ago, Mr. Soussou has opened a printing shop he still operates. When the new school year approaches, he is able to raise significant revenues. Now that this time of the year has come again, he would like to be able to do everything possible in order to do a good job. He is seeking his tenth loan from WAGES in order to purchase supplies necessary to his printing shop in order to meet to his client’s needs at the beginning of this new school y

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing printing supplies

loans.name: C4580 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 40 years old and married with two children who are 10 and 12 years old.  Jean de Dieu is the leader of a group called Abahuje and this group has owned a barbershop for a long time.  The business hours are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Jean and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, the group will buy additional equipment such as chairs and they will start a new barbershop of women.  If successful, this team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for a better future for their business as well as their families.

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita E. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Ramonita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ramonita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2000, Ramonita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramonita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Ramonita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Ramonita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en: Burastan K. has been selling shoes since 1998. She is a very energetic and successful businesswoman. Burastan has good relationships with many customers, who are very satisfied with her positive attitude, personalized service, and who prefer buying shoes only from her. To acquire new shoes for her inventory, Burastan has applied for this loan to cover part of her costs.

loans.use: purchasing new shoes for her inventory

loans.name: Mercy Aba Atta

texts.en: Mercy Aba Atta A. is married and has two children. She has received senior high education. Mercy is a hair dresser at Elmina. Her husband is a driver. Mercy uses the income she makes from her sales to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Mercy is asking to use the loan to purchase more hair creams to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to reinvest into her business by purchasing more hair products.

loans.use: To purchase more hair creams to expand her business.

loans.name: Vienna May

texts.en:
Vienna May C. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 34 years old. Vienna May is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Vienna May owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk food, in the local community. Vienna May has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vienna May joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vienna May has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Vienna May is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vienna May from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: James Njogu

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years. He is 54 years old, and married to Nancy Wambui with four children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our credit officers. This will be his fourth loan. He has repaid all his previous loans on time. He plans to buy a dairy cow with the loan.

In the future, he plans to buy more cows and a large farm for large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena P. is from the village of Crossing Airport, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old. Lucena is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and sells rice by the kilogram in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $115 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Lucena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional rice to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell

location.town: Crossing Airport, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Joaquin Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Joaquín se dedica a la fabricación y arreglo de  flotas ya hace bastante tiempo, vive en alquiler con su esposa y su hijo, trabaja con una empresa ya ocho años quienes le contratan  para soldar, armar el esqueleto de la flota ya que es muy conocido por los  sus clientes por el buen trabajo que realiza, el dueño de dicha empresa tiene mucha confianza en el porque hace muy buen trabajo. Don Joaquín  solicito el crédito para el incremento de la compra de una movilidad ya que vive en un lugar alejado de donde el trabaja y con la movilidad  le será mas fácil y cómodo llegar a su trabajo, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Joaquín works making and fixing vehicles.  He has been in this business for quite a long time.  He lives in a rental house with his wife and child and, for the past eight years, he has been working for a company who hire him to weld and assemble the chassis of the vehicles.  He is very well known by his customers for the good work that he does.  The owner of the company has a lot of faith in him because he does a very good job.

Joaquín requested this loan to help him buy a car since he lives a long way from where he works and, with a vehicle, it would be easier and more comfortable to drive to work.  Joaquín is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered.

loans.use: To help buy a car

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado B. is from the village of Aurora. He is 44 years old. Conrado is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-four years and earns approximately $183 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Conrado joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es: El señor José Santos J. Marin  desde hace 3 años se dedica al transporte escolar, esta es la manera que el percibe un ingreso para abastecer los gastos de su familia. El camión donde trabaja y traslada al estudiante esta fallando es por ello que el pide el apoyo para darle mantenimiento para que este en mejores condiciones. José quiere dar un mejor servicio y así poder tener más ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Santos J. Marin has driven a school bus for the past 3 years, which is how he generates income to support his family.  The van that he uses for his work transporting students is failing.  He is requesting support so that he can make some repairs so that it will be in better condition.  José wants to be able to provide an excellent level of service, so he can augment his income and offer his family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To make repairs to his mode of transportation.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna, es una mujer dichosa, pues está contenta de poseer una familia unida, y trabajadora, que lo conforman su esposo Edmar, y su hija Kaori, con quienes vive en su casa propia, ubicada en Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Durante todo el día. Giovanna, se dedica a la venta de tamales, chicharrón, y una variedad de frutas, en un puesto que queda a orillas del puente. Ya tiene 15 años vendiendo en este lugar y; en todo este tiempo pudo adquirir buenos clientes. Diariamente vende un promedio de 30 a 40 tamales, pero según cuenta que en los meses de marzo, abril y mayo, que es la campaña agrícola de café, vende en mayores cantidades, y sus ingresos se duplican. Ahora ella desea ambientar su negocio para poder generar más ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es una socia respetada, por su vitalidad y ganas de salir adelante. Giovanna, con la moto carro (medio de trasporte público) que adquirió; incursionó en el trasporte público, por ello con el crédito comprará piezas para su mantenimiento, asimismo comprará insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a woman who is happy because she has a united and hardworking family, made up of her husband Edmar and her daughter Kaori, with whom she lives in their own house in Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle). 

During the day, Giovanna sells tamales, pork cracklings and assorted fruits from a stall beside the bridge. She has been selling in this spot for 15 years, during which time she has acquired good customers. She sells an average of 30 to 40 tamales a day, but during the months of March, April and May, which is the coffee season, she sells many more and her revenue doubles. 

Now she wants to change her business to generate more profit. This is Giovanna's sixth loan with MFP. She belongs to the Comerciantes communal bank, where she is a member who is respected for her vitality and desire to succeed. With the motorbike (means of public transport) she acquired, she has taken her first steps into public transportation. So, she will use this loan to buy parts to maintain the motorbike, and she will also buy supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy parts to maintain her motorbike, plus supplies for the food she prepares

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn M. is from the village of San Antonio, Cabisera 18, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Marilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 32000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for rice farm

loans.name: Kribian Del Rosario

texts.es: Kribian del Rosario S. Velazquez es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de salchipollo y hamburguesas en las afueras de su casa, eligió esta actividad hace 2 años por que tenia que mantener a su pequeña hija ya que no cuenta con el apoyo economico de su ex pareja, su meta a futuro es tener su propio restaurante donde quiere vender  todo tipo de aperitivos al paso y comidas tipicas de esta region, ella cuenta con  buenas referencias personales y es muy conocida y apreciada por sus vecinos ,con el dinero comprara mesas y sillas para su negocio y asi poder atender mejor a sus clientes
texts.en: Kribian del Rosario S. Velazquez is a single mother and sells salchipollo (a local dish made with chicken, french fries and seasonings) and hamburgers. She chose this activity because she needed to support her little daughter, since she could not count on help from her ex husband. Her goal for the future is to have her own restaurant with every type of fast food appetizers. She has good personal references. She is very well known and appreciated by her neighbors. She will buy tables and chairs for her her business and thus be able to attend to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, de 38 años, es una luchadora mujer que día a día labora para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos pero solo vive con 4 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada a la afueras de la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Ella, evita hablar de la situación difícil que vivió con el padre de sus hijos. Pero rescata que aprendió a valorarse como mujer, y siendo muy emprendedora, comenzó a dedicarse en la venta de cerveza y bebidas gasificadas, con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos; además prepara comida para expenderla en su recreo turístico “La Inolvidable”, que recién instaló. Por otro lado cría decenas de patos y gallinas que luego son vendidos así como también lo utiliza para la preparación de sus potajes. Daniela cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, por eso el negocio le resulta rentable pues no tiene que pagar a terceras personas para que le ayuden en la cocina. Su espíritu emprendedor le lleva a instalar una granja para que pueda vender animales menores al por mayor, puesto que un tiempo anterior percibió buena cantidad de capital al vender decenas de cuyes; orgullosa cuenta además  “críe 120 gallinas, las hice crecer desde muy tiernas y las comercialicé cada una a 35 soles, por eso estoy segura que este negocio me resultará muy beneficioso”. Concluye.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las brisas”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, le gusta trabajar de manera organizada y siempre velando por el bienestar de los socios. Daniela, compra constantemente mercadería para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará los insumos necesarios para que prepare comida, además de cerveza, bebidas gasificadas y algunos dulces.
texts.en:
Daniela, 38, is a fighter; she struggles every day to so that her family can get ahead.  She is a single mother of five children but only four of them still live with her in her own house located in the outskirts of the city of San Rafael (Peruvian central jungle).  

She tries to avoid talking about the difficult situation she lived with the father of her children.  But she does state that what she managed to rescue from the experience is to value herself as a woman and, being very enterprising, she started to sell beer and carbonated soft drinks with the goal of supporting her children.  She also prepares food to sell at her tourist stop ‘La Inolvidable” (The Unforgettable One) that she recently opened.  On the other hand, she raises ducks and chickens that are later sold or used in the preparation of her stews.  Daniela’s children help her and this is why the business is profitable: she does not have to pay salaries to kitchen help.  

Her enterprising spirit led her to set up a farm in order to sell small farm animals at wholesale because sometime ago she made a good amount of money selling guinea pigs by the dozen.  Proudly she adds:  “I raised 120 chickens.  I cared for them since they were very young and sold them for 35 soles a piece.  This is why I’m so sure that this business will have very beneficial results.” She concludes.

She is a member of the “Las Brisas” (The Breezes) communal bank and this is the 8th loan with MFP.  Because she’s already familiar with the communal bank’s work methodology she likes to work in an organized way always caring for the wellbeing of the members.

Daniela is constantly buying merchandise for her business so will be using the requested loan to buy the ingredients necessary to prepare her food as well as beer, carbonated soft drinks and some sweets.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her stews as well as to buy beer and carbonated soft drinks.

loans.name: Hannah Kabura

texts.en: For the last 20 years, Hannah has worked as a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. She is 68 years old, single and has one child. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is now applying for her fourth loan. She paid her first three loans on time and will use her new one to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth M. is from the city of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old. Janeth is married and has two school-aged children. Janeth owns and operates a motor transport service. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Janeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Janeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda tiene 3 7 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en la compañía Beni Loma de la ciudad de Carapegua.
Desde temprana edad empezó a ayudar a su madre a confeccionar las colchas artesanales, de quién aprendió el oficio, hoy en día ella misma lleva a  vender sus productos en la zona de la capital del país con la ayuda de su marido, gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa y brindar buena atención a sus hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 37 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She lives in the Beni Loma neighborhood in the city of Carapegua.

From an early age, she began to help her mother make artisanal bedspreads.  She learned how to do it from her mother, and now she herself brings her products to sell in the capital region of the country, with the help of her husband.  Thanks to this work, she has been able to build a modest house and take good care of her children.

She is asking for the loan to purchase merchandise (hammocks, blankets, bands, and sheets), since she has many orders for these products.

loans.use: to purchase bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Kattia Maria

texts.es:
Kattia María M. Q., tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera ella  vive con sus dos hijos menores de edad, la señora tuvo que abandonar la secundaria por motivo de que tenía que trabajar para generar ingresos en su hogar, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable.
La señora ha sido clienta de fundación en dos ocasiones ella en los anteriores ha mantenido una excelente moral de pago, los crédito anteriores también fueron para fortalecer su capital de trabajo
Con este crédito la señora Kattia piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería para su peluquería, ya que viene días festivos del año y necesita tener surtido su negocio
La señora tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al negocio, ella tiene una peluquería ella empezó con haciendo manicure y poco a poco fue capacitándose en belleza,  tiene una peluquería en San José centro, desde hace mas de  15 años alquila el local, donde se encuentra ubicado es un buen punto.
Kattia nos cuenta que se levanta temprano, hace las labores domesticas, y después se va a trabajar y regresa hasta las siete de la noche, hace la cena y les ayuda a sus hijos a ser la tarea, sus hijos se los cuida su mamá, Kattia nos cuenta que ella desea tener un carro para transportarse a su negocio.
Con este crédito la señora podrá tener más capital de trabajo para fortalecer su negocio y poder cumplir su objetivo
texts.en:
Kattia María M. Q., 43, is a single mother living with her two minor children.  She had to drop out of secondary school because she had to earn money for her household.  She is a very hard working, responsible person.

She has been a client of the Fundación on two previous occasions and she kept an excellent payment behavior in both of them.  The past loans were also to strengthen her working capital.

Kattia wants to use this loan to buy merchandise for her beauty salon because annual holidays are approaching and she wants to have it well stocked.

She’s been in business for over 20 years.  She has a beauty salon.  She started out doing manicures and gradually trained in beauty.  She has had a beauty salon that she rents in downtown San José for over 15 years; it’s located in a good spot.

Kattia tells us that she rises early, does her domestic chores and then goes to work.  She returns home at 7pm, prepares dinner and helps her children with their homework.  Her mother babysits the children.  Kattia tells us that she’d like to have a car to get to work.  With this loan, she’ll have more working capital to strengthen her business and meet her objective.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Belinda has a retail shop that sells yellow and green bananas. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy additional bananas to sell.

Belinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Belinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional yellow and green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Roberto; el tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en un hotel en el área de jardinería, ella es cuidante de todo el área de jardinería sembrando diferentes flores y también el socio se dedica al negocio de ganadería, el es propietario de vacas y lo vende en las diferentes ferias del distrito de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados y también mejorar en su trabajo en el área de jardinería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para las vacas y para comprar una vaca.
                                                 
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Roberto belongs to the Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Roberto is 28, has a life partner, and has three children.  He alternates his daily activities with his gardening work at a hotel.  He takes care of all of the garden area, and he plants different flowers.  

He also devotes himself to the livestock business.  He has cows, and he sells them at the different fairs in the district of Urubamba.

He wants to expand his business of selling livestock.  He also wants to improve his gardening work.  He requests the loan to buy feed for the cows and to buy a cow.

He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy feed for the cows and to buy a cow.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto Antonio de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijas en su casa. Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado para sacar adelante a su familia que son la razón de su vida. Roberto posee un pequeño puesto en el cual vende variedad de sandalias para todas las edades, género y gustos. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy estratégica en la cual muchas personas  demandan su producto ya que ofrece buenos precios y calidad en sus productos. Este negocio lo es todo para Roberto, ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y durante muchos años le ha ayudado a sostener económicamente su hogar. Últimamente ha notado una tendencia creciente en la demanda de sus productos y esto lo ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de comprar variedad y nuevos estilos de sandalias para las diferentes edades, géneros y gustos.  De esta forma espera  mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Roberto Antonio is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters in his house. For a long time, he has tried to get his family ahead, since they are his reason for living. Roberto has a small stall where he sells sandals for all ages, tastes, and both genders. His business is located in a very strategic area where a lot of people want his product, since he offers good prices and quality. This business is everything for Roberto, since it is his main source of income and for many years it has helped support his home. Lately he has noticed a growing demand for his products and this has motivated him to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy a variety of new styles of sandals for different ages and tastes and both genders. In this way, he hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new styles of sandals for different ages, genders and tastes.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa, 40, lives in the Philippines and is separated with two children. For five years, she has been selling beauty products from Avon and kitchen products from Tupperware. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stock from Avon and Tupperware.

Tomasa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Avon and Tupperware.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with two children, aged seven and two years. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past ten years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He is 27 years old and married to Jane.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan.  He paid off all of his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to open up a salon which will be run by his wife.  This will increase their income. 

In the future, John hopes to grow in the transport industry and own a number of minibuses.

loans.use: To open up a salon

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: La Sra. Mariela es una mujer trabajadora, con deseos de superación y lograr sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella es casada y se dedica a la venta de comida rapida como son salchipapas, hamburguesas y salchipollos; lleva trabajando en este negocio más de 5 años, el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y así comenzar otro tipo de negocio como es la venta de la misma; la Sra. Mariela tiene el sueño familiar de tener su casa construida de material noble y su meta es tener un restaurante en su casa y así poder vender mucho más. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que va a poder empezar otro negocio y asi va a tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Senora Mariela is a hardworking woman with a desire to excel and raise her children. She is married. She sells fast food such as sausage and french fries, burgers and chicken and chips. She has been doing this work for more than 5 years. The loan granted is going to be used to buy clothing thus starting another kind business by selling the clothing. Senora Mariela has a dream, familiar to all, of building her house with top quality materials. Her goal is to have a restaurant in her house and so sell a lot more. She is very gratefull for the loan granted as she will be able to start another business and so have a better income.

loans.use: to buy clothes which she will then sell.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз женат и у них 3 детей. Он умный и добрый человек. Абдуазиз занимается приготовлением блюд на своем местном городе. Он имеет свою столовую и у него много клиентов, которые каждый день посещает его столовую. Кроме этого он занимается купля продажей скот. Более 12 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и у него очень хороший опыт. Абдуазиз запрашивает займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки скота и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Abduaziz is married and has three children.  He is a smart and kind person.  Abduaziz is involved in food preparation in his local town.  He owns a cafe and has many customers, who visit his cafe every day.  Besides this, he is involved in buying and selling livestock.  He has been in this business for over 12 years and has good experience in it.  Abduaziz is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of livestock and expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram is a 41-year-old married woman and mother to two beautiful children. To help her husband with their family's income, Ikram started a small business three years ago.  She works as a tailor making curtains and living room shields.  She also fixes dresses and makes beautiful new ones.  Ikram also sells underwear, in addition to towels and winter blankets. She is a multi-business woman who works hard to keep her business running and improving.

Ikram is experiencing an Al Majmoua loan for the first time.  She knew about it from her neighbor, who gave her a very positive and impressive feedback about his loan through Al Majmoua-KIVA and his business progress, and now she's very excited to share her experience with them.

Her requested loan will be used to buy a new sewing machine and its tools.  This machine will help in doing extra jobs in less time and with perfect quality.  Ikram hopes to open a big tailoring factory in the future to expand her business as much as she can, and to make sure her family's future is secured.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine and its tools

loans.name: Rusayumbe Abamwe Group

texts.en: David requests another loan to plant soya beans.  He used the previous loan to pay workers who cleared land that was used to grow maize.David harvested thirty sacks of grain from the land.  He says that the whole group benefited from the previous loans.  David wants to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy soya beans to plant.

loans.name: Debora Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Debora Elizabeth es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella es docente desde hace 13 años y para ayudarse en los gastos vende distintos productos desde ropa, lácteos y trucha. Con el crédito comprara crema, mantequilla, zapatos, ropa de cama.
texts.en:
Sra. Debora Elizabeth is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She has been a teacher for 13 years. To help with her expenses, she also sells different products such as clothing, dairy products, and trout.

With this loan she will buy cream, butter, shoes, and bed sheets.

loans.use: to buy cream, butter, shoes, and bed sheets.

loans.name: Banana B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Banana B Group in Western Kenya! Gelan is the facilitator of Banana B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Gelan takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season,Gelan had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Gelan was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gelan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Gelan will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Banana B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mercedes Alicia

texts.es:
Mercedes de 40 años, decidió dedicarse a la venta de comida ya que en el sector en el que vive es muy poblado y no hay restaurants.

Lo realiza solo todos los días sin horarios fijos. El único problema que se le presenta es el mal clima. 
Está casada pero vive independientemente de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años que estudian en colegio fiscal. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere contruir mejor su casa por tal motivo quiere el prestamo para comprar cemento, arena y bloques. Su meta es poder comprar más mesas y sillas para así poder agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 40 years old.  She decided to sell food because there are many people who live in her neighborhood, but there are no restaurants.  Mercedes works every day, but without a set schedule.  The only problem that she must deal with is bad weather.  

Mercedes is married, but lives independently from her husband.  She has two children, age 17 and 14, who attend a public school.  

She has many goals for her business, which is why she wants to build a better home. With this loan she will buy cement, sand and blocks. Her goal is to buy more tables and chairs so that she can expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, and paint.

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Norma, de 47 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, es comerciante se dedica la venta de artesanías, es viuda, madre de 6 hijos. Sus comienzo fuero difíciles cuando quedo viuda emigro a Costa Rica en busca de una oportunidad de trabajo que le ayudara a solventar los gastos de manutención de sus 6 hijos, trabajo de domestica cuando regreso  a su tierra se propuso tener su propio negocio para no tener que trabajarle a nadie invirtió en la venta de artesanía poco a poco su negocio que empezó con 5 piezas de artesanías ahora distribuye fuera de su ciudad y vende a Costa Rica con este negocio termino de criar a sus hijos para que no les hiciera falta nada.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar artesanías para aumentar el volumen de ventas. Pues su visión de futuro es poner una tienda de artesanía con la capacidad de exportar fuera de Nicaragua a los países vecinos
texts.en:
Norma, age 47, lives in Leon. She is a merchant and sells crafts. She is a widow and has six children. In the beginning things were difficult for her. When she was widowed, she emigrated to Costa Rica in search of work so that she could provide for her six children. She worked as a maid. When she returned home she decided to have her own business so that she wouldn't have to work for anyone. She invested in selling crafts, starting with only five pieces. Her business grew bit by bit. She now distributes outside of her city and sells to Costa Rica. This business will last her until her children are grown and allow her to ensure that they lack nothing.
She needs this loan for the purchase of crafts to increase her sales. Her vision for the future is to open a craft store with the capacity to export outside of Nicaragua, to the neighbouring countries.

loans.use: to buy crafts

loans.name: Brenda Carolina

texts.es: Emprendedora, alegre , juvenil y con un gran deseo de su superación se refleja en la Joven de 24 años de edad  llamada Brenda, originaria de León, soltera, estudiante de la carrera de turismo, dueña de un pequeño cyber café. Ella nos expresa la enorme satisfacción y agradecimiento por la oportunidad brindada atravez del préstamo Kiva, el cual utilizo para comprar una impresora/fotocopiadora que la ha ayudado a generar nuevos ingresos por la afluencia de personas es constante solicitándole este servicio en especial los estudiantes de secundaria y universitarios. Siempre con visión de crecer como empresaria ha puesto en su cyber el servicio de mini librería donde oferta artículos escolares. Es por tal motivo que solicita un segundo crédito para la compra de dos computadoras y compra de mercadería para surtir su mini librería. Desea ampliar su local ofreciendo un bue servicio a sus clientes que la haga diferente a los demás por el momento su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación pero ve la necesidad de buscar un lugar mas amplio que es por lo cual esta ahorrando para un día llegar a tener capital para tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Entrepreneurialism, joy, youthfulness, and a great desire to succeed are all reflected in this 24-year-old young woman named Brenda.  She is from León and is single.  She is studying for a degree in tourism, and runs a small cyber cafe.  She tells us about her enormous satisfaction and gratitude for the opportunity provided by the Kiva loan.  She used it to purchase a printer/photocopier which helped her to generate more income from the influx of people who constantly request this service, especially students at secondary schools and universities.

With her ongoing vision of growing as a business-woman, she has started a mini-store service in her cyber cafe, where she offers school supplies for sale.  It is for this reason that she is requesting a second loan for the purchase of two computers, and to purchase merchandise to stock up her mini-store.  She wants to expand her premises to offer a good service to her customers which will differentiate her from other cyber cafes.  For now her business is run in her home, but she sees the necessity of looking for a larger location.  This is what she is saving for currently, so that one day she will have capital for having her own premises.

loans.use: to purchase two computers and merchandise for her mini-store.

loans.name: Leofe

texts.en:
Leofe is from Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte.  She is thirty-three years old.  Leofe is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Leofe runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as cigarettes, shampoo and laundry soap.  Leofe has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately PHP 4,000 per month for these activities.

Leofe is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  In 2009, Leofe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells cassava and plantain at Efutu. 

She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. 

Aba has been selling food for 30 years now. She uses her income to help  her husband to provide for  their family. 

Aba will use her loan to purchase more food to sell. With the new profit, Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase food for sale.

loans.name: Hazratkul

texts.ru: Хазраткул заботливый семьянин любящий отец. У него трое детей из них двое несовершеннолетние. Жена домохозяйка. Также на иждивении у него находятся его родители. Он уважает и любит своих родителей. Для содержания своей семьи он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и предоставлением услуг по строительству. Он работает штукатурщиком и каменщиком. Он не боится тяжелого труда. Он хочет получить займ в размере 2000 сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота и концентрированного корма. Он просит поддержать его и предоставить займ. Он благодарит заранее тех, кто поддержит его. Спасибо
texts.en: Hazratkul is a caring family man and loving father. He has three children, two of them are minors. His wife is a housewife. His parents are also dependent on him. He respects and loves his parents. To support his family he grows crops and works in construction. He has worked as a bricklayer and plasterer. He is not afraid of hard work. He wants to get a loan of 2000 Somoni to purchase cattle and concentrated feed. He is asking for support and a loan. He would like to thank in advance all of those who are supporting him. Thank you

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for them

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en: Melisa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Melisa has operated a retail shop for 10 years, buying and selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 05 mai 2012  est composé de 32 femmes issues du meme village. Elles ont pour activité principale l'agriculture.

Madame Aissatou à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe.Elle est âgée de 48 ans.Elle a pour activité principale le commerce de denrées alimentaires.Elle est mariée et mére de 08 enfants dont 02 garçons. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en oignons:150kg,en poissons séchés:200kg et en riz:200 kg ,ainsi elle pourra faire face à la demande de sa clientéle.

Son objectif est d'accroitre son épargne,d'assurer la santé de ses enfants et participer à l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" Koukou was founded on 5 May 2012. The group consists of 32 women from the same village. Their main business activity is agriculture.

Madame Aissatou is the leader of the group. She is standing on the far right of the photo with her arm raised. She is 48 years old. Her main business activity is trading general foodstuffs. She is married and is mother to 8 children including 2 boys.

This loan will enable her to buy: 150 kg of onion, 200 kg of dried fish and 200 kg of rice so that she will be able to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Her goal is to increase her savings, ensure the health of her children and take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy onions, dried fish and rice

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es una señora de 43 años originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente de León, madre de soltera de tres hijos dos de ellos a su cargo uno que estudia en la universidad y el otro en la secundaria.
Con su salario de maestra ha hecho el esfuerzo por tener a sus hijos estudiando, ya que su gran reto es que sean profesionales.
Ella imparte clases de consejería a los niños de primaria en un colegio de la localidad dese hace doce años.
María Eugenia está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien dicho crédito para pagar los gastos universitarios de su hijo y el pasaje de un viaje ya que está estudiando una carrera profesional fuera del  país y esta de vacaciones por aquí Nicaragua.

A pesar de que está becado ella como madre responsable tiene que costear el pasaje de ida y regreso y algunos gastos de la universidad.
Tiene la esperanza en Dios y en estas personas que apoyen su solicitud para poder enviar a su hijo a esta universidad.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a 43-year-old woman who comes from the municipality of El Sauce, a settlement located west of León. She is the single mother of three children. Two of them are her dependents, one studying at university and the other in secondary school. 

With her salary as a teacher, she has made the effort to have her children attend university, since her great goal is to see them become professionals. 

For the past twelve years, she has given council classes to the primary-grade children at a school in her area. 

María Eugenia is requesting a loan from the Kiva lenders so that they will finance this loan through Ceprodel to pay her son's university expenses and his travel to Cuba, since he is studying for a professional degree in that country, and he is currently spending his vacation here in Nicaragua. 

Although he is on scholarship, she as the responsible parent has to pay for his round-trip travel and for some university costs. 

She "has faith in God and in the people who support her request so that she can send her son to this university."

loans.use: to pay university costs and travel for her son.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a single mother of three children, resides in one of the city's suburbs. She earns her income from the small rooms that she lets out at affordable prices to low income earners. Florence educates her children and supports her needy relatives with the income from the rentals. She used the previous loan to construct an underground water tank to make the rooms more habitable for her tenants, and now wants to renovate the rental units so as she can increase the amount she charges every month to expand her income base.

Like with the previous loan, her dream has always been to establish a real estate of rentals. Florence still believes that as long as she is still alive, her dream will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy materials to renvate her rental units

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is single and has to work because her parents live separately.  She sells cosmetic products through a network system from home.  She wants to buy the cosmetic and beauty products wholesale so that she can sell them and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Kübra hanım bekar, anne babası ayrı yaşadığı için çalışmak durumunda kalmış.  Evden netwörk sistemi ile kozmetik ürün pazarlaması yapıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan kozmetik ürünleri ve güzellik malzemeleri alarak satarak işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy the cosmetic and beauty products

loans.name: Metodi
