texts.en: Metodi is a 54-year old piano player living in Sliven, Bulgaria.  He is a member of the Roma minority, and works as a keyboardist in a Roma band.  He began playing music as a child, tapping anything that would make a good percussion beat.  He attended a government-run music high school in on the west coast of Bulgaria in Burgas and then in a military academy in Plovdiv, where his training focused on classical music.  He began working in the Bulgarian Army Band where he played the accordion and other instruments as needed.   Since the massive military cuts of the post-Cold War era, Metodi looks for work feverishly, both as a solo performer and in a group.  Last summer, Metodi began to play with “Southern Nights” orchestra in Sunny Beach.    Sunny Beach is a new tourist destination for western Europeans on the Bulgarian Black Sea coast.  This loan will be used to finance the upfront costs for this summer’s work; travel expenses, instrument tuning and the purchase of this year’s uniform.  The loan duration is 1 year, although we expect the preponderance of the loan to be repaid in a shorter time frame.   Lenders interested in learning more about the Roma culture in Bulgaria might find “Bury Me Standing: The Gypsies and Their Journey” by Isabel Fonseca to be helpful.  The book was published in 1995 and is widely available.

loans.use: Instrument repair, uniform

loans.name: Fonima

texts.en:
Fonima is a very shy widow but is one of the more active savers in the SPBD programme. She joined the Centre at Tulaele in 2005. Since the husband died in 2003, she started thinking about ways of surviving with her two children and a grandmother. She got in, and her first Loan was 300 tala (US$ 120). This loan was used for purchase of  stocks for her small shop. With the second loan of  500 tala (US$ 200), she also spent it on more stocks.

Fonima paid off her loan promptly and was therefore entitled to get  1,250 tala (US$ 500)  on her next loan. Fonima already  spent the other two loans on the stock, and with this loan she thought of renovating her small shop, so she used it to double wall the inside of the store. Fonima is excited that these loans enable her family to go on and live since her husband died.

At the end of last year, Fonima paid off her loan and got another loan amounting to 1,750 tala (US$ 700). This loan also was used to further improve her store. As we have seen in the photo taken, the store looks new and it’s just after the work done last week.

Apart from the Loans, on the other side, Fonima is one of the ladies that have a vision. This vision enables her to save the extra money. So she is done with the store but now she is looking of starting up the Elei Printing – a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics using handcrafted stencils.

loans.use: To purchase 50 yards of fabric, assorted ink, stencils, and printing block to start an elei printing business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang S. is 35 years old and works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.  She earns about $1.50/day and has 5 children.  With this loan she will build a home for rental to other garment factory workers.  She feels that this will provide her with more income, and may even allow her to leave the garment factory sometime in the near future.  If she is successful, she plans on sending all of her children to university.

loans.use: To build a house to rent to factory workers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Verónica N. lives in her own house in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of La Paz, with her husband, Mr Francisco Quispe, and her 4-year-old son, Juan. Ms. Verónica N. works as a weaver in a nearby micro-business and her husband works in as a carpenter in Sopocachi.

She shares her house with her three brothers. Each of them occupy a single room, and there is only a single common bathroom.

The requested loan will be used to construct an additional bathroom (toilet and sink) on her own part of the lot, and this way improve her living standard. This is the fourth time that she is approved for a loan with IMPRO, and her loan history and credit analysis show that she is qualified to receive this loan. The income of husband and wife and their cash flow indicate a stable economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica N. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ubicada en la ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Francisco Quispe y su hijo Juan de cuatro años. La señora Veronica N. trabaja como tejedora en una microempresa de su zona y el esposo es carpintero empleado en un taller de la zona de Sopocachi.

La vivienda es compartida con sus tres hermanos y cuenta con una habitación para cada familiar y solo tiene un baño común.

El destino del crédito ira a la construcción de un baño adicional (inodoro y lavamanos) en la parte del lote que le pertenece.

Esta es la cuarta ocasión que Verónica se beneficia con un crédito en Impro y sus antecedentes y el análisis crediticio la califican para poder acceder al préstamo. Los ingresos de ambos esposos y los flujos de caja efectuados indican una situación financiera estable.

loans.use: To construct an additional bathroom

loans.name: Hat

texts.en: Mrs. Hat N. is 34 years old and has three children. She and her husband work together making brick in a nearby factory earning around $7 each day. This couple hopes to use a loan to purchase farmland to grow crops and buy a motorcycle so that her husband can operate a motor-taxi during the time he is free from his work.

loans.use: To buy a farmland and a motorcycle to operate a motor-taxi when her husband is free from work.

loans.name: Darhwin Dario

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Darhwin, I’m a merchant and my main activity is selling bakery products (bread and donuts). I’ve been a street vendor for 2 years and I sell, mainly, to the grocery stores in my city. The money I make allows me to cover the expenses of my family. It’s also important to mention that the idea of this business came to me because I could not count on a steady job due to the lack of oportunitys in my community. Thank god with this job I’ve been able to carry my family through..

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Darhwin, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de hornado (Pan y Roquillas) cuento con 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, las ventas la realizo de manera ambulante en todas las pulperías de mi ciudad, gracias a las utilidades que percibo de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos mi familia. es importante mencionar que la idea de este negocio surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos en vista que no contaba con trabajo ya que en esta comunidad las oportunidades de trabajo son escasas, pero gracias a Dios con este negocio he sacado adelante a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of bread, donuts, quesadillas and culin.

loans.name: Rachid

texts.en: Rachid is a 36 year old man who lives with his wife and their child in south Lebanon, in Saida. Rachid is a very ambitious young man. He is a blacksmith, and he works on cars. This is the sixth time Ali has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is now planning to buy cars in order to sell them, and will then have two different income sources. Rachid always strives to develop and enhance his business. He has enough commitment and determination to make it.

loans.use: To buy cars

loans.name: Maureen's Group

texts.en:
Maureen N. wants a loan to open up a shop for second hand clothes. She even wants to start importing second hand cargoes from abroad. This will help her in her shops’ availability of clothes. In the future, Maureen expects to move away from second hand clothes to already made clothes (new clothes) which are selling better than second hand clothes. This will increase her sales and income.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To open a store

loans.name: Sassré

texts.fr:
Born in 1965 in Bassar in the north-west of Togo, Monsieur Sassré Binaou is single with one child. He works as a welder. He is currently based in the Tokoin-Wuiti neighborhood of Lomé. Unfortunately he cannot practice his trade to its full potential as he does not have enough suitable tools. To overcome this shortage, Monsieur Binaou is asking for a loan of $800. He is a very dedicated craftsman who is passionately fighting his way out of poverty.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1965 à Bassar dans le nord-ouest du Togo, Monsieur Sassré BINAOU est célibataire avec un (01) enfant et exerce comme activité le métier de soudeur. Il est actuellement basé à Lomé au quartier Tokoin-Wuiti. Malheureusement il n’arrive pas à exercer pleinement ses activités parce qu’il ne dispose pas suffisamment d’outils appropriés. Pour palier à cette insuffisance, il sollicite un financement de $800. C’est un artisan très dévoué qui se bat ardemment pour sortir de la pauvreté.

loans.use: To purchase work tools

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Mrs. Veng R., 38, is a mother of four children and works as a farmer in her rice field, typically earning $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Vong Saem, 40, works as a policeman and earns around $1.1 a day. Two of their daughters work in a garment factory, making a salary of $50 each a month; two others work in construction labor, normally earning around $56 a month. The family is hoping to increase its income by borrowing $700 through Kiva to start a business breeding pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to breed.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep S., age 61, is a widow with three children who live at home. She rents rooms to garment workers for her income, earning approximately three dollars a day.

To increase the family’s income, she is requesting a loan to purchase food that she can in turn sell in front of her house.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria Toleda is a calm, honest and very hardworking woman who started her own business in order to supplement her income after the death of her husband, since the money she received from his pension wasn't enough to provide for her two children. She started working for herself in February of 1993, when the family owned a taco stand at their local market, started thanks to a loan they had received. But after her husband passed away, Gloria wasn't able to maintain the business on her own and had to sell it. Afterwards, she worked selling various products in order to support her children. Then a friend invited her to take a craft class, which she really enjoyed. This led her to start her own craft business, with her friend sending her customers. So far, her customers have been very satisfied with her work and have been recommending her products to relatives and other friends, allowing Gloria's business to keep growing.

Now Gloria is seeking a $450 loan, to be paid in 5 months, in order to buy the basic materials that she uses to make her products and be able to fill all of her orders. Your generosity will help Gloria continue to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria T. es una persona tranquila, honesta y muy trabajadora inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener otro ingreso, ya que su esposo falleció y la pensión que le dejó no me era suficiente. Necesitaba tener un ingreso que le permitiera sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos. Comenzó en Febrero de 1993, antes de fallecer su esposo tenían una taquería en el mercado que habían puesto gracias a un crédito que obtuvieron, pero después de fallecer yo ya no pudo atenderla por lo cual tuvo que traspasarla y se dedico a vender diversas cosas para sostener a sus hijos, fue entonces que una amiga la invitó a tomar un curso de manualidades el cual le gustó mucho, animándose a poner su negocio y su amiga le comenzó a enviar clientes, los cuales quedaban contentos con su trabajo y la iban recomendando entre sus familiares y amistades y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $450 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando adornos y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Gloria seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-Oeun S., 51, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Neang, were married in 1980. They have seven children, two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two others are garment factory workers, while another is a construction worker; the last one is learning beauty skills. The family lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokha used to be a mason but now stays at home due to health problems. Mrs. Sam-Oeun has been a fish seller for twenty years. She buys them from a district market for resale in the village market. Now she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon S. is the mother of three children and works raising pigs to sell on a piece of land near her house. Two of her children are employed as garment workers. Her husband (in the photo) is a motor taxi driver and earns about $2 a day to support their family. Now he would like to receive a loan from Kiva to replace an old and unreliable motorbike. The old motorbike uses a lot of gas which is why sometimes he makes no profit.

loans.use: Pon would like to replace an old motorbike for her husband's motor taxi business.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana is a very diligent woman who, since becoming responsible for her own financial support, has tried her hand at several businesses. Unfortunately, none of them proved successful and as a result she decided to start selling shoes. She buys the shoes from suppliers in the city of Tacna and sells them from a stall in the Tupac Amaru market in her town, Juliaca.

Liliana has several plans for her business, for which she requires additional capital investment. This loan will enable her to purchase new additional stock of new shoes to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Liliana es una mujer diligente, desde que se independizó económicamente tentó suerte con diferentes actividades, pero desafortunadamente en ninguna lograba tener éxito, es así que decidió vender zapatos, mercadería que adquiere en la ciudad de Tacna y la vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Tupac Amaru de su ciudad, Juliaca.Liliana tiene muchos planes para su negocio, para ello requiere contar con mayor capital de inversión, por lo que solicita este préstamo, dinero que le permitirá adquirir novedosos zapatos que ofrecerá a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of new and varied shoes for the business.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is the wife of M. and lives in a small area of Kasur named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her husband sells crockery. Yasmeen baji is a housewife but she does embroidery also. She makes embroidered dresses and fills the orders of her neighbors. Yasmeen baji has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more crockery to expand her husband's business.

Yasmeen baji is joined in her loan group by five other members. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Bushra baaji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy more crockery to resell. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy crockery to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy an embroidery machine and thread to make embroidered dresses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy crockery

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Mariée à M. KWASSI Ayi qui est un frigoriste, Dame D. Adjowa est née le 11 août 1969 à Lomé. Elle a deux enfants et a pour activité la vente des épices et de produits de premières nécessités au grand marché de Lomé. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 2004 lui procure beaucoup de revenus.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 3 sacs, 4 bidons et 2 sacs de gingembre.
texts.en:
Married to Mr. Ayi Kwassi who is an expert in refrigeration, Mrs. Adjowa D. was born on April 11, 1969 in Lomé. She has two children and her business consists in selling spices and other staple goods in the big market of Lomé. This business which she opened in 2004 brings in a good income for her.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to refurbish her inventory by buying 3 sacks, 4 jerry cans, and 2 sacks of ginger.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spices and other staples for re-sale

loans.name: Licet Maria

texts.es:
La señora Licet Maria, socia del BC “Mariscalense”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón, juanes y arroz chaufa. Desarrolla el negocio en las afueras de su casa, situado en el Jr, San Martín S/N, del  A.A. H.H. Santa Rosa del distrito donde vive. Decide iniciar estas actividades ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo en la economía de su casa. Sus clientes son moradores de la propia localidad y transeúntes de lugares cercanos.

Con este crédito de S/.1,800, el cual será cancelado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar, carnes de res, pollo y cerdo en kilos, también comprará cecina y chorizo, que le permitirá variar los platos a ofertar y atender la petición de sus clientes.
 
Licet es una mujer entusiasta de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus decisiones y con 02 de sus 04 hijos a quienes quiere darle un futuro mejor y su hija la ayuda en el negocio. Su meta es terminar de construir su casa para darle presencia e implementarla con otro tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Licet Maria, BC "Mariscalense" partner, lives in the San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui district. She is an enthusiastic woman of 43 and lives with her husband, who supports her in her decisions, and with two of her four children, for whom she wants to provide a better future. Her daughter helps her in the business, which is selling char-grilled chicken kabobs, juanes (Peruvian tamales) and chaufa rice. Licet Maria is conducting business near her home in Jr. San Martín S/N, del A.A. H.H. Santa Rosa. She decided to start this activity when confronted with the need to generate more income and help her husband with the household expenses. Her customers are local residents and passersby. With this 1,800 sol loan, which she will repay in six months, she will buy ingredients for preparing foods, such as rice, sugar and kilos of beef, chicken, pork, jerky and chorizo, which will allow her to vary her menu and respond to her customers’ requests. She wants to renovate her home in order to set up another type of business there.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beef, chicken, pork, etc.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Neema M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children between the ages of seven and 11 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because the child's parents do not take care of him. Neema has been running a tailoring business since 1998. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing mainly for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Neema currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy thread and kanga. In the future, she plans to employ more people. Neema thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy thread and kanga

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Painting the house and doing some repairs inside

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of raw materials for dyeing cloth

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica O., a 56-year-old married mother of eight, lives with her husband and three of their children in Abofour, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil, produced from palm nut fruits, for twenty years now, supplying area food vendors and sometimes even trekking to other villages when demand warrants.

Veronica is requesting the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts, containers in which to store the oil, and an electric milling machine to enable larger scale production. She believes this will help to expand her business and thus increase income to support her husband’s efforts to provide food for the family and finance their children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts and an electric milling machine to produce palm oil in larger quantities.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 53 años, vive en Itá y está casada  con el señor Anastacio D.  51 años D. edad. Tienen 2 hijos, Cinthia D. 19 años quien trabaja en un supermercado  y Osmar D. 18 años quien este año cursará el primer año  en la facultad. 

Clara posee un copetín hace más D. 13 años,  y empezó a trabajar en el después D. que su marido perdió el trabajo que tenía ya que a causa D. ello los problemas económicos aumentaron.

Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que tiene que levantarse a la madrugada a preparar la comida que se encargan D. vender por las calles su hijo menor y su esposo.

Hoy día cuenta con una clientela bastante formada y afirma que gracias a los ingresos que genera su pequeño negocio,  ha logrado criar a sus 2 hijos quienes hoy se han convertido en personas D. bien.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. ingredientes porque el capital D. trabajo que posee no le permite realizar más variedades D. comidas para satisfacer el gusto D. todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old, lives in Itá, and is married to Anastacio who is 51 years old. They have two children, Cinthia who is 19 years old and works in a supermarket, and Osmar, who is 18 years old and starting his first year of college. Clara has owned a café for more than 13 years, having started to work after her husband lost his job, and event that created financial problems for them. She comments that the work requires a great deal of sacrifice, given that she has to rise at dawn to prepare food that her husband and son then sell throughout the streets. These days, she has a well-established customer base and affirms that, thanks to her small business, she has been able to raise two children who have become good people. She requests the loan to purchase ingredients, as the working capital she has doesn’t permit her to make a wiD. enough variety of foods to satisfy all her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meats, flour, bread, condiments, beverages, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 40 años, dedica su vida al cuidado de su esposo y sus dos hijos integrantes de su  familia que la llena de alegría. A pesar de la distancia para realizar sus actividades laborales María siempre viaja a su pueblo para estar pendiente de su ganado. Esta actividad la inició hace 15 años junto a su esposo, quien es el que está más pendiente del negocio pues se queda en el pueblo, mientras que María viaja a la ciudad para atender a sus hijos quienes están estudiando en Lima y requieren de sus cuidados. Cada quincena de mes regresa a su pueblo, aunque los viajes la agitan mucho, le reconforta saber que gracias a esta actividad puede brindarle a sus hijos una educación y desarrollo profesional. Cuando sus hijos terminen su educación María anhela incrementar su ganado y tener una gran hacienda que provea carne de primera calidad a los mercados de las  ciudades más comerciales. Hace seis años que trabaja con MFP, este es su 13avo préstamo y junto a su banco comunal logró adquirir experiencia en trabajo de equipo y la oportunidad de aprender a hacer crecer sus ingresos, administrando adecuadamente sus ganancias, pues las charlas educativas le han ayudado mucho. María invertirá 3000 soles en la compra de ganado de raza, los cuales brinden mayores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, and dedicates her life to the care of her husband and her two children who fill her life with happiness. Because of the distance she needs to travel to work, María always travels to and from her village to take care of her flock. She began this lie of work 15 years ago with her husband, who cares for the business from their village, while María travels to the city to be with the children as they are studying in Lima and require her care. Every 15th of the month, she returns to her village, and although the travel agitates her, she takes comfort in the fact that this activity will bring her children an education and professional development. When her children finish their education, María would like to increase her livestock and to have a large farm that provides meat of the best quality for the markets in the most commercial cities.

She has worked with MFP for 6 years. This is her 13th loan and in conjunction with her communal bank, she was able to gain experience working in a team and the opportunity to learn to grow her income, administrate her earnings adequately. These educational lectures have been very helpful.

María will invest 3000 Peruvian Soles in the purchase of livestock, which will bring more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.en:
Zenovia is 50 years old and married with three sons, all of whom are now working adults. Her oldest son drives a taxi, her middle son works on a cruise ship and speaks English, and her youngest son is a tour guiD. in the Cusco area and is also studying languages. She is very proud of her children and their accomplishments, and speaks about them lovingly.

Zenovia has a restaurant where she serves different meals throughout the day. She serves mostly traditional Cusqueñan food, like fried beef, breaded trout, and baked cuy (guinea pig). She usually works at the restaurant all day (her niece fills in for her when she has to go to her monthly village bank meetings or run other errands). She has had her restaurant since 1998, the same year she first joined a village bank at Asociacion Arariwa. Zenovia is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy more meat, rice, vegetables, and oil for the restaurant. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy meat, rice vegetables and oil

loans.name: Seberino

texts.es:
El sr. Severino M., es nacido en la cuidad de Potosí, Provincia Tomas Frías, y actualmente vive en la comunidad de Belén perteneciente a la comunidad del Torno. Cuenta con parcela propia.
Tiene su esposa la Sra. Martina Martínez y tiene tres hijos, ambos se dedican a la actividad de la agricultura, actualmente tienen sembrado maíz y fríjol. 
Con el préstamo que se les otorgará quieren sembrar papa, además de tener sus siembras también tienen 6 cabezas de ganado vacuno, 80 gallinas y 25 ovejas.
El sr. Severino quiere seguir trabajando de manera continua con el crédito ya que esto le ayuda a seguir aumentando su capital.
texts.en:
Mr. Severino M. was born in Potosí, Tomas Frías province, and currently lives in the community of Belén, belonging to the Torno community. He has his own plot. He has a wife, Mrs. Martina Martínez and they have three children. They are both engaged in agriculture for a living, and currently plant corn and beans. With the awarded loan they want to plant potato, and besides having their crops, they also want livestock, including 6 cattle, 80 chickens, and 25 goats. Mr. Severino wants to continue working on an ongoing basis with credit as this helps him to continue to grow his capital.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Daysi Patricia

texts.es: Daysi Patricia S. R. vive en El departamento de Ahuachapán. Daysi está acompañada con José, quien es el padre de sus tres hijos, José se dedica a la profesión de electricista, pero sus ingresos salariales de su trabajo, no son suficiente para mantener  a su familia, es por ello; que Daysi una mujer muy luchadora,  puso un negocio de venta de sombreros en el mercado central. El producto que Daysi comercializa es muy demandado en la zona, ya que es un lugar donde las personas utilizan mucho este accesorio como manera de protección del sol cuando se encuentran trabajando en la agricultura, Daysi lleva solo 4 años en el negocio pero tiene expectativas para hacerlo crecer, es por ello que solicita un crédito para comprar más variedad de sombreros para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daysi lives in Ahuachapan with her partner Jose. Together they have 3 children. Jose is an electrician, but his salary is not sufficient to maintain their family. For this reason, Daysi, who is a very determined woman, started a businesses selling hats in the central market. Her products are in great demand in the area, where people use hats a lot as protection against the sun while working in the fields. Daysi has just 4 years in this business, but she expects it to continue to grow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more variety of hats to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of hats to offer her customers, and continue to grow her business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi has sold fruit and vegetables in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for three years. She belongs to the Amken loan group (code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $50. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more vegetables and fruit to resell, to expand her business. She is hoping that her profit will increase and she will be able to get more food for her family.

Naomi is 23 years old, married, has two children: ages 4 and 1.

loans.use: Buy more vegetables and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Mervedi Plus Group

texts.fr: Marie K. Mamu est membre d’un des groupes de Hope RDC qu’elle a intégré en décembre 2008 dans le but de renforcer son activité en vue de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une boutique générale. Elle vend des beignets depuis 2001 dans un quartier périphérique de Kinshasa. Ses clients fidèles sont principalement des enfants et adolescents. Son capital initial en 2001 était de $1 qu’elle a multiplié grâce aux efforts fournis, une bonne gestion et des bénéfices accumulés qui lui ont procuré un capital de $90 en 2003. De 2003 – 2008, Marie a encore beaucoup travaillé pour atteindre un fonds propre de $180 avant de commencer à recevoir les crédits de Hope qu’elle a totalement remboursés. Vue le nombre croissant de ses clients, Marie a utilisé le crédit obtenu en mai dernier pour acheter 1 sac de farine de froment, 1 bidon de 25 litres d’huile végétale, 1 sac du sucre et 1 boite de levure en vue de satisfaire la demande et d’accroitre aussi le bénéfice de son affaire. Elle a 36 ans, mariée et mère d’un fils étudiant âgé de 20 ans. Marie est très fière de son activité et est déterminée à atteindre son objectif.
texts.en:
Marie K. Mamu is a member of a HOPE RDC group that she joined in December 2008 with the goal of bolster her business. One day she hopes to realize her dream of opening a general store. She has been selling beignets since 2001 in an outlying district of Kinshasa. Her loyal customers are mainly children and adolescents. In 2001, her initial capital was $1, which she multiplied through her efforts, correct management, and accumulated profits, all of which gained her $90 in capital in 2003. From 2003-2008, Marie still worked a lot to attain $180 in capital. She then started to receive loans from HOPE that she repaid completely. Given the growing number of customers she has, Marie used the loans obtained last May for buying: a sack of wheat flour, a 25-liter drum of vegetable oil, a sack of sugar, and a container of leavening in order to satisfy the demand and also to grow her profits. Marie is 36 years old, married, and the mother of son, age 20, who is a student. She is very proud of her business and is determined to achieve her dream.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of flour, a drum of vegetable oil, a sack of sugar, and some leavening to make more beignets

loans.name: Selena

texts.en: Selena Matina, 37, is married with 7 children.  She has many years of experience in the pork bun, pancake business. She sells to the public 5 days per week.  Selena has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ 120USD).  SPBD loans are Selena’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase bag flour,sugar,veges oil, frying pan,soyak pots.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Lý Nguyễn Thị (1433040377) is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Lý owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling clothing to local businesses and community members.  Lý has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Lý joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  Lý is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lý from TYM Fund.  Lý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.en:
Godofredo F. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old. Godofredo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Godofredo operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn and cassava for sale. Godofredo has been engaged in his business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (about $84) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Godofredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Godofredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Godofredo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Godofredo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery tiene 30 años, es una mujer que durante toda su vida ha incursionado en varios trabajos. Vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a su hermana menor y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de Vida.A partir de las 7 de la noche sale a vender sus deliciosos anticuchos (brochetas) en su carretilla, ella es una vendedora muy carismática y siempre trata a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad, la sazón que le pone a sus anticuchos ha hecho que su carretilla sea una de las más concurridas de la zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y hacerles más agradable el momento de la comida, lleva 6 meses en esta actividad y aunque recién está comenzando, sabe que está yendo por buen camino. Rosmery considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer hasta muy altas horas de la noche en la calle y soportar el intenso frió. Para el futuro anhela que su negocio crezca y pueda poner una tienda de comida rápida, donde pueda atender con más tranquilidad a sus clientes. Este es el sexto préstamo al que accede Rosmery con MFP, no ha tenido problemas para pagar los anteriores créditos y espera esta vez tampoco tenerlos. En su banco comunal le tienen mucha confianza, ya que es una de las socias más serias y cumplidas. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios para preparar sus anticuchos, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en la comprar de los ingredientes para sus anticuchos.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 30 years old and has dabbled in various jobs throughout her life. She and her younger sister live at home with their parents. What she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Starting around 7pm, she sells delicious kebabs (brochettes) from her food cart. Rosemery is a very charismatic saleswoman who treats her customers with much kindness. The seasoning she adds to her kebabs gives them more flavor. As a result, her food stand is one of the busiest in the area. What she likes most about her job is being around her customers and making conversation with them while she prepares their food. Rosemery has only been in business for 6 months and she already knows that she is headed in the right direction. She says the most difficult part of her job is staying up very late at night on the street and enduring the intense cold. In the future, she hopes to open a fast food shop where she can attend to her customers in a calmer environment.

Rosemery is requesting her sixth loan with MFP. She has not experienced any problems with making her payments and expects this time to be the same. Her Communal Bank has tremendous confidence in her because she is considered to be one of the most serious and well respected members. With her loan of 3000 soles, she plans to buy new pots and utensils for preparing her kebabs. Any money left over will be used to purchase ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase utensils & ingredients

loans.name: Son

texts.en: S., 30, is a cooking supply trader. She sells items such as firewood, charcoal, and some groceries to citizens in the village. Another income source is from her husband who works driving a car taxi for a salary. The couple is blessed with two teenage children who are enrolled in school. Recently, some parts of S.’s stock have been exhausted; she hopes to increase her stock supply with a loan from HKL to purchase extra charcoal and firewood to sell. This loan will allow S. to increase her income and maintain her family’s expenses more easily.

loans.use: To purchase extra charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl A. is a 39-year-old woman from Pasay City.  Her husband, Leonardo, 41, drives a pedicab (rickshaw) for a living.  They have an only child who is still at home. They live among the city’s poorest communities.

Cheryl has had a small general store for more than two years. She saved most of her earnings until she was able to purchase the pedicab that her husband now uses in his business. Cheryl earns PHP9,000.00 a month. She uses her profits to address daily basic needs.  

Cheryl became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She has applied for a new loan (PHP10,000.00) in order to increase the inventory of groceries for her store.

It has always been her intention to send her child to college. This is why she has been working hard day and night.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en: Bassima is a very hardworking and enterprising married woman with 2 children. In 2000, she decided to work as a home-base tailor after 18 years of experience to help her husband in the household. Today, Bassima is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy an additional sewing machine and textiles to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: buy an additional sewing machine and textiles

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: H. Josephine est née en 1976 à Adjarra, village situé non loin de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Josephine vit depuis sa naissance à Honvié à Adjarra. Mariée à HOUNTON Ablo un commerçant, Josephine est mère de quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Josephine a un enfant à sa charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Josephine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis 10 ans, Josephine vend de l'huile à moteur à la devanture de sa maison. Josephine vend également des boissons par le système de distribution. Josephine s'approvisionne à Comé et au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. Josephine sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé pour accroître la taille de son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle.
texts.en:
H. Josephine was born in 1976 in Adjarra, a village located near Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin. Since birth, she has been living in Honvié in Adjarra. She is married to HOUNTON Ablo, a merchant, and is the mother of four children. Some of them are in school. In addition to these children, she has another child to support. The couple covers family expenses jointly. Josephine never attended school. For ten years, she has been selling motor oil at the entrance of her house. She also sells beverages through the distribution system. She stocks up in Comé and in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. She’s requesting an initial loan from ALIDé for expanding her business and for satisfying her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers of motor oil and cases of drinks

loans.name: Djamolidin

texts.en:
A. Djamolidin is 45 years old. He is married with five children. Djamolidin runs his own café cooking shish kebabs. His café is located in the local central market. He has been in this business for 11 years. Djamolidin is trying to use only the best quality meat in his café. Thus, for example, he is breeding the cattle. He sells some of the meat and he uses some in his café. His elder son helps him in the café and will probably, in the time, inherit the business. The café and cattle breeding are the main sources of income for the family. Today Djamolidin requests 4450 somoni. He is planning to purchase two cows and coal for his café for cooking the shish kebabs. Having a positive credit history, Djamolidin is sure that he will also repay this loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and coal for his café

loans.name: Senciaga

texts.en:
Senciaga B. is from the village of Balanlinao, Palridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Senciaga is married and has two school-age children.  She owns and operates a business venture selling food for snacks like "Puto" rice cakes and banana cue (deep-fried banana with caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. Senciaga has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Senciaga joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Senciaga is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for food vending. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for food vending

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de 47 años, vive con su esposo (Mario), de 56 años. Ellos viven en la tranquilidad de su hogar con sus 3 hijos: Edwin de 26, Bécquer de 15 y Yois de 12 años.

Junto a su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de alverja y papa en sus propias tierras, ambos se esfuerzan por salir adelante por sus hijos menores, además ellos también los ayudan a sembrar, ya que es un trabajo que se debe hacer en equipo para que pueda avanzar en perfectas condiciones y la cosecha sea próspera. 
Luisa también cría carneros y ovejas, ya que como ella misma dice: “criar animales es como un seguro cuando no tienes dinero, ahí nomás los vendes y sales del apuro”. 
En la sierra del Perú el trabajo es constante, muy rudo y si se hace en unión avanza mucho mejor, y esto lo sabe la familia de esta luchadora mujer que no se detiene ante los obstáculos de la vida y ya tiene pensado incrementar su producción agrícola e ir adquiriendo más ganado vacuno.

Este el primer préstamo de Luisa con MFP y asegura que será muy cumplida con cada uno de los pagos, pues desea seguir progresando y pedir más prestamos en adelante. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono para asegurar su siembra y su cosecha pueda ser reproductiva.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 47 year old woman and lives with her husband, Mario, who is 56 years old. They live in the tranquility of their home with 3 children: Edwin of 26, Becquer of 15, and Yois of 12 years of age.

Together with her husband, she sows common vetch and potatoes in their own fields. Both of them are struggling to get ahead for their minor children. In addition, the children help with the sowing; it's a job that must be done with equipment so that the crop can advance under perfect conditions and the harvest may be prosperous.

Luisa also raises sheep and ewes, because as she herself says: “To raise animals is like insurance; when you have no money, you can sell them and get out of a tight spot.”

In the mountains of Peru work is constant and very hard; if you do it together it advances much better. The family of this struggling woman knows that very well; they are not stopped by life's obstacles. They are thinking about how to increase their agricultural production and acquire more milk cows.

This is Luisa's first loan with MFP and she assures us that she will be very punctual with each payment. She wishes to continue progressing and to ask for more loans in the future. The money she requests will be invested in manure to assure that the crop and its harvest may be reproductive.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MANURE TO FERTILIZE THE FIELDS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rock, sand, cement, material to make a porch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her shop

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 59 years old and married with eight children, between the ages of nine and 26 years old. Six of the children are still attending school. He's been a dairy farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley of Kenya for five years and previously worked as a supervisor in a tea estate. He sells milk to milk vendors in the area and also earns income from small-scale tea and poultry farming and a retail shop. He says that the main challenges to his business are lack of water and lack of artificial insemination services for his dairy cows.

He has requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. In the future, he would like to acquire two quality breed cows and produce 50 litres of milk per day. He says that this loan will provide him with food security from the milk and added income for school fees and other necessities for his family.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa, vive al lado de su esposo y sus dos queridos hijos: Ángel y Milagros de 16 y 7 años respectivamente.
Su experiencia en el comercio la animó a tener un negocio propio, es así que desde hace 10 años implementó una librería, a la que le dedica la mayor parte del tiempo, pues abre desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 7 u 8 de la noche. 
A Edith le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues es tranquilo y la hace sentir independiente, ya que no tiene que cumplir un horario y mucho menos obedecer a un jefe, esto la hace sentir realizada y muy productiva. Por otra parte, se esmera mucho en la atención, pues cliente que pisa su establecimiento es tratado muy cordialmente, es así como se ha hecho de buena fama en su barrio. 
Por tal motivo, para el futuro espera seguir haciendo crecer su negocio, surtirlo y convertir su librería en la más importante del barrio.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado ante su grupo por ser muy responsable y puntual con los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cuadernos, lápices, colores, bolígrafos, etc., ya que se acerca la época escolar y piensa aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edith, age 39, is a very hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and their two beloved children. Ángel is 16, and Milagros is 7. Her experience in commerce motivated her to have her own business. So it was that ten years ago she set up a bookstore. She spends the greater part of her time on the business. She opens very early in the morning until approximately seven or eight at night. Edith likes her work a lot. It is peaceful, and it makes her feels independent. She does not have to follow a schedule or obey a boss. This makes her feel fulfilled and very productive. She takes great care in the attention to her customers. A customer who enters her establishment is treated very cordially. That is how she has gotten a good reputation in the neighborhood. That is why in the future she plans to keep making her business grow, stock it, and convert her bookstore into the most important one in the neighborhood. This is her fourth loan with MFP. In her group she has always been characterized as being very responsible and punctual with her payments. She will use the money she is requesting to buy a larger quantity of notebooks, pens, colored pencils, and pens, etc. The school season is approaching, and she plans to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda B. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old. Luzminda is separated from her spouse and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling and peddling dried fish in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Fazila Musafer Group

texts.en:
Fazila is the daughter of M. M. and the leader of the Fazila M. group. She lives with her family of six in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is single and has an embroidery business. She works hard to support her family. 

Fazila wants buy a new machine and other necessary things for her embroidery business. She plans to pay her loan on time. She would like to thank everybody who helps with loans in Afghanistan and other poor countries.

loans.use: a machine and other supplies for her embroidery business

loans.name: Dilma

texts.en:
Dilma A. is from the village of San Carlos in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Dilma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Dilma owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products such as candies, vinegar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Dilma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Dilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dilma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Dilma's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Amelia de 44 años de edad es soltera, vive en la colonia la Fonseca, trabaja como docente de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera del municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 14 años, tiene 1 hijo de 24 años de edad.-      
Està solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4to crèdito con el fondo kiva, con el cual piensa comprar materiales de construcciòn para hacer una habitaciòn y asi poco a poco mejor sus condiciones de vida.  

Expresa que con su salario es muy dificil mejorar su casa, pero con los creditos puede hacerlo; su sueño en el futuro es conocer a sus nietecitos y servir a  Dios, tener salud y que su familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Amelia is 44 years old, single, and lives in the Fonseca subdivision. She has been working as a teacher at the Rafaela Herrera School in the city of Nueva Guinea for 14 years. Rosa Amelia has a son who is 24 years old.

She is requesting refinancing through her fourth loan using Kiva funds. She plans to purchase building materials so that she can continue with the construction of her house and gradually improve her living conditions.

Rosa Amelia says it is difficult to make improvements to her home on her salary, but the loans make this a possibility. Her dreams for the future are to get to know her grandchildren, serve God, experience good health, and have her family stay together.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to continue with the construction of her house

loans.name: Battsengel

texts.en:
Battsengel M., 33, lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  His oldest daughter attends a local secondary school. His youngest, a 4-year-old old daughter, attends a local kindergarten. 

Battsengel operates a clothing trading business at Narantuul, the biggest market in Mongolia. He has been operating his business since 2005 and has gained significant experience as a businessman.  Over the past years he has steadily expanded his business and built a loyal customer base. Today his working capital is 3,500,000 MNT.  His daily revenue is between 50,000 – 150,000 MNT. His profit is between 40 – 50 %.

Since he began his business, his family's standard of living has improved. With his last two year's earnings, he purchased a house for his family. Battsengel is an industrious person. The most important thing to him is being able to provide for his children's education. He says, “I have been planning to be financially able to provide higher educations for my two children after they graduate from high school.” He is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase the latest women's clothing including shirts and outerwear to resell to his many customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living there, with her family, for over twelve years. Her husband's name is M. N. and he owns & operates a clothes selling business. He has been in this business for five years. He purchases clothes from different cities (Lahore, Peshawar and Faisalabad) and sells them in the local community. He goes to different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart which he uses to sell his clothes.

  
Salma is a very caring lady and stays at home to manage the household chores and take care of her family. She also helps her husband in his business by selling clothes to her neighbors.  


Salma is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s business so that he can purchases clothes in bulk to sell to the cloth shops and increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina J. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Cristina is married to Rogelio J. and blessed with 11 children, of whom four have already married; 2 are adults but still single, three are teenagers, and two are still in elementary school. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for one year already and earns approximately 500 PHP a month from this business activity. 

In the year 2008, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is now requesting a loan of 7000 PHP as her 4th loan to be used in purchasing fertilizers for her corn production and the remaining amount for additional capital for her existing sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for her corn production and capital for her variety store

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 39 años de edad, comparte la vida con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo que se dedica desde hace 7 años, es la venta de pollo, en un mercado de lo más concurrido de su zona llamado “28 de Noviembre”. Es así que todas las mañanas sale muy temprano para llevar sus productos perecibles a su puesto logrando venderlo hasta las 3pm de la tarde, pues gracias a los años que tiene trabajando en este rubro, ha hecho que sea estable su negocio y gane la preferencia de sus clientes. En un futuro espera poder seguir mejorando su negocio comprando una congeladora para así poder adquirir más mercadería y mantenerla fresca para su venta. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Olga is 39 years old. She shares her life with her husband and two children in a house that they own. For the past 7 years she has been selling chicken in a busy market in her area called "28 de Noviembre" (November 28th). Every morning she leaves very early to take her perishable products to the market and she sells until 3 pm. Thanks to the many years that she has worked in this trade, she has a stable business and her customers prefer her over the competition. In the future she hopes to improve her business by buying a freezer so that she can stock more merchandise and keep it fresh. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she has always been very responsible with her payments. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy more merchandise so that she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more perishable products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chanthon's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Samraong Mreah village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Chanthon M. is the group leader of the loan, having been selected by its members. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chanthon M. and her husband, Mr. Lach Chin, are corn and sweet-potato sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase income to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Chanthon M. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. 

This couple has four children, all are whom are students and also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Johel

texts.es:
Johel  Jiménez Espinoza  es un señor de 31    años de edad el  cual vive con su esposa e Hijo  en una comunidad llamada Coquital  localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos y  naranja.

Don Johel siempre ha tenido su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes (Pulpería)  en donde ofrece todo tipo de productos para los miembros de la comunidad, esta actividad le ha permitido desarrollarse económicamente. Sin embargo ahora tiene más responsabilidades ya que hace poco nació su primer hijo. Es por eso que Don Johel necesita otra  actividad que le genere ingresos.  El pensó que un centro de entrenamiento era una buena idea, ya que en su pueblo no  existía ninguno.

Es por eso que Don Johel necesita un crédito de  ¢619.000 (seiscientos diecinueve mil colones) para la comprar una mesa de pool  e instalarla en su negocio. Así podrá ofrecerle a sus clientes un servicio más, y por lo tanto generar más ingresos que le permitirán darle lo mejor, y estar más tiempo con su hijo.

El forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su  primer crédito  y con el espera  mejorar su negocio cada día.
texts.en:
Johel Jiménez Espinoza is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in a community called Coquital. Coquital is located in the Los Chiles area, in the province of Alajuela; this community is in a mountainous area and is very close to the country’s northern border. His main economic activities are ranching and farming, specifically, growing staple grains and oranges. Johel also has his own business, a grocery store (“Pulpería”) where he sells all types of products to members of the community. This activity has allowed him to develop economically. However, Johel now has more responsibilities since the recent birth of his first child. That is why Johel needs another activity to generate income. He thought a recreation center would be a good idea, since nothing like that exists in his town. Johel needs a loan of ¢619,000 (619,000 colones) so that he can purchase a pool table and install it in his business. This would allow Johel to offer his customers an additional service and generate more income, and make it possible for Johel to spend more time with his son and provide the best for him. Johel is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be Johel’s first loan and he hopes to use it to improve his business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a pool table.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros T. is from the village of Cabantian, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 65 years old. Milagros is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Milagros owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Milagros from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia M., 44 years old, is a proud mother of 5 children whose ages range from 2 to 12 years old. The family's main source of income is farming, as Ma. Cecilia's husband is a farmer. Because of her husband's meager farming income, Ma. Cecilia decided to join Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. - Rizal East Branch, a Kiva partner microfinance institution in the Philippines, to start her own business in order to help her husband with their financial needs. Her previous loans were spent in the purchase and sale of livestock, particularly chickens, and from her income she was able to support her family's needs. From then on, all she dreamed of was to increase her capital in order to earn more profit.

Ma. Cecilia maintains her good performance in ASHI until she fully pays her loans. Now she is applying again for a new loan to augment the needed capital for her business. If approved, her plan is to buy and sell live chickens. From her earnings, she has been able to construct housing for her poultry and develop the skills for raising chickens. Her aim is to establish a good business so that she can help in providing for all her family's needs, especially for their education. One of her dreams is to renovate their house. This serves as her motivation in working harder and performing her best as a member of ASHI and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy chicken and feed

loans.name: Rilmar Roman

texts.es:
El señor Rilmar tiene 33 años es soltero y tiene un hijo de 9 años a su cargo, ya que la madre los abandono y se fue a España por lo tanto el cliente tuvo que hacerse cargo de su hijo, aunque tiene un poco de dificultad para cuidarlo ya que él trabaja todo el día  y lo deja a cargo de su hermana, como se puede ver la vida del niño es muy triste ya que no puede disfrutar de una familia estable como cualquier niño de su edad.

Rilmar vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba  en la zona de Pacata Alta, no tiene casa propia vive en la casa de sus padres, pero él tiene un terreno en Villa Tunari  en la zona del trópico en la  cual está construyendo una cabañas y posteriormente alquilarlas a los turistas y de esa manera tener más ingresos para ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida.

Rilmar trabaja en la alcaldía de la comunidad de Chimore el cargo que ocupa es Cotizador.
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de material para la construcción de dichas cabañas. Entre sus principales metas y sueños es terminar de construir las cabañas y de esta manera generar más ingresos para poder ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida y que su hijo estudia una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Rilmer, 33, is single but has a 9-year-old son in his care because the child’s mother abandoned them and went to Spain. He was left in charge of his son’s care. However, it is a bit difficult to care for him because he must be at work all day. His sister takes care of his son but one can see that the child’s life is very sad because he can’t enjoy life in a stable family like any other child his age. Rilmer lives in the city of Cochabamba, Pacata Alta zone. He doesn’t own his own home but lives in his parents’ house. However, he does have a lot in Villa Tunari in the tropical zone where he is building cabins to rent eventually to tourists and thus have more income in order to offer a better standard of living. Rilmer is employed by the City of Chimore as an Estimator. The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies for the above mentioned cabins. Among his main goals and dreams are to finish building the cabins thus generating more income to offer a better quality of life and that his son study a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a dairy farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where she has been farming for the last 25 years. Her farm produces maize and milk which are sold locally. She also earns income by selling horticultural products at a local market. Salome is 43 years old. She is married with 5 aged children all of whom attend school.

She fully repaid her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000KES and has requested this loan of 40,000KES to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income generated from this loan will be used to pay school fees for her children and expand her businesses. Her major challenge is lack of capital  to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and dairy feed. In future, she would like to expand her farming activities by acquiring more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tob

texts.en:
Mrs. Tob P., 48, and her husband, Mr. Sophea Cheun, 49, have been married since 1985 and have two daughters. One daughter is a garment factory worker and the other attends school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number 5, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Tob and her husband are rice farmers. They also sell food in front of a garment factory when they are not at the farm. Tob is asking for her first loan of $400 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia D. is currently in the business of selling sugar, beans etc at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Lilia is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a lawyers clerk. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es:
Dennis vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Achumani, de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y trabaja como empleado en una oficina particular con cuyos ingresos que obtiene se mantiene.
