 El anterior crédito fue utilizado para la refacción del patio de su vivienda. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos. Ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para refaccionar el techo de plástico del solarium de la casa donde vive.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito y se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Dennis lives at his parents’ house in the District of Achumani of the city of La Paz. He is single and works as an employee for a private business. The income he earns enables him to support himself.

His previous loan was used to repair the patio of his home. Sr. Dennis is pleased with the loans he has received. Now he is requesting a new loan so that he can repair the plastic roof over the sun room in his house.

His prior history qualifies him for a new loan since he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: Repair the roof over the sun room in his parents' house

loans.name: Raida

texts.en: Raida M. sells green vegetables and fruit like oranges, lemons, etc.  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of fruit to sell. Raida is 27 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of fruit, especially lemons, to sell

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married with four children and lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. She sells groceries — a business she started with the help of her husband 10 years ago. She has built up a good clientele. Sharifa is requesting a 8800 Somoni loan to purchase foodstuffs for her grocery store. She is hoping to see her business expand and grow consistently. Sharifa has a cheerful personality which is always a positive factor in working with customers. She is willing to work really hard to see her business flourish in the future. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuff to increase the range of goods offered

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther P. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old. Esther is married and has one small child. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Esther is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and snack foods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Esther from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes G., es soltera tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 asisten a la escuela  en nivel primario y 2 al Instituto a nivel Secundario, tiene  un negocio de venta de productos comestibles llamada TIENDA CLARITA la cual inicio hace 3 años cuando perdió su vivienda debido a un huracán que le afecto mucho, sus hijos le ayudan a vender cuando ella realiza la elaboración de productos de belleza  y limpieza  para el hogar, ella recibió clases para la elaboración de los mismos y ha empezado a venderlos dos veces por semana y tiene que salir a lugares lejanos a su casa, ella le da gracias a Dios por que su negocio cada dia crece mas y es por ello que ella solicita a FAPE y Kiva le puedan apoyar con un crédito para comprar productos comestibles y asi seguir trabajando en sus negocios, el sueño mas grande de G. es que sus hijos sean unas personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mercedes G. is single and has 4 children.  Two of her children are in elementary school and two are in high school.

G. has a business selling food products which is called "Tienda Clarita".  She set up her store 3 years ago when she lost her home in a hurricane which affected her greatly.

G.'s children help her to serve in the store when she is busy making beauty products and household cleaning products.  She received classes on making these products and has started selling them twice a week.  To do this she needs to travel to places which are far from her home.

G. thanks God that her business grows every day and and, for this reason, she is asking FAPE and Kiva to support her with a loan so that she can buy food products and thereby continue working in her businesses.  Her biggest dream is for her children to become good people.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad (pictured here) is a young man and university student in Bethlehem. His father is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Muhammad's father can't help Muhammad pay his tuition fees any more due to his insufficient salary. Muhammad thought of starting his own business to enable him to carry on with school and help his father in the near future. He took out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to purchase equipment and start-up items for a small restaurant, which he could open next to the university where he studies. Muhammad's customers will be university students, and hopefully this business will secure him a steady income.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for restaurant

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en:
Ernesta T. is 61 years old and from the village of Sto. Niño, Tampilisan Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two adult children. Ernesta owns and operates a business venture running a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Ernesta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1000 PHP per month.

In 2009, Ernesta joined Kiva partner Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesta has successfully repaid a previous PMPC loan of 5000 PHP. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ernesta is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the third loan Ernesta has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her service-based business

location.town: Liloy-Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lorena Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lorena, Tiene 27 años de edad,  está  casada y de  esta bonita relación procreó 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores  están estudiando en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, trabajan desde la madrugada hasta la tarde, ella vende en su casa ya que tiene un pequeño puesto y su esposo recorre la ciudad de Manta en un triciclo los martes jueves y viernes, ella dice que antes acompañaba a su esposo en sus recorridos pero ahora que sus hijos están en la escuela no puede porque tiene que ayudarlos y cuidarlos, los productos los compran en Portoviejo, porque allá se consiguen más baratos y de mejor calidad.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas, legumbres y verduras. Este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Sus sueños son terminar su casa y poner una tienda.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in the parish of La Sequita, which is part of Montecristi in the prosperous canton of Manabita. The residents are dedicated hardworking people who are proud of their roots. In the parish of La Sequita, the people are honest and know only how to work and take care of their families.

It is here one can find Sra. Lorena. She is 27 years old, married, and her loving relationship resulted in three children (ages 9, 7, and 3). Her two older children are studying in school. Lorena’s husband works as a merchant.

She and her husband have a business selling fruits and legumes. They work from dawn until the afternoon hours. Lorena sells products from a small stand at her house while her husband travels the streets in the city of Manta by tricycle on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays. She says that she accompanies her husband on his trips. However, she is not able when her children are in school because she must help and take care of them. Lorena buys her products in Portoviejo because they are cheaper and of better quality.

She will use this loan to buy fruits, legumes, and vegetables. This is her sixth loan with the Communal Bank and she likes the fact that the interest rates are much lower than other credit institutions. Her dreams include finishing her house and opening a store.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, & legumes

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia Elizabeth S. L. de 34 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su compañero de vida, y dos hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad. Sonia posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias extras lo que le brinda la ayuda necesaria tanto a su esposo como a ella para pagar su casa a tiempo, y así mismo contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Sonia desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos y otros. Esto es muy importante para Sonia ya que cuenta con varios clientes fijos, y otros potenciales, por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en: Sonia Elizabeth S. L. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Soyapango, in the department of San Salvador. She lives together with her life partner and two children, aged 14 and 9. Sonia owns a store in which she sells perishable products and necessities for the home. This business has made it possible for her to receive extra earnings, which provides her and her husband with the necessary funds to make their house payments on time, and also to have food and other things they need to live with dignity. For this reason, Sonia would like to stock her store with more products, and thus she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, and others. This is very important for Sonia, since she has a number of steady customers and others who are potential customers; for this reason, she needs to have everything that is necessary to satisfy her customers and attract others who will prefer to shop at her store.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn N. is married and resides with his wife in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. Nourn is a construction worker earning an income of 4 USD per day. His wife sells brooms, earning 4 USD per day. Each month the family has to spend 60 USD on food and 70 USD on other necessary expenses.

Nourn is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. He would like to purchase a motorbike for their children to commute to work. In the future, Nourn would like to use additional income to repair his house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his children to commute to work

loans.name: Maritza Maximina

texts.es:
Maritza de 24 años de edad, reside en Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad, con quienes vive, son dependientes, ella se dedica a atender su negocio de productos de consumo y también ofrece ropa de forma ambulante, lleva un año y medio de dedicarse a vender, la necesidad de proveer para sus hijos la llevo a buscar un oficio de donde reciba lo necesario para la alimentación y salud de ellos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio, también ropa nueva para comercializar, contribuyendo así a mejorar el inventario y mantenerse en pie con el negocio.
Su objetivo es ir mejorando poco a poco las condiciones actuales de su familia, dando a sus hijos lo más necesario y trabajando fuerte por tener una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Maritza is 24 years old and resides in Lolotiquillo in the Department of Morazán. She is a single mother who lives with her two dependent children, ages 3 and 2. Maritza manages a business selling consumer products, but she also sells clothing as a traveling merchant. She has been selling for a year and a half as a way of providing her children what they need, such as food and health care.

Maritza is currently requesting a loan to buy products for her business as well as new clothing to sell. This will help improve her inventory and maintain her business. Her goals are to improve the conditions for her family, provide her children what they need the most, and work hard to achieve a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store and new clothing to sell.

loans.name: David Muchiri

texts.en:
David has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 21 years.  He is 39 years old, married to Margaret Wangui, and they have five children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fifth loan.  He paid all of his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, David hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel D., age 40, is a fish vendor. Annabel has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. She and husband have two school-aged children and live in  the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 
 
In 2008, Annabel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Annabel has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fish and other seafood products to offer for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Annabel from GDMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish and other seafood products to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosa Natalia

texts.es:
Rosa de 62 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, empezó su trabajo vendiendo mercadería a una edad muy avanzada ya que tenía la necesidad de seguir generando ingresos.  

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa aunque su edad no le es favorable. Ella quiere continuar trabajando desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm de lunes a viernes. Lo más complicado de su negocio es que tiene que salir a comprar en el centro de la ciudad la mercadería para venderla en su casa.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working 62 year-old woman who owns a business selling clothes.  She started selling merchandise later on in life as she needed to continue making income.

Rosa has a lot of aspirations for her business.  For this reason, she would like to continue in her business selling clothes, even though her age is not in her favor.  She would like to continue working from 8.00am to 10.00pm, from Monday to Friday.  The most difficult part of her business is that she has to go out to the city center to buy the merchandise that she sells in her home.  She has a lot of aspirations for her business and so would like to use her loan to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, es madre de familia, vive con dos hijos, es comerciante  desde hace 30 años, se dedica a la venta de  frutas, verduras y queso, tiene muchos años de estar en el negocio, lo aprendió por su familia la cual es comerciante.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de verduras: zanahorias, papas, tomates, chiles, también fresas, uvas, bananos y naranjas, para fortalecer el negocio, esta idea es para ofrecer a los clientes una diversidad de frutos frescos, mejorando la condición del negocio.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, aumentar el comercio, con la esperanza de crecer cada día y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a mother and lives with her two children. She has been a merchant for 30 years and works sells fruit, vegetables and cheese. She has been in this business for a long time and learned the trade from her family, who are merchants.

She needs a loan for the purchase of vegetables like carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, and hot peppers, as well as fruits like strawberries, grapes, bananas and oranges in order to strengthen her business. The idea is to have a variety of fresh fruits to sell in order to improve the business.

Her dream is to strengthen her business and expand sales with the hope of growing on a daily basis and thus improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, hot peppers, strawberries, grapes and bananas.

loans.name: Khalila

texts.ru:
Халила родилась в селе Мургаб (Республика Таджикистан). 
Замужем  и является матерью пятерых детей - три дочери и два сына, младший из которых проживает вместе с Халилой и помогает по хозяйству. 
Халила родилась в многодетной простой (7 детей) семье инженера. Она была средней дочерью и большую часть времени посвящала домашним хлопотам. Старшие сестры рано вышли замуж, и ей пришлось присматривать за младшими сестрами и братьями. По окончании школы Халила поступила в Кооперативный техникум по специальности бухгалтер, где познакомилась со своим будущим мужем и в возрасте 19 лет вышла замуж. Вначале они проживали в общежитии, так как муж Халилы тоже из многодетной семьи и своего дома молодожены не приобрели. Два года спустя у них рождается первенец. Халила устроилась на работу в местную  организацию Райпотребобщество и проработала там 12 лет. Год спустя она рожает еще одну дочь. А в 1986 году и 1987 году у семьи Турдуевых появляются на свет еще две девочки. В 1993 году в связи с экономическими трудностями в семье они пререзжают в село Панфиловка (Чуйская область). Два года прожив в с. Панфиловка она рожает еще одного сына.   Халила с мужем устраиваются в местном колхозе на работу  и получают участок земли под жилой дом, который они постепенно достроили. С распадом колхоза, они стали заниматься земледелием на арендованной земле. В 1999 году Халила с мужем устраиваются в ДЭП-42, она в качестве ведущего специалиста, а он в качестве водителя. В 2010 году они покупают дом в селе Вознесеновка (Чуйская область).
Со временем, три дочери вышли замуж и отделились от родителей. Для этого Халиле пришлось продать часть скота. В данное время Халила с мужем по-прежнему работают в ДЭП – 42, разводят скот и занимаются земледелием на арендованной земле. 
Сейчас в хозяйстве Халилы имеется одна корова и телочка. Для увеличения поголовья скота, Халила обратилась в компанию Бай-Тушум и Партнеры за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). 
Прибыль от кредита она планирует потратить на оплату контракта на обучение сына и дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.  
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Khalila was born in the village of Murgab (Republic of Tajikistan). She is married and the mother of five children: three daughters and two sons, the youngest of whom lives together with Khalila and helps her with her work.

Khalila was born in an ordinary engineer’s family with seven children. She was a middle child and spent a lot of time on household tasks. Her older sisters got married early, and she needed to take care of her younger sisters and brothers. After finishing high school, Khalila was admitted to a degree program in accounting at junior college, which is where she met her future husband. She got married at the age of 19. The spouses first lived in communal housing since Khalila’s husband also comes from a large family, and the newlyweds did not have a home of their own. Two years later their first child was born. Khalila found a job with the local produce distribution society, where she would remain working  for 12 years. A year later she gave birth to her second child, a daughter. In 1986 and 1987, two more daughters came into the world. In 1993, due to economic difficulties,  the family moved to the village of Panfilovka (the district of Chuisk).  Two years into their life in Panfilovka, Khalla gave birth to another son. Khalila and her husband found work at the local collective farm and were allotted a land plot, on which they eventually had a house built. When the collective farm ceased functioning, they started working as farmers on leased land. In 1999, Khalila and her husband found jobs with the Roadway Management Office  #42: she is a senior specialist, and he as a driver. In 2010, they bought a house in the village of Voznesenovka (the district of Chuisk).

With time, their three daughters got married and settled independently. Because this, Khalila had to buy part of her cattel. At present, Khalila and her husband still work for Roadway Management Office  #42 and also raise cattle and grow crops on the land they lease. At present Khalila has one cow and one heifer. In order to obtain more cattle, Khalila approached Bai Tushum and Partners with a request of a loan of 50,000 KGS.
She plans to use the resulting income to cover the costs of her son’s education and to expand her business further.

The microfinance institution Bai Tushum & Partners offers loans to socially vulnerable populations through Kiva. Bai Tushum & Partners ia a leading microfainance organization in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which contributes to the economic growth of the Republic ofKyrgyzstan by providing affordable microfinance services in rural areas as well as in cities, thus helping  create jobs and serving the interests of its clients of investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Shrijana

texts.en:
Shrijana is 26 years old. She is married and has one child, age 2. In 2006, she established her business raising cows. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase a cow.  

In the future, Shrijana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en: Huong sells cooked food like sausages, rolls and roast duck in the market. She is married with two children. Huong was born in 1984. She lives in Tuan L. village, Tien D. commune. Her husband is a carpenter. She has had her business for three years. Her monthly income is about 3,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). This is the first time she is taking part in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy ducks. She is the leader of this six member group loan from SEDA. About other members in her group: Hoan is 33 years old. He has two children. He would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to grow vegetables. Phuc is 35 years old. He has three children. He would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to breed pigs. Ngan is 32 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy a tree. Ly is 35 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to grow vegetables. Hue is 28 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ducks.

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 51 years old, married, and has one child. 

Sattar has owned a laundry since 2000. He has a lot of experience and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting $1900 to buy two washing machines for his shop. He aims to make more money to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy two washing machines for his shop.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and one daughter. Mayson's husband works as a construction worker. Mayson and her husband have a poultry farm where they raise laying hens and broilers and sell the produce to shops in Jenin city where they live. 

Mayson wants to increase the family income as her children are growing up and their educational and life expenses are growing as well. Therefore, she thought of increasing the number of hens of both types on the farm and increasing the produce. Therefore, she took out a $3,000 loan from FATEN. 

Mayson and her husband are photographed at the poultry project.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 26 years old.  He is married to Beatrice, who is a farmer.  They are blessed with one child, aged eight months.  Benson has been operating a motor cycle transport for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Benson will use the loan to buy another motorbike, which will increase his income. 

With the anticipated profit form the business, he will service his motorbike.  His hopes and dreams are to buy a commercial taxi which will provide for his child’s education.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Wendy María

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua la  señora Wendy  laborar en una empresa de esta ciudad. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día  es deudas que la señora no ha podido solventar debido a esa situación la señora tomo la decisión de  solicitar un crédito a ceprodel  para la cancelación de estas deudas Es importante destacar que por  medio de este crédito  la señora va honrar las deudas y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad de se le brindo al haberle dado el financiamiento que solicito
texts.en:
Sra. Wendy works for a company in the city of Managua. One of her needs at the moment is to resolve her debt, but she does not have the capacity to do this. She made the decision to request a loan from CEPRODEL in order to pay off these debts.

It is important to note that with this loan, Sra. Wendy will be able to cancel her debts. She is grateful to CEPRODEL for giving her the opportunity to receive this loan.

loans.use: to pay off personal debts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 51 years old and a single mother of four.  

She runs a cafeteria so as to raise her children. She has operated the business for over ten years and has employed five people.  

She also owns rental houses that earn her extra income.  

Previously, she used to sells clothes.

Jane hopes to expand her business in the future and get enough income to build an apartment. She has requested 100,000 KES to buy ingredients such as maize flour, beans and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour, beans and cooking fat.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 39-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in the school. She is married to a construction worker. She sells fish in Dar es Salam branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. She also earns some income from selling beans and onions.
Agnes requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. The extra income will be used to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en:
Yucabeth is married to Innocent; they have four children together. She sells GNLD products for health and cleaning, and she has been in the business for the past seven years. She gets a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan from KADET. She will use the amount to buy more cleaning products for resale. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to contribute to the family budget. Her hope is to have a stable business with a steady income.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products.

loans.name: Cornelia Emelda

texts.es:
La Sra. Cornelia es soltera, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Tiene hijos, los cuales son todos ya mayores de edad. Posee una despensa la cual explota hace ya un buen tiempo, está bien surtida, lo cual atrae a clientes de todos lados.
Comenta que le va muy bien, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir trabajando en su despensa. Ella se considera como una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y por sobre todo muy sacrificada.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, panificados y demás artículos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más lleno su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por esta oportunidad y también a Kiva.
texts.en:
Cornelia is single living in the city of San Lorenzo.  She has children who are all adults now.  She has a grocery store that she’s been operating for quite some time now.  It is well-stocked which attracts customers from all over.

She comments that she does well and would like to continue working in her store.  She considers herself to be a hardworking, tenacious but, above all, a self-sacrificing woman.

She requests the loan to buy foodstuffs, beverages, baked goods and other items to stock up and have the store fuller.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva also for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 30 years old, a married woman with seven children. Five of them are in school. She has had a business selling bananas and avocados in Yei, South Sudan for six years.

Salome requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bananas and avocados. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and avacados for sale.

loans.name: Julia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miraflor es uno de los municipios mas turísticos del departamento de Estelí, debido a sus tierras fértiles, la riqueza de la flora y fauna que posee, sus habitantes y comunidades aledañas dedicadas alas diferentes actividades propias del campo, justo ahí en la comunidad llamada el Terrero es donde habita Julia, una joven de 27 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 11 y 10 años de edad respectivamente, casada, con apenas 5 año de primaria aprobado, se dedica a la agricultura , siembra hortalizas y vegetales . 
Cuando inicio con esta actividad fue mediante un préstamo pues el capital que tenia no era suficiente, tenia 17 años de edad, comenzó sembrando cebolla y tomate, después aprendió a criar cerdos para vender. Con EL tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia ahora también siembra papas y la vende en la ciudad de Estelí junto con su esposo trabajan en conjunto para sembrar y vender los cultivos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semilla , insumos para siembra de papas y comprar cerdos para criar. Ya que con la inversión podrá solventar parte de las necesidades para siembra de la cual no dispone y sacar una muy buena cosecha de papas. Ella die que uno de sus objetivos es dejarle a sus hijos una casa donde vivan honradamente y no tengan que andar rodando de un lugar a otro como les toco vivir a ella , darles estudios para que sea alguien en la vida . En sus planes futuros quiere mejorar el lugar donde esta criando a los cerdos para tenerlo en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Miraflor is one of the municipalities of the department of Estelí most visited by tourists because of its fertile land, its rich flora and fauna, and its inhabitants and communities engaged in a variety of farming activities. 

Julia lives there, in the community of Terrero. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children aged 11 and 10. She completed grade 5 of primary school. She now earns her living by growing vegetables.

She started this job at the age of 17 with a loan as she didn’t have enough capital. She grew onions and tomatoes. Then she learned how to raise pigs and sell them. As time passed she got more experience, and now grows and sells potatoes too in the town of Estelí. She works alongside her husband growing and selling the produce. 

Now Julia needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies for the potatoes, and also to buy pigs to raise. With the money she will be able to afford some of these necessities that she lacks and will be able to get a good crop of potatoes.

Julia says that one of her objectives is to provide her children with a house where they can live with dignity so they don’t have to move around from one place to another. She also wants them to be educated so they are someone when they grow up. Her future plans also include the wish to improve the pen where the pigs live so that they have better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies for potatoes, and also to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 6 children. 

Helen has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy electronic loads for sale.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 49-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She sells fresh and dried fish to her community. Nilda earns 4,000 PHP a month from her business. Nilda works hard to support her family.

Nilda is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. Nilda hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes that her children will finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 38 years old and married. He is a very responsible man who has supervised his farm for 20 years. He generally earns P7,000 for every cropping. He is requesting a loan of P20,000 to purchase corn seed and fertilizer for her farm. Geraldine hopes that he can give the needs of his family in able to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Sol Radiante De Huaycan Group

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Sol Radiante de Huaycan” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Gloria  trabaja desde hace 10 años en la venta de prendas de vestir en su domicilio este negocio surge a raiz de que sus hijos comenzaron a ir al colegio y gloria veia que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir las necesidades basicas del hogar y de sus hijos, es asi que consiguio un capital y empezo a vender polos, short, con el tiempo cuenta con clientes fidelizados y su negocio ha crecido gloria  nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran sus hijos y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos,sus hijos cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería polos, pantalones, short, blusas, vestidos. Sabemos que Gloria  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Gloria has a common-law husband and 2 school age children. Currently she is a member of the communal bank Radiant Sun of Huaycan group formed by 10 members who work in different areas. 

Gloria has worked for 10 years selling clothing in her home. This business came about because her children began to go to school and Gloria saw that her husband’s salary was not enough to cover the expenses for the household and the children. She was able to get some polo shirts and shorts to sell and over time she has built a loyal client base and the business has grown.

Gloria tells us that everything she has was achieved through hard work and perseverance and that her motivation were her children and her desire to overcome was bigger than her problems. Thanks to her struggle and attention she has obtained higher earnings, her children have a better quality of life, and she continues growing.

She is asking for a new loan in order to buy merchandise including polo shirts, pants, shorts, blouses, and dresses. We know that Gloria will meet her goals with a lot of work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 41 years old and married. She has three children aged thirteen, fifteen and eighteen.

For the past five years Ann has sold electronics such as televisions and mobile phones in order to earn a living. She also has two employees. She describes her business environment as busy due to the existence of many other similar businesses.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya Ann has been able to save her income. She has applied for a 100,000 KES loan to buy more televisions and mobile phones to sell.

She hopes to open a big electronics shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more televisions and mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 47 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 
Nila has a dried fish business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. 
She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more kind of dried fish for her business. 
Nila has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more kind of dried fish for her business

loans.name: Djekafo Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe DJEKAFO III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zanfina, un des villages de la commune de Konobougou,  préfecture de Barouéli, région de Ségou, 4ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, BIBA première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assis, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a business woman who runs a saloon. She also earns additional income from coffee farming. She is a thirty year old single woman with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  Annet also has a task of taking care of one dependent who attends school. With the profit from coffee farming she hopes to have enough income to give her school going children quality education and improved standards of living. A loan would help her to improve her family's quality of life. Her businesses are doing great, however they would be more attractive if she was not limited by capital and had no thieves.

Annet is requesting for a loan to buy cosmetics for using in her saloon for the festive season.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for using in her saloon for the festive season.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson Hernandez is a 41-year-old native of Guayaquil who is married and has 3 children. He owns his home and rents a location for his business where he sells, repairs and refurbishes furniture. He sells all types of items, including popular outdoor pieces made with wood perfect for beach conditions. His business is located near his home in a popular business sector. He opens from 8:30 AM to 6:30 PM and counts on the help of one employee and his oldest daughter. He is in need of $575 dollars in order to buy materials (such as wood and paint) necessary for the production and refurbishment of new items.

loans.use: Furniture sales and repairs

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en: Fenumiai is one of many mothers who have improved her standard of living since joining SPBD. She joined in 2002 and started her business with a loan of  750 tala ($300US) and before joining the husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Today Fenumiai has also cause to be a part of putting food on the table for her family. Through her grocery store she has been able to contribute widely to the development of the family. When Fenumiai first started her business she operated from in her home and after applying for a second loan she was able to move her business to the road front catering to more people. Her next loan will be used to buy timber and cement to improve the state of her store and house.

loans.use: Purchase of timber and cement to improve both the store and house.
